name: WalletHub
review: PNC Personal Loan ReviewPNC personal loans have low APRs, ranging from 9.24% to 19.44%, based on applicants’ creditworthiness. While you might be able to find a lower minimum rate from other lenders, PNC’s maximum is one of the lowest around. That means even people who just barely qualify for a loan will still get a good rate. Plus, PNC further minimizes costs because they don’t charge an origination fee. PNC offers up to $20,000 in funding, with up to 60 months to pay the loan off.There are a few drawbacks to PNC personal loans, such as the fact that rates vary heavily by ZIP code. PNC isn’t as transparent as they could be about approval requirements, either. However, the benefits definitely outweigh the shortcomings. PNC Personal Loan Review Highlights: •	PNC personal loan rates: 9.24% to 19.44%•	Processing timeline: 1 to 2 business days•	PNC personal loan requirements: 18+ years old; SSN, ITIN or passport •	Loan amounts: $1,000 to $20,000 •	Payoff periods: 6 to 60 months•	Origination fee: $0•	Late fee: Varies•	Customer satisfaction: PNC holds an A+ rating from the Better Business Bureau and a 3.6/5 user score.Overall, PNC offers personal loans with very attractive rates, though it’s a bit difficult to get some information on those loans. Fortunately, you can pre-qualify for a PNC personal loan online without hurting your credit. You can also try out WalletHub’s pre-qualification tool to check your status with other lenders.Below, you can see how WalletHub rates PNC in three key categories: Terms, Requirements & Application, and Reviews & Transparency.  PNC Ratings by Category:Terms: 5 / 5Requirements & Application: 4.5 / 5Reviews & Transparency: 3.3 / 5Overall Score: 4.6 / 5

name: Gabriel Liberman
review: This company simply provides the worst customer service of any company I have ever interacted with. As well, they charge very high fees, such as $37 per statement if you would like a simple copy of any statement older than 36 months and $22-$27 for statements between 12 and 36 months old. All other credit card companies offer free copies of statements from almost any time period. The poor reviews I've read here are accurate. While they do offer credit cards at competitive rates, the customer service agents are rude, vague, uncaring and incompetent; they offer inaccurate information which changes from agent to agent. I've also been told a "manager" would call me back to resolve my issue at least 5 times, as the manager is in a "meeting" and can't speak with me at the moment. I have not once received a phone call from any "manager." In addition, there seems to be no complaints department, as I was once transferred there, only to find myself at a strange computerized menu which was meaningless. Another time when I was "transferred," I was out on hold for 45 minutes before hanging up. In sum, this company offers barebones service for a competitively rated card. Their service department is pathetic, and if you do have an issue, it will NEVER be resolved. I would advise to go with a different card - stay away from this one. It really is not worth it.

review: This is, by far, the worst bank I have ever dealt with (and I have dealt with a lot of banks so this says a lot). No such delinquencies exist so this is a false excuse and I will dispute it because I do not want to have any closed accounts but I wish I had never started doing business with this fraudulent bank.  I have been a customer since 1999 and they have done this a number of times (I guess they make money from opening new accounts).  Stay away from this fraudulent business.

review: I am on Social Security and I was notified by SS that someone opened an account in my name at this bank and deposited (and withdrew) $5,000. This put me over the limit to receive benefits. However, this is not soon enough for Social Security as they will start to deduct $95 per month until BBVA provides proof this is not my account.

An unauthorized transaction went through and caused two authorized transactions to bounce. I’ve been charged fees when I could not access my account and alert the Bank of the fraudulent activity. I will be moving my account as fast as I can.

name: Blah Deblah
review: I've banked with two other major national banks in the USA. Both were decent and easy to understand, I just needed a simple checking account to hold my money, has direct deposit, a mobile app and use it for basic things like purchases. Nothing fancy, nothing advanced or complicated. PNC has the least user friendly interface. The app is garbage. The balance amount doesn't take into consideration all of your pending transactions, it is incorrect most of the time. You might have some pending transactions that will disappear for a few days, only to pop back up and take a chunk of your money depending on how much you spent. It has SERIOUS potential to overdraft your account. I've NEVER, ever in the history of having a bank account overdrafted. Not even ONE time, until I had to switch to PNC (because the other 2 banks are not available in my area.) Virtual wallet is confusing and fails as a simple checking account. You cannot even change your ATM PIN # number over the phone, like I could with the 2 other banks I had. You have to go to a PNC bank in order for them to help you out. How inconvenient is that??? name: Jim Drottar
review: DO NOT BANK WITH PNC! This bank will not have your back for any ATM disputes! I attempted a withdrawal at any authorized third-party ATM at the Bellagio Casino and the machine malfunctioned prior to dispersing the funds. A casino supervisor was able to pull the information from the machine and stated that the funds were indeed NOT withdrawn from my account and there would not be any issue with my checking account. Well, of course, PNC withdrew the funds from my account, and I had to file a dispute. I just received a letter stating that they would not refund the money to my account. I immediately picked up the phone and their dispute department told me that because the ATM company stated their books balanced that day, they are taking THEIR WORD for it and not mine. So, long story short, I am apparently lying to them about not receiving the money and they will do nothing else to assist me other than taking the word from a third-party ATM company. I even asked why they couldn't request that they pull one of the camera recordings to prove it and they refused to do anything than take the word of THE OTHER COMPANY AND NOT THEIR CUSTOMER!  So I am left without my $$ and a banking account with a incompetent company that has no desire to resolve my dispute. PLEASE DO NOT LET THIS HAPPEN TO YOU! STAY AWAY FROM PNC BEFORE THEY RUIN YOUR VACATION AND YOUR DAY!

Then he said he could transfer me and i was transferred to a recording which i believe was in chinese and translated to english saying the card was blocked and then disconnected the call. I called the fraud alert number and gave up on that after waiting on hold for 40 minutes. I was also able on one call to hear the bbva hours for the christmas holiday 2020. this bank does not seem to have its act together at all and i now regret wasting an inquiry on my credit report for an account i now want to close.

review: PNC literally closes at 5 pm Monday thru Friday, and if you have any problems beyond those hours, forget it. You cannot get any help until the next time they open. PNC will actually charge you a fee to release the money that you deposited. PNC has absolutely HORRIBLE customer service. Basically, PNC is just an inferior bank. I learned my lesson, and I'm going back to Chase. Don't even bother with PNC. They SUCK!!!

review: I was coming out of a bad financial situation. And I was reestablishing credit. They gave me a chance when no one else would. Thank you for that!!

name: Willow O'tree
review: I have had a long, good relationship with PNC. Paying my credit card balance off within days of posting. They recently reported to the credit bureaus that I had a balance; which I already paid off and took a point from me. Trying to dispute this I was given the runaround and was told to write a letter. I did. PNC did not have the decency to write back, instead, took ANOTHER 24 points off my credit report with no real explanation! Now, they refuse to answer or return my calls, or inquiries. Fine, tomorrow I will be moving ALL my money somewhere else. I was a good customer, and they did what they did because they can. My advice if you have their card, get out or suck it up, don't challenge them even if your right, they will ruin you. Unfortunately, closing the account will steal 2 more points!?

review: Huh?  PNC doesn't take points off your score -- they merely report your payment history, current balance and available credit, which impacts your score.  It's normal for your score to fluctuate a few points every month.  But a '24 point drop with no explanation' - ridiculous.  Unless you made your payment 30+ days late - and this will clearly be in the report - your score dropped due to some other reason, that likely wasn't related to your PNC card.

review: Imagine a PNC commercial loan officer walking into your office offering $100K "undocumented" loan and another $150K against a property. Sound like a personal loan? This deceptive, fraudulent loan officer came in offering something he had NO business doing since he represents commercial loans, and that was verified by his boss. Timing was critical and I needed a personal bridge loan because my company was not in a position to secure a business loan. So, this deceptive "commercial" loan officer pulled all the paperwork from the company-not personal, all to satisfy a sales quota. With all other financial institutions, I can do this online, but this particular bank forces me to call customer support, and after 3 times calling they finally were able to update my Phone Number. A few days later I planned to set up "Auto Pay" for all my future online payments to my surprise I was forced to talk to customer reps. again.  After talking to different people over the phone they informed me that they need to send me a paper document for me to fill out and return to them for such a request. So in nutshell, this bank is way behind in IT, Web design functionality, and helpful customer service. If you read what I had to say I recommend you choose another financial institution for your needs and stay away from BBVA.

In 10 years of dealing with other banks, I never had this issue.  I am quite experienced with computers and technology, but the problem is the bank's policies.  They either have no way of recognizing my computer--it is the same one every time--or else their software is flawed.  Either way, I have to go through an arduous process just to give them the money I owe them each month.  Perhaps it would be best to just default on my mortgage and maybe they would come to me.  One would think that a man who pays all his bills on time for years on end would be given a system whereby he could continue to do so seamlessly.

review: Our mortgage was, unfortunately, transferred to PNC Bank. They said to send them a letter once it showed up on my credit report and they would remove it, then they refused. I have filed an ADA complaint and will be moving my mortgage elsewhere as soon as I am able.

review: I had my PNC Credit Card on Autopay just in case I became ill during the pandemic.  For some reason the Autopay stopped in January 2021 and I did not realize the payment was not auto paid until after it hit my credit report.  I had plenty of emails from PNC advertising products to me.  None of the emails mentioned my payment had not been made.  I also sent a goodwill letter and they refused to remove the negative report from my credit report.  Now, my other creditors are reducing my credit limit because I am now considered one who does not pay on time.  I had never been late on a PNC payment before and had no late payments since 2012 when I paid two payments to another similar bank (Bank of America).  Because I used my ATM card (which had a limit) the payment was declined and I did not realize it until it hit my credit report.  I also want to file a credit reporting dispute since I was already enrolled in autopay and the bank just did not process the auto pay.  My credit score tanked about 72 points when this happened.

review: Very terrible bank! Over the weekends nothing posts to the account but none the less it takes 5-7 days for one transaction to clear on your account. review: From November until now getting the run around despite providing everything they requested!These two ladies are so inept in handling this refinance professionally!Stalling at every turn every week with something they forgot to ask for. review: They suck you put money in  and can never take it out they had my money for a year but they can take money out anytime  they  want  I will never do business  with them anymore

review: Exceptionally bad and unprofessional customer service. Always paid my balance in full, never missed a payment, except one single time when the statement was lost in the mail due to COVID. I was willing to pay the balance right then, was promised the late fee would be reversed, which never has happened. The representatives were rude and seemed incompetent. Bad experience overall. There are plenty of other decent credit card companies with similar or better rewards programs, no need to be subjected to this.

name: jbeard1858
review: When it comes to customer service, If I could give them a ZERO, I would. Each time I have called, the wait time is totally unacceptable. Especially the fraud department. They will block your card for suspicious activity. (Which is for my protection, and appreciated). The problem is, if I'm out shopping or trying to make an online purchase, I am left stranded unable to transact business due to extraordinary wait times for customer service. God forbids, and certainly worth noting, if there is a situation that is complicated for the service representative, they simply hang up the phone. Can you believe it! They hang up the dang phone! This has happened to me on three different occasions. I was left in utter disbelief! After 4 years, I am closing both accounts. BYE FELICIA!!

name: Michael Dara
review: I have a PNC Business checking account. I tried to transfer funds to my personal checking account to another . It takes 5-7 business days to transfer by the bank and also the limit is only 5000. I regret for choosing the PNC bank. I advise to go with bigger banks such as Chase or Bank Of America where the intra bank transfers are much faster with higher limits.

name: Jessica Graham
review: I lost my job due to Covid... so I have been receiving a portion of what I use to make through unemployment. Trump let the bill that would continue paying wages lapse, so I haven't been paid in over a month, meaning my bills are not getting paid.. After a $5 reoccurring bill went through, I woke up to $80 in negative fees. I explained the situation to PNC and they refuse to help.. in the middle of a Pandemic-- I should mention customer service told me we were no longer in a pandemic!! Absolutely disgusted by this bank's refusal to work with the people who are going through such a difficult time this last year. I normally don't make a fuss if I get a fee here and there, but right now is the hardest time I've faced since the pandemic started and PNC has done nothing to help out its long-standing customers. I will be moving my account elsewhere.

name: Kerry
review: PNC has Great service most of the time when you call and they fix issues fast. Definitely recommend the app is easy to use as well

name: Kathleen
review: It’s ok. Interest a bit high. Could do better interest wise. Have been a loyal customer 25 years . You would think that would account for something

review: Good everyday card with generous credit limit. A bit difficult to use without PNC account already established. Pay on desktop only

name: eadkins019
review: I have the PNC SmartAccess card! I love it so much! 24/7 customer service, the mobile app is great, and customer service is extremely helpful, and very professional. (I have a personal account with Wells Fargo, I love, love them) I wanted a 2nd option when it came too my banking, and money. So, I was on PNC and came across the SmartAccess. I read about it and said; this is a great option for me. I have never thought I would love a prepaid card until I met the SmartAccess, it is a great option. It's a prepaid Visa, and it's just like a regular debit card except you can't overdraft, and it's not linked to a checking account. For a prepaid card, the SmartAccess is very modern, and I love how I have access 24/7 on the mobile app is well, the app is great and works well to no issues that I have encountered. I actually recommend the card. Like I said; I have a checking account so, I love this option and every time I walk into PNC to upload money it's FREE! And FREE to withdraw from any PNC ATM or Branch, however, I do not like the fee for none- PNC ATMs or to add money at a none-PNC Branch. It is a great card!.

name: Stanley
review: The payment system is down which once caused a late payments. However, they refunded it. I’ve never missed a payment and it was still frustrating.

name: Ashley
review: BBVA had been great to work with! They offered me a very low interest rate and the app is easy to use. I’ve never had any problems with them and I will do business with them again.

name: briannaroseh1
review: When I first got PNC bank, I loved them. I loved that they cared that I was a student and that their customer service was usually helpful. A few of my loved ones even started banking there because I referred them.  I no longer feel safe depositing my money for school or work into this account. Here’s why:Without a job for some time, I have not made much use of my PNC bank account. Yesterday morning I went to deposit my tuition check and I realized that 19 overdraft fees (almost $700 worth) were  taken from my account. I spent a good portion of my day trying to work something out with them. The opt in & opt out option is very confusing to me and doesn’t make much sense since you can still accidentally over draft either way. I did not purposefully overdraft my bank account. PNC bank feels entitled to these fees, especially during a time such as this one. Where is PNC’s empathy for the customer? I am currently in the process of fighting to keep my life going until I can get back on my feet. Luckily I finally landed a new job and I will be taking my paychecks and tuition funds elsewhere. I will say that regardless of time spent over the phone and the situation at hand -I spoke to 5 out of 6 outstanding individuals yesterday. Aimee was very condescending and mean. I did not appreciate her attitude towards me from the moment she got on the phone. The other five people I spoke with were very supportive and helpful (as much as they could be). They deserve kudos for sure.

review: Loaded 1750 dollars into the account and said services denied because I come to find out that’s too much to load into the account at once for whatever reason, I don’t know. Then doesn’t give me my money back bank says there is nothing they can do to call customer service, so I did, after being transferred couple times I had to file a dispute and get told it will be 1 to 23 days before you can get out there to audit the ATM. Are you serious, I just want my money back so now by the 29 my 7-year-old daughter, wife and I will have been evicted because the ATM did not credit my money but still took it. name: merrycreager
review: The couple of times I've contacted their 800 customer service, the experience was awful.  I have several complaints about BBVA.  Today's complaint, is where are our stimulus checks/money?  When I called customer service, I couldn't get anyone.  They are having difficulties and please call back later.  That isn't helpful at all.  A few months back I had a charge on my account that was fraudulent and they didn't remove the charge from my account.  Oh no!  They left it on there while they investigated it, up to 90 days!  Just crazy.  And then every time there is a deposit made over the weekend, it is NEVER deposited in the account until the following Monday, unless it is cash.  Now, mind you our employees send the money to them on Friday.  They have it on Friday, but the deposit is dated for Monday, so they hold the money in their accounts collecting interest on our money until they finally acknowledge it on the following Monday.  This is not good customer service.  As of tomorrow, I am beginning to look for a new bank.  Bye bye BBVA!

review: HORRIBLE  customer service! I have never had such poor service from a bank like with BBVA. Its so frustrating to be treated with such disregard. I applied for assistance due to covid, and almost 14 days later, over 20 calls that I was misrouted or hung up on and an agent not submitting my request correctly, still no resolution.. no help at all .

review: I recently went through a mortgage process with PNC and I have to say it was the worst experience ever. On average, I had to send 2-3 follow up emails to even get a response. The loan processor quit a week before our scheduled close and no handoff was done with our file so no one knew what was going on. In summary, customer service was non-existent, employees were not properly trained and lacked knowledge and professionalism, communication was terrible and very much lacking. I experienced everything you don’t want to deal with when closing on a house. I was offered similar competitive rates by Chase and so in the future, I will never bank with PNC again and highly advise other consumers not to do so. PNC management - I implore you to look into improving your internal processes and better training for your employees.

This letter must be received by them within 7 days of the maturity date, otherwise your CD will automatically renew.  There is no way to do this electronically, which is ridiculous in this day & age.  Had I known this, I would have never done business with this bank.  I hope this review helps you to avoid the same mistake.Other issues: Your interest will not accrue monthly so withdrawing before maturity means absolutely no interest will be paid (they will of course penalize you if you withdraw too early).  They don't state this upfront so it was quite a shock to me when the first month went by and my balance didn't increase.When you send electronic messages via their Secure Message Center, don't expect a reply if your message is asking how to close an account. name: katesimmer
review: PNC closed my account and reported it as delinquent to a credit bureau WITHOUT EVEN GIVING ME A CALL over a transaction that I warned them in advance was going to happen. My credit score plunged by 93 points in one day.Full story: a few months ago, I missed a payment. I always pay my bills right after I receive them in the mail, but this one must have been lost. I received the following month's bill and saw that there was a missed payment and a late fee. I called them immediately and over the phone, paid the balance in full (as I always do), from my checking account. Another month or so later, I'm reviewing my accounts and see a withdrawal from my health savings account from PNC. Confused, I call my bank and they tell me it was submitted over the phone. I finally realize that somehow, someone made an error and withdrew the money from my health savings account to pay the past due amount from the previous statement. While it’s possible it was my error, I have my regular checking account number memorized so it is highly unlikely it was me. But anyway.I contact my bank and they instruct me on how to dispute the transaction, since I’m trying to avoid the penalties associated with using my HSA for non health expenses. They tell me to contact PNC, which I do. I inform the PNC rep that the money was taken from the wrong account. I try to make another payment from the correct checking account for the amount. I am unable to do so because PNC doesn’t allow payments for higher than the current balance on the account. The rep tells me she is making a note on the account, and to contact them when the money is taken back.Because of Covid 19 there is some delay in processing this because I have to sign papers for my bank and send them back through the mail. So another few weeks passes. Finally, I see that the money has been redistributed to my HSA. I admit I didn’t call PNC immediately. I just assumed that the amount would be added onto my next bill, or that they would give me a call if they needed it before then. I am, after all, only a phone call away. Just to be safe, I am planning to call them in a few days just to make sure and see if they want a payment.So today I get a notice from a credit monitoring service I use that there has been a settlement for less than the debt from, you guessed it, PNC. I call them immediately and find out that they have reassessed a late fee, and processed the payment as delinquent from January when I originally was late, therefore making my account two months past due. They have taken away all my rewards, closed my account, and reported me to Experian. I just don’t understand how a company that wants my business could treat me this way. I am of course disputing the severe ding to my credit, and have paid my total balance in full as of today, which I would have done immediately if they had ever bothered to call and ask before taking such drastic measures. I very much hope they decide to withdraw the settlement from my credit report, and the missed payment, as I've worked very hard for literally years to get my credit score into the "excellent" range and now it's back down to "good" in ONE DAY. I honestly wonder if they were looking for a reason to close my account as I pay my balance in full every month and accrue rewards. Regardless, BUYER BEWARE, they treat you like an enemy and not a valued customer.

review: If I could give fewer stars, I would. PNC Bank NA will swindle as much money as possible from their customers. Their idea of customer service is a string of insincere apologies. In an age of instant communication they use the most antiquated forms of communication possible. Forms are not available online, nor can they be emailed. Anything to benefit the customer has to be done via snail mail, so it can be misapplied when posted. The only payments accepted online are monthly payments. I called to find out how to make additional principle payments and was told "You will have to mail in a check with apply to principle written on the memo line.". I did this and every time it is applied as a 2nd monthly payment and large portions credited to interest on the loan and not the principle.I called to have PMI dropped from my loan when it reached 67% of the appraised value. On the phone I was told "No problem, we will get that taken care of." but a month later when saw the payment still coming out of my account and called, and was told "A letter was mailed with a form and you will have to pay for an appraisal." I contacted them via phone, if what I was told was not correct, I feel a phone call is in order, not a letter! Additionally, I never received the alleged letter nor the form. Now I will be waiting for another form, because I can't request the appraisal online, and more money will dissipate as I wait for them to get their story straight, mail me the required form and arrange an appraisal. All I can say is, if you are doing business with PNC Bank NA, you better be watching your accounts like a hawk!!!

review: I am struggling to restrict my review to socially acceptable language.  I started a business account with them and applied for a credit card. Surprising-after only 6 months!!  Forget the expensive overdraft fees for silly reasons (they hold a large transaction for almost 3 days before releasing it-good luck if you get a bill in those 3 days for which you have to utilize more than the immediately available funds). Finally the coup de etat - I get a notice from a debt collector's agency for almost $5000 from a business credit card that my business did not apply for nor have.  Despite 12 calls to recovery, fraud department and the credit card department, I am still unable to get any single human being to tell me the details of these transactions nor find out how I can file for fraud.I am a physician with good credit rating and a long banking history with another National Bank as well as with my favorite credit union.  Never had a single default nor any issues with my prior Banks or credit union.Dear BBVA - I hope you are reading this because I will be leaving your Bank shortly as soon as I get my administrative paperwork in order to migrate to another bank.  If you are a potential BBVA customer - I would urge you to reconsider - the deal may be attractive but their customer service is extremely poor and forget about contacting any helpline over the phone unless you are prepared to wait for hours and attempt multiple times to contact them.

name: fkinzie
review: STAY AWAY!!  I deal with a lot of banks and BBVA is at the very bottom.  They get your money with a teaser rate and within a few weeks the rate drops to something like 2/3 of market rate.  Their electronic banking is the worst.  Difficult to link accounts and once you link them, low limits on transfer amounts.  When you try to take money out, there is a $5000/day and $10000/month limit and also a $3 fee.  What bank charges a fee on EFT transfers? Want checks -- they link you to an outside vendor who is happy to sell you checks.  I called to see if there was any other way to transfer funds out and the experience was terrible.  10 verification questions, including provide your full account number, full social security number, full drivers license number, amount of a recent deposit, etc.  Then the person couldn't help and was not even familiar with the interest rates or transfer options and limits on BBVA accounts and couldn't be bothered to look it up.  She sent me to another person who went through the whole verification procedure again.  I then asked whether I could just close the account.  Sure, but to do that you have to send a fax (who uses faxes these days?) with all of the same verification info, plus also a copy of your identification.  The reason they use fax rather than email is because it is more secure (like a fax is really secure, right?)  This bank is beyond a waste of time, it is unethical and luddite.  STAY AWAY!

name: Trevor Witheld
review: I signed up for their ClearPoints credit card and was making payments regularly. As I always do I tried to set up autopay so I no longer have to worry about missing payments. For some reason their app wouldn't allow me to enroll in autopay without opening a BBVA checking account. So I just made sure to log on and make my payments. About 3 months of card use and I find another section in the app that allows me to set up autopay. This time it works, my payment is processed and I see that my account says autopay is active in the app. Fast forwards 2 months and I check my account on a whim only to find that I have missed a payment and autopay is not active. So I quickly pay my bill and call BBVA customer service. After waiting for 20 minutes I finally get someone on the line and explain my situation. The lady shows no sympathy and instead tells me that I will have to file a dispute with TransUnion credit bureau. I also ask her how I can enroll in autopay and she tells me that they will have to mail me a waiver that I have to sign and mail back before they can set up autopay. Fast forward another 2 weeks and TransUnion tells me that no change will be made and that I should talk with the financial institution if I feel there is still a mistake. Meanwhile, my credit score plummets 150 points and my credit limit on the card is dropped from $5,000 to $800. So, once again I call BBVA. This time I get a much more helpful and understanding woman on the line and I again explain my situation including my efforts to make a dispute with TransUnion. She quickly refunds my late fee, which I greatly appreciated, and tells me she will file a dispute for me to have the late payment removed and my credit limit increased to it's original limit. I then ask about setting up autopay and she transfers me to a man who walks me through setting up autopay on the BBVA app. It turns out it was the exact same process I had done before and there was no need to sign a paper authorizing autopayments. After nearly 2 months of trying to correct my credit history I finally received a letter telling me that they would not be removing the late payment from my account history. Needless to say I canceled the card and will never be using BBVA services ever again. The only reason I gave this company 2 stars instead of 1 is because the helpful lady during my second call refunded my late payment and actually tried to help me out.

name: Jorge ORtiz
review: Beware of the commercial account. I started one for my startup and even though my credit score is 800+ I was limited to a $500 credit limit. When booking a hotel + car rental, the pre-authorization security charges would run the account over the limit and I would get charged overdraft even though the charges were then removed. To increase the limit I would have to write a letter (not an email, or app, or even bank visit) and it was such a hassle I had to decline.Additionally, the corporate account that this mystic entity that (1) I didn't have visibility to, (2) I didn't receive statements for (3) Was inaccessible through the app (4) Was inaccessible through their website (5) Could not be paid online. In 25+ years of banking I have never had a late payment. I somehow accrued $200 of late fees and overdrafts without my knowledge. Right now I find $200 a great price to never have to deal with BBVA again. Currently closing all accounts, which of course, require several visits to the bank and a 21-day waiting time afterwards. Will be so glad to be done with BBVA then.

review: By law they have to give you 6 transfers out, but they want to charge you $3 per transfer and limit you to $5000 max transfer a day, not only that, it takes 2 business days when most banks go instantenously through zelle for free! This is the 21st century, not 1950.

review: One of the least user friendly Websites and Apps.  I have been using computers since 1984 (not a novice) and do all of my shopping online.But, the BBVA site is a “pull your hair out” exasperating experience.  I will be closing my account after only six weeks.  The two stars are exclusively for the superior service in the bank.Award-winning App??!! Ha!!!

review: Can not close my account.  I have 15k and they will only allow you to transfer 5000 a day and 2 transfers a month.  Will take me 2 months to close the account.  Never again with BBVA. Plus they charge $3 a transfer

name: Lisa W
review: I've had a checking & savings account with PNC for over 10 years with minimal problems. I budget my money very well so I’ve never had an issue with overdraft fees or anything. The issues I’ve had are few and far between, but were very frustrating at that moment. Overall, they’re a pretty good bank and it’s not worth the hassle of switching banks as I’m sure the all have issues from time to time. I just wish they’d open a branch in the Hudson Valley area of NY so that I have a brand nearby should these issues arise again…My main issue is with the mobile app. Unfortunately, my current employer doesn’t have direct deposit so I get a paper check every week, and the closest PNC location is at least an hour from me, so I use the mobile deposit every week. There were 3 weeks in a row this year where the mobile deposit didn’t work at all on Friday evening, which is a pretty inconvenient time for it to go down when most people get paid at the end of the week. This has happened sporadically before, but for almost a month straight, it really made me consider looking for a different bank. Most of the time there are no issues though, so I hope it stays that way.Another small issue I had recently is with the customer service not being properly trained and giving incorrect information. A check that I deposited via mobile deposit into my account bounced (insufficient funds on the end of the person who wrote the check). Not a big deal as I had funds to cover the loss. Customer service told me I had to wait 48 hours and then I could deposit it again via mobile (or come into a branch location, but I’d have to travel an hour plus). I didn’t see how it could deposit the check again because that check number was already counted as a deposit and figured it would reject it as already deposited. But, I waited 2 days per her advice, tried again, and (no surprise) it said I couldn’t because the check had already been deposited. I called customer service again, and was told “I’m not sure why she told you that, but that’s incorrect.” I could have gotten the replacement check from the issuer and had my money 2 days sooner had the first girl knew what she was talking about.

name: KIMBERLY WOLFE
review: Trying to use the app from my phone has many many glitches and constant problems. I have my username and password saved and still it tells me it's wrong. This happens frequently and causes me to wait until I can contact someone or reset things from my computer. I can't tell you how frustrating it is. This app completely sucks.

review: I wanted seamless banking and all I'm getting is headaches, I've never over drafted my account there is also money in that account always its a business account and I'm not doing to bad for myself . I was promised my deposits would never be put on hold and guess what that was a lie! IM SWITCHING BANKS ONCE AGAIN !

review: BEWARE—- don’t ever sign up with any BBVA. They will not help you with fraud / disputes charges. They said they would take care of it but they never did. They kept sending you a letter late fee for $29. You will regret if you sign up with BBVA. Be careful! I promise you thanks

name: tracey pappas
review: I submitted a dispute to BBVA Compass Bank regarding two $100.00 charges on my account dated 5/13/19.   I received ticket # ******** on 7/23/19 from Jason and was told I would receive some forms to fill out and sign within 10 days.  I never received these forms nor did I receive the dispute acknowledgement that they legally were supposed to send me within 30 days.   Also this dispute has not been resolved within the two billing cycles they are supposed to have resolved it within legally.  I called them again on 8/8/19 asking again why I've received nothing and what was going on with my dispute and spoke to Andrew who stated he knew nothing about any forms and told me to wait longer.  He also gave me the phone # to call the dispute department directly.  I called again on 9/5/19 directly to the dispute department and spoke to Leona who stated that nothing has been done on my dispute and the ticket # was just notes stating I had started a dispute.  When I complained about no one working on this dispute and them just giving me the run around, she stated she would put me on hold and "get this dispute to the finish line"  After leaving me on hold for a half hour, she just transferred me back to the original customer service department again!   I spoke to Leon and insisted on speaking to a manager so he transferred me to someone named April who was just as useless and unhelpful as everyone else I've spoken to at BBVA.  She said she couldn't control the mail if I didn't receive the letter, but wouldn't tell me that they had even sent one.  She also wouldn't tell me why there were not any correspondences in my online messages or any copies of this non existing letter or what if anything was done on the dispute.  She again told me just to wait and maybe this would end up in arbitration!!  When I told her I was fed up with the run around I was getting and the terrible customer service her company has she couldn't have cared less.  She stated "do what you have to do"  when I told her I was filing complaints against BBVA.   She said she would escalate my dispute to another manager but wouldn't transfer me to them so I have no idea if she even did that or if she just added another note or did anything at all to resolve this dispute.   I guess they just think that if they ignore their customers long enough they'll just go away and the bank can keep their customers money.    Worst bank EVER - don't bank with them for any reason, you'll end up regretting it.

name: ctksimoes
review: Yes, please file complaints against bbva. We have the same experience. They will not help anything thanks

name: nsanders32
review: I have worked for the State of Texas for 10 years and get paid once a month. usually on the first of the month. I have previously banked with capital one and bank of America, I changed to BBVA because they gave me a car loan and I wanted all my banking to be done with one bank. I change my direct deposit to my new BBVA checking account. Over the years when there is a holiday that falls on my pay day the funds are available the business day before the first business day of the month. NOT BBVA! this year Labor Day is on a Monday the 2nd of September therefore the next business day is September the 3rd. Even thought I have confirmed with BBVA that they have received my direct deposit pay check on Saturday Aug 31 they will not make any of the funds available to me until the next business day September the 3rd!!! I was told that even though they have a reliable confirmed paycheck from my employer (THE STATE OF TEXAS) The will not release my pay check funds because the paycheck date is September the 3rd. Go to a bank that doesn't have an overdraft fee.  Greedy!!!! Greedy! praying on peoples mistakes!

review: I wish there was no stars. The silver lining is I guess Abilene N3rd campus has an older lady that is exceptional, that one star is for her. name: Bruce Frykman
review: I have reluctantly come to the conclusion that BBVA is currently scamming its CD customers.   What may have happened is that lower level management has been incentivized to make additional profits by scamming its customers similar to what other banks such as Wells Fargo have done in the past.    I have come to this conclusion because of multiple duplicitous statements they have made.   They say they record customer contacts but when challenged to produced them that say they have no records.What they do is offer a high CD rate but then don't deliver on the promise, I would avoid them like the plague.The average of all their 80 Better Business Bureau reviews is 1 : the very worst yet the BBB gives them a rating of B- (what would they need to do to get an F? )

name: Priscilla Zink
review: Six weeks ago I bought a CD from BBVA...or thought I did. I provided routing and account numbers for the checking account from which they were authorized to withdraw payment, and they made two small deposits to verify that I own the account. When I reported the amounts back to them they told me they were incorrect.A typo? Inverted figure? No big deal.  (Until you get on the phone to try to fix it.)   After 25 minutes on hold and a disconnect that sent me to the back of the line I reached a rep with such a pronounced accent that I understood approximately every third word.  Nonetheless I thought everything was cool. Not so.  The CD appeared in my BBVA account, but payment was never withdrawn from my checking account.  Another unintelligible phone call. Several hours of scouring the website for some form of written contact....an email address or snail mail or smoke signals...anything without a foreign accent! Unless I missed something, it's phone contact or nothing. I couldn't even reply to the “no reply” email notifying me that, at my request (?!?), my account has been removed from Mobile and Online Banking. Actually, it's kind of a relief.

name: Ja Jackson
review: Closed both checking and money market account after a month for no reason that is obvious to me. They did this after I had started the process of linked external accounts for bill payment, and the abrupt account closure resulted in them pulling back ACH transfers that had already been shown as cleared on the other side. This has left me with a mess to clean-up, hindered by the fact that I can't access anything related to my BBVA account online. Waiting for the bank to send a check now, who knows when that will arrive. Customer service gave me the wrong information (account will be unlocked when funds transfer clears), told me I would be called by agent in charge (never happened), and ultimately just sent a letter with no reason for their actions. Poor..

name: Chris Moore
review: Debit card was not automatically sent out when the old one expired. I have been waiting a week to get the new one in. When you try calling customer service, the replay is to "Please call back again" and then the call is disconnected. BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE

name: weeks6671
review: You know I am not using them anymore I consider than a joke. The little fees they have I will pass I do not want them. The mistake I made was using them as a bank, I do not need there stupid fees plenty of banks do not have fees.

Other than checking account, you get 2 other accounts for free: savings and growth. I definitely recommend using PNC's services if you are trying to open a checking account as a student.

review: Worst bank I have ever done business with.  They rob from their customers.  I have a personal loan with them, payment due on the 7th of every month. name: danamarie9177
review: I never write reviews but i feel the need to here. Got the credit card in December with a $2,800.00 limit. Made some small purchases and then went in and downloaded the app to set up payments. Tried 3 different times to figure it out and couldn't. Got distracted with moving and then realized my payment was a day late. I called customer service to make the payment and get help setting up payment thru the app. I finally got someone to help me set it up and my account was verified by them making 2 small deposits to and then removing from my bank account. Made Marches payment online with no issues. Went in on March 29th to make April's payment. Everything went fine and got a confirmation  number, then checked my account april 9th and the payment i had made on the 29th was reversed and i was charged a fee. Called to find out why and they said my bank returned it (there was no reason for that) the girl verified the account number for my bank and there was a number missing even though my end on the app showed the proper number. She said they would need to investigate further and call me back. Now 2 days later they are calling to collect my missed payment that i tried to make. I explain all this again to the agent today and still have no answer. Made the returned payment on the phone with the agent but they still cannot tell me why the account number was different. While i was on the phone with them my account magically moved from a source account to a destination account. They also told me there was no record of the call 2 days ago. I have never had so many problems trying to pay money. Of course the reversal charge was not waived either. I am closing this card and paying off the balance. Do yourself a favor and don't waste your time with this company because they will lie and cheat you out of your money.

name: ccxfh
review: PNC bank changes the credit card rewards terms freely to deny the $100 rewards after a customer qualifies for every term based on the bank's original printed offer. The customer service associate is not customer friendly and sounds untrustworthy. PNC's original offer states that to receive the $100, the WorkPlace Banking customer must haven an eligible WorkPlace Banking account at the time you submit an application for a new PNC points credit card account through the offer; have your application approved; and make at least $1000 in qualifying purchases within the first 90 days following credit card account opening. review: We paid our loan off 30 day ago. Initially I was told the title and payoff letter would come within 10 business days. 10 business days came and went so I called again. review: I paid off my loan in early December of 2018. On Jan. 22nd they autodrafted my account for $600. I called again and they told me to wait because it hadn't been a full 10 business days. I feel they should have to pay me interest on the money they have held onto, but really I would just be happy with answers and MY MONEY!!!!

name: Wyndy Jenkins
review: I opened up a business checking account at the branch located at  2217 W Market St, Bloomington, IL 61705 with Branch Manager Katrina Jones. I opened up the account because I am new to the area and doing business there. I also started on another sub business under my current business which is a property preservation company. My sub was going to be business to business collection. I informed Mrs. Jones that it was new to me and I new very little about the workings of it worked but was learning how to do it. She asked me if I knew how much money would be going into the account I told her I was not sure but I told her possibly big sums and doing wire transfers to pay the money to the company we were suppose to be working for. I asked her how much could we deposit at one time and how long it would take for a check to clear, she said you can deposit any amount and for the first 30 days it will take 2 days for a check to clear because it was a new account, then after thirty days it will take 1 day for a check to clear. She said there were no holds on wire transfers, money orders and or cash. So I began my new business adventure and received, a check in the mail for over $79,000, I take it to PNC Bank the next day and deposit it. The gentleman that works there runs the check and begins to inform me there would be a longer hold on the check. Mrs. Jones comes out of her office to say it could be but check your account in 2 days before I spend anything further confirming she told me 2 day hold. Now the reason the hold is important to me because I had already told the client that I was working for it would take 2 days for the check to clear, I did not care if it was 2, 5, or 10 days just give me the accurate information so I can inform my client when they would get paid. It resulted in me having to give them different dates which cost me the client because it appeared as if I didn't know what I was doing. The check was reversed back to the payees account by the payee and PNC Bank closed my account with no warning, no investigation till after the fact. They concluded and said the check that was received was fraudulent and although after 2 business days the check that was deposited was my ledger balance. Also PNC did not return or stop the check they were not even aware that the check was reversed until I informed them. So now if it was FRAUDULENT as they claimed how come the bank manager Katrina Jones did not know it until I informed her that my payee reversed the check back to his account. So they closed my account made me pay for a bounce check that never bounced and sent me a cashiers check in my business name. I went to cash the cashiers check at the same location 2217 W Market St, Bloomington, IL 61705 only to be told they could not cash the CASHIERS CHECK THAT THEY SENT TO ME THE OWNER because it was in the business name  oh and they wanted to charge me 2% to cash a cashiers check that they sent me. So now I am taking this as far as I can take it and will not stop because this is horrible.

review: BBVA violates fiduciary responsibility. Unfortunately we feel forced to end a 26 year relationship with BBVA (which started in 1992 when they were Central Bank). review: We give 1  star because we had personable loan officer who we knew was trying his best, though rest of the staff there were too slow and lacking in thoroughness.The rest of BBVA mortgage experience as we were trying to close on buying our home was just horrific.  They are bad at keeping deadlines and the details, which is quite anxiety provoking when trying to close on a home in 30 days or less. Firstly, they took almost 10 days to get an apprasial confirmed when we had an apprasail contingency in shorter than that, and each time they said they would keep a deadline they would miss it.  After that our loan approval was pending, we had all our documents in within 14 days of Escrow, but a loan administrator sat on the file for over  a week and did NOTHING to push it forward, meanwhile BBVA was not requesting proper documents from our employers or insurance which delayed further, and we had to step in.multiple times just to spark things going again. When it came down to the wire, they submitted our file for “review” and it took a whole week just to get the loan approved after they had already delayed it. This resulted in frustrating everyone involved in closing, prolonging escrow, worrying the listing team and sellers, putting our earnest deposit at risk, and also resulted in us having to take work leave (and resulting frustrations at our employers) and costing us money. We eventually did close (after they also made mistakes and needed additional documents at the last moment, that they should have asked for on day 1 of escrow). We appreciated our main loan officer doing what he could, but BBVA is severely lacking in professionalism and timeliness as an organization.Throughout this process I had to email and call them multiple times a week just to get an update response, often times they would not respond for a week. And in the end after me asking several times in a polite way if they had all documents needed, they still were lacking them in the final moments before closing.I DO NOT recommend BBVA if you are at all in a competitive buyers market as they will slow you down and cause your money to be at risk from their inability to keep any deadlines. name: menninger22
review: BBVA is the absolute worst credit card company I have ever used in my life. I can't wait to cancel this credit card no matter its impact on my credit score. They apply payments unfairly and contrary to the industry standard of highest-interest-rate first. Furthermore, they don't apply it until the end of your statement, so if you pay off interest then make as much in purchases, only half of your interest is paid off in the end.  Their responses in email (which take over a week to get after initial contact) claim that your Minimum Payment Due can be used to their discretion, and anything else is applied to highest-interest balances first.  Using the same arguments I use below, I have demonstrated that that is not even close to what happens.  The second you do anything that accrues interest, you will accrue interest until you have a $0 balance for at least one month.  Here is my story, with rounded numbers to maintain some semblance of privacy:I got the credit card for the 0% intro APY promotion. Thinking that applied to balance transfers, I transferred $2000 to this card in addition to general purchases. The only debt on my first statement was this transfer.The second cycle was when I began using the card for general purchases.  Halfway through the second cycle I went to pay for the first month, but saw that I had accrued $50 in interest.  When I realized the mistake I had made, and that the $2000 balance transfer was accruing interest at 18%, I immediately paid $2100 to completely pay off the transfer balance that was accruing interest.  BBVA claims that they apply the Minimum Balance Due in their discretion, and then apply payments first to the highest interest charges.  At the time of payment, I had $2050 under 18% interest and $500 under 0% interest. Thus, my $2100 would be allocated as $50 to Minimum Payment Due, $2000 to the transfer, and to $50 accrued interest, leaving a $450 balance accruing at 0%.Fast forward to the end of this second cycle when my balance is now $1500 in exclusively 0% APY general purchases.  I see another interest charge. After investigating, I found that I still had $750 from the balance transfer accruing interest. Now I'm confused. Not only did $750 of my $2100 go toward a lower-rate balance, but after that payment, my balance was $450.  How is there $750 of my original purchase accruing interest when the total balance was only $450?! Disgusted, I paid the balance in full -- all $1500 of this statement -- bringing my balance down to $0 to enter the third cycle.  I waited a few days for the payment to reflect on my account so I could see with my eyes that I had a $0 balance.  With a $0 balance, I can't have any charges anywhere accruing interest, right? Wrong.Fast forward to the end of the third cycle. Skeptical, I used this card sparingly, and my balance is only $400 in exclusively 0% APY general purchases. Well, good thing because there is still interest accruing! The $10 interest that $750 accrued in two weeks was not paid off by the $1500 because that interest isn't posted until the end of the statement.  So now I still have $10 accruing interest even though I've made only 0% APY purchases since the last time my balance was $0.Currently, I'm still trying to eliminate this interest. I am convinced the only solution is to pay down to $0 before the next statement end date, then make no purchases, only paying off interest still accruing, until the following statement end date. So here I am unable to fully take advantage of my intro APY because BBVA won't let me make interest-free purchases while anything else is accruing interest.

review: I should start by saying we've been with PNC since they acquired National City Bank many years ago.  We've had several car loans, a mortgage, and most recently a HELOC and Line of Credit.  For the first time ever, someone from PNC called and said that they might have a way for us to get a better interest rate while extending our line of credit. All I can say is this was a total bait-n-switch experience.  The first rep sells you while the other internal and less people friendly rep breaks the news that their underwriters can't get the rate I was told.  Both my wife and I have scores in the 800's, good incomes, and equity already existed in the home.  When I mentioned that I wasn't interested in extending the line at a higher rate the rep was dismissive and had an "I don't care" attitude, as if I was wasting her time.  Really?  PNC has gotten too big to understand customer service, which is just a total shame.  We're now looking to move our funds to another institution, not that I expect PNC to care much about that either.

name: tasheaking24
review: I filed a dispute for a payment on 7/27/2017. The total charge was $195. I requested to dispute $125 of it however, PNC filed the dispute incorrectly and disputed the entire $195. This was the first issue. I was given a $195 provisional credit while the dispute was investigated. On 7/30/2017 I no longer needed the charge disputed because I was able to get in contact with the merchant and everything was taken care of. I called to cancel the dispute and was under the impression that it was taken care of. It was never cancelled. On 8/15/2017 I check my account with the merchant and see that $195 was reversed. This caused me to incur a $75 fee. I immediately called PNC and was told that the dispute was never cancelled and that the dispute was filed incorrectly. They told me that they will cancel the dispute and everything would be reversed and that they will also reverse the $195 provisional credit from my account in 5 business days. They also filed a complaint in my behalf due to the error and negligence on their part, causing me to incur a $75 fee. The next issue occurred the following day. I was just told that the $195 provisional credit would be taken from my account in 5 business days. But THEY TOOK IT THE VERY NEXT DAY! This REALLY frustrated me. All the while I have been checking with the merchant to see if they had received the payment back since it was reversed. They still had not. 8/18/2015, 3 business days after the dispute had FINALLY been cancelled I see that the merchant STILL had not received payment. This outraged me because PNC wasted no time reversing the $195 credit from my account, yet is taking their precious time rectifying their own mistake. I call PNC and basically asked them "if the merchant does not have the $195 and I don't have the $195 then where is my money????" At this point I need to know why this still has not been taken care of. Mind you, this is a deposit for an apartment so it is a time sensitive issue. The representative I spoke with tells me that they do not show that the merchant reversed the $195 and that they do not have it either. So the merchant does not have it and now they claim they do not have it either and I surely don't have it and I don't even have the provisional credit that was provided. So in all I am out $270 because of PNC's mistake and they act as if they do not even care to rectify the issue. I am HIGHLY upset. This has caused so many issues. I have been a PNC customer for 6 years and as soon as this issue is taken care of I will be taking every penny out of my account and I will be closing my account with them. PNC used to be a great company but they have really gone downhill in service as well as in their customer service. PNC has lost a loyal customer. This has been reported to the BBB as well.

name: fgg2001
review: I applied for a MM account online for a promotional rate of 1.1%. They replied to the application stating that they could not verify my identity and asked me to go to one of their branch offices.After they verified the identity and the Branch office they told me they could not honor the promotional rate because I was not applying online and offered me a B.S. rate of 0.1% instead of the advertised 1.1%.This is clearly a scam to lure customers to their branch, they never intended to honor the promotional rate.If this is the way this bank conduct business you better stay away from it.This is the worst bank experience I had in many years dealing with online banks.They should get zero starts in the review.

name: wanlam2188
review: Don't let their "high yield" money market account lurk you into opening an account with them because the "good rate" would only last a couple of months and will drop way low. When you realize the low low rate, it would be at least one and one half month later because by the time you got your statement and look at it, it is 45 days later. It is not worth the time to opening an account and closed your account within 4 month. When trying to talk to a representative, NO ONE can give you a clear answer. When I close the account I was told the interest was calculated until the day the account is closed. WRONG.  I get Zero interest today. Scam! Do not do business with them. Awful banking experience.

name: ashleytowery1984
review: This is by far the most incompetent bank i've ever dealt with. From the call center to the branches. We only have our business banking account, line of credit and credit cards for our business with these knuckleheads. If it werent such a pain to change everything we would drop these people! I have never in my life dealt with such overall incompetents.

name: invoices4home
review: PNC has a great rate. But DONT pay your bill in full, or they will lock your account for 14 days while they take your money and freeze your account! Ridiculously unacceptable in our immediate transfer days.  I am cancelling the account because i pay my bill in full most months. To not be able to use the card for 2 weeks out of the month because it's paid in full doesn't make sense.

name: Patricia Murray
review: Customer service is not good. After 15 years with them and never a missed payment I asked if they could waive a $10 fee for for using a transfer balance check. They flatly refused. I will be cancelling this card

name: _entonois
review: Horrible experience.Mortgage price on a fixed loan changed 4 times in a month charging me $1900 instead of $650. It took them over 2 weeks to refund me and never did I hear an apology. I do not recommend anyone banking with BBVA. Please be aware.

name: salilatravers6
review: Very unprofessional company.  I spoke with a representative that sounded half asleep and told me I would have 4.99 or 5.99% interest for six months.  I used the card and then the interest was 11.49%.  I finally was called by customer service and then after a long delay in which I had to call again, I was told that because I didn't expressly state that I was going to charge the card (which I did on the same day I was given the offer),I could not get the lower interest rate.  In my opinion, this borders on fraud.  The rep did not tell me I had to state that I was accepting the offer.

name: Sleazy Pea
review: I got it because I qualified for it through my bank. It's alright, don't put a lot of money on it though because the interest rate is high. The customer service is excellent, you can cancel and get a new one very quickly if you lose it. The points are pretty good, I really only use cashback. I would not recommend it to others unfortunately.

name: Jon A Fernandez
review: I have used PNC's Virtual Wallet product for almost 6 years. It makes life easy. They have plenty of local branches but also have a strong online offering. My only complaint is they frequently try to cross sell their credit cards with mail advertisements.

name: lovejarita
review: I applied for a prepaid card I received the card with a letter stating I was denied the use of the prepaid card do to my banking history I am so confused why would my banking history matter its a PREPAID card I fund with my own money

name: kollinlockamyproductions
review: Same thing happened to me. I told my banker that he needed to figure out why. After a long chain of command, no one in the branch knew why. I applied for an override and now have the card.

name: kollinlockamyproductions
review: Same thing happened to me. I told my banker that he needed to figure out why. After a long chain of command, no one in the branch knew why. I applied for an override and now have the card.

name: Ethan Hollow
review: Terrible card, the customer service is absolutely abysmal and when I tried to redeem my points (Of which they hand out in tiny amounts like they're afraid of you getting enough to cash them in so you can leave) I wound up waiting two months with nobody being able to tell me what the hold up was. I would absolutely positively never use another card from them or use PNC Bank again in my life nor would I recommend them to others. You're better off writing IOUs on used napkins than resorting to using this bank/card. Stay away! FAR AWAY.

name: _inqi
review: The worst service in the world! Bankers lack of financial knowledge. Never call you back including branch mangers! I'm in Denver colorado, I desled with three different branches, exactly the same. I guess this is their company's culture!

name: yancy
review: This was another card that I got even though I really didn't need it, because I opened an account with the bank and they sort of pushed it on me. In this case, they immediately extended me a 0% promotional period, and because I was changing jobs at the time. I used it for a couple months and only made minimum payments. It didn't take long for them to just immediately close the account, even I didn't owe them any interest and had never missed a payment, which left me confused about why they gave me the card in the first place, and especially why they gave me the 0% offer. Second time this has happened to me. I got a letter explaining it that showed up a couple weeks after it had happened; it would have been nice of customer service to contact me with a heads up prior to me suddenly finding out the card didn't work anymore, but since I didn't really *need* the card I didn't care that much. I had no contact with their customer service other than that. Other than that the card was unremarkable, average line of credit, interest was a bit high. I had a hard time making payments, since they really pushed using their mobile app, which was kind of buggy, hard to navigate, and frequently unavailable. I couldn't really recommend this card to anyone if they've got decent alternatives.

name: sgregory1152
review: I would make payments utilizing the coupon book provided. The payment coupon has an area where you can make additional principal payments.  Apparently no one ever looked at the coupon submitted. They continually applied the entire payment to principle vs. the monthly payment.  Customer service was unbearable. This happened more four times and never got adequality resolved.  Finally, just paid the loan off in full to get away from this situation. Will never again use BBVA Compass bank no matter what interest rate i have to pay.

name: Brian McIntyre
review: Was not happy with Roni primm.Pnc will never have my Business

name: Kelly Williams
review: PNC is a fee hub.   I was charged $15 pro rated fee for not having the minimum deposited into my account (not on a monthly cycle but the statement cycle) which ended in the middle of the month. This was not explained when I opened the account (statement cycle vs. monthly cycle).  To make matters worse, the deposit was was made the day after the statement date.  Their fees made my account go into the negative.  Then, I was charged $7 for each day in was in the negative.  On top of that, I went to the branch to see if I could recover any of the fees and they said it was nothing they could do.  I'm sure many people will catch on and a class action suit will be filed.  I'll recoup my funds at that time.

name: Rod Horne
review: PNC points is a rip off. I have been waiting 15 days for 2 dining gift cards with no answers as to why they have not been sent. Still processing. But you talk to so many different cuts. sec people and they all say different things. Supervisors are of no help and don't know anything either. Ordered in October and still waiting for them. Poor cust. sec and poor website...

name: Maen
review: Everything about PNC was great, I got my account activated in couple days, there was no fees for student's account, and overdraft protection, the only missing thing about them is that I didn't get a Chip-card, I'm still waiting for it.One problem I had with them, when I changed my address, they changed the account address but not the card address and I had to go through hard times with their customer support to solve this problem. Other than this everything was great.

name: melissad1
review: My experience with my PNC savings account has been superior and excellent. They have provided me access to the Virtual Wallet for online and mobile banking and they frequently send me updates regarding my balance. I would highly recommend utilizing PNC for a bank savings account.  My previous experience with other banks has been substantially subpar compared to my current and ongoing experience with PNC.  At any time if I have a question, their customer service answers quickly and efficiently and I am located near several branches if I’d like to walk in and have a face-to-face with an actual person any time.

name: Kimberlie Rogers
review: I have been a PNC bank customer for almost 10 years now.  I switched from another well known bank that had been taken over by a large Canadian corporation and all of a sudden I was being charged fees left and right.  I rarely ever let my accounts get over drawn so I could not understand why on earth I was being charged for giving someone MY money.  On the other hand, PNC bank has been awesome!  I started out with the basic checking account.  Absolutely no minimum balance and no maintenance fees.  Then the Virtual Wallet came into play....the Virtual Wallet is amazing!  It literally lets me break down my paychecks each week into money set aside for bills, short term savings, long term savings and whatever extra I can spend.  I can see my actual real-time finances and set up an automated savings strategy.  I can pay my bills online without fees and can transfer money between accounts instantly!  Two thumbs up for the Virtual Wallet!!!!

name: Ron Carlos
review: I've had a really good experience with my PNC checking account since switching from Chase bank about three years ago. I spend most of my time with the bank online by paying bills or electronically depositing money. Everything goes through extremely fast. I have never had a problem with delays. The website looks like other banking sites and is easy to use and navigate. The people at my local branch are fairly friendly and they always have enough people working, so lines are not a problem. There are not any fees associated with my account, and I have never had any hidden charges either.

name: Julius Guzman
review: PNC Bank is a decent option to have if you live in a city with many branches and PNC ATM machines. The fees with PNC can get a little out of control if you need a debit card replaced, need access to an ATM frequently, and don't have a free checking account. Ordering checks was not free, which many banks offer.Overall, my experience with PNC is a positive one. With a few branches around and PNC ATM machines available in several gas stations in the city it is easy to avoid silly fees when using your debit card. If you need anything done quickly however, expect to pay a nominal fee.Pros:Customer servicePlenty of branches aroundCons:Fees for replacing debit cardHigh fees after you have reached your free ATM withdrawal limit at non-pnc atm machinesNo free checks

name: James Clark
review: I had an issue getting a checking account after some financial issues and PNC was willing to open a PNC Virtual Wallet account for me to start banking again. So far the experience has been great with little issue and transferring money between checking and savings is easy online or with the app. Have had no issues with the product and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is interested in the product!

name: Gary Stephens
review: This PNC Points Visa is the stingiest and most miserly reward program ever. The reward choices are limited  and quite expensive. A cheap-o  package of 5 ball point pens costs 1800 points and It takes some 50000 points to get a $100 reward. You would be wise to skip this deal.

name: Chris Jenkins
review: I have a PNC savings account which I have had since I opened my account back in college, in 2003.  It has always served its purpose, save my money and it does it well!  I love the easy access to it and how it is linked to my checking account.  I am able to access it with the mobile app and my life is absolutely better having a savings account at PNC.  The customer service at this bank is also very good. I have had other banks before which I have had issues with previously and thankfully at this place I have been more than ok.

name: Wayne Hendrix
review: The card is great for points.  Do not transfer balances as they hide the fact that there is a 2.5 % base interest charged on that balance.  Not a 0% transfer as they advertise.

name: Kristan M Hall
review: There is so many banks to choose from around everywhere so when I found myself at a PNC bank in our town, I was sceptical that it was going to be any different than the fee raping banks around everywhere. I went in to fill out a application for a checking account. After talking to an amazing rep at the branch I took the new free account and have had nothing but a wonderful experience. I don't pay anything if I use my account like I normally do. I was able to use my fee free card anywhere and love all that they do for me as a customer.

name: John Serrano
review: I have been a long-time customer of BBVA Compass for over 6 years now. I first applied when I was 18 years old, and their staff worked closely with me to help setup the account as well as made sure I understood the terms and conditions of service. I previously held an account with Amegy Bank who provided terrible service and charged several fees that I was unaware of, which is why I was a bit wary of moving to a new bank. The times I had been charged for withdrawing too many times from my savings account, BBVA Compass worked with me to waive the fees and they were extremely friendly about it. Any bank transfers to my ClearChoice savings account are usually quick and speedy. Mobile deposits to my savings account using their app also makes banking with Compass a breeze. While they no longer offer yearly rewards and member benefits since the recession in 2011, they have never failed to provide excellent customer service in helping me resolve any issues with my savings account. I highly recommend BBVA Compass, especially if you are a student or if you are opening your first savings account.

name: Tanner MacLaren
review: There is a PNC right in my town, which is the only bank offered in my town (it's a smaller sized town). Anyways, the PNC bank has always been good to me and I have never had a single problem with it. The only negative thing i'd have to say about PNC is the checking account fee. It's pretty dumb, but it's not too expensive and the bank is still worth it even with the fee.

name: Todd
review: I have had a PNC checking account for almost 20 years.  The customer service is very reliable, and my PNC card is very easy to use.  It makes life a lot easier to me instead of having cash on me at all times.  The best part about having my PNC checking account is that there are no minimum and maximum penalties for how much one can have in their checking account.  I will remain a PNC checking account holder forever.

name: Thomas King
review: I've had this checking account for a while.  I use it to manage my business and it helps with certain aspects of the business.  Its better than most of the alternatives but PNC isn't the best company in terms of customer service and cost; going to a different ATM aside from PNC can really be costly.  Because of their faults as a company, I have to take off a few points but don't be scared away from this particular account.

name: jennie sal
review: I have 3 small children and now fear my water and electric will be shut off. I have been a loyal customer for over a decade. I would have never banked with this institution or kept this account open as long as I have if I knew that they fabricated fees like this and just take ridiculous amounts of money from a family barely making ends meet. I honestly believed they would do the right thing and I have tried to maintain this account in spite of what they were doing.However they don't care. They took as much money as they could and dismiss me by writing a couple letters acting as though I am wasting their time filing complaints with Better Business Bureau and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and attaching copies of the Account Agreement. I tried to get resolution without the need of any complaints or attorney fees and court costs and I was ignored.It is my understanding that unless a consumer chooses to opt-in for overdraft protection, their purchases will be declined if an account has insufficient funds. I should have never had any fees whatsoever from PNC on any check that they believed could not be covered should have been rejected immediately. Funds are available immediately if they are cash or direct deposits.
