This bank ignores these deposits, processed multiple checks and essentially took any and all of the money for themselves.Some shady banks have a policy of processing the day's largest transactions first (as opposed to chronological order), which increases the likelihood of multiple small transactions incurring overdraft fees. If customers don't have overdraft protection anymore, the banks can't collect. In fact a federal judge accused Wells Fargo of "profiteering" by employing overdraft policies that led customers to pay multiple fees. The bank was ordered to return over $203 million to their customers. I believe PNC should be held accountable for doing the same to their customers.

name: Jack
review: This really is a no-frills savings account. I have always enjoyed that they do not require me to keep a minimum balance requirement and I get this account automatically because I have a checking account with BBVA. I wish the interest rate had a better return and it was higher, but for something I only keep a few hundred dollars in, it does the job. Fees are pretty much non-existent with this account and fees are primarily attached to my checking account. The online features BBVA has are very easy to use and to transfer money between my checking and savings account. While I recommend the savings account, be ready to have minimal features and just a standard savings account.

name: Jack
review: My identity was compromised on PayPal and it was connected to my Easy Checking account with BBVA and almost $200 was taken from my account. I never had a reason to connect with BBVA customer service for anything and the first time I did it was regarding fraud. Low and behold, they were fantastic to work with and had my money back in the account within two days. They handled everything for me and it all came as service guarantees attached to my Easy Checking account. It is a very simple account and I only use on debit card with it. They made it very seamless for me to get back to normal and use my checking account. Thanks BBVA Compass.

name: Debra Ann
review: This account is great because there are no monthly fees or minimum balance requirements(since not all of us have hundreds to spare each month). My only recommendation is to skip the overdraft protection on your account- this allows PNC to initially cover the expense if there is not enough money in your account but charges you $36 a day until you deposit enough to cover that expense PLUS the additional $36 a day. It is easy to remove from your account though, you can do it online or with a teller.

name: David Casey
review: As mentioned before, the Virtual Wallet is a very unique type of banking that PNC offers. Within the account, they also provide a savings account for members to place money in known as a "Growth" account. The standards for the Growth account are very lenient, as nearly any sum of money placed in there will begin to gain a miniscule interest. PNC doesn't take funds from your account or membership fees in order to have this account in place, even if it does not contain sufficient or massive amounts of funds inside. The customer service is great and the bankers are knowledgeable and provide every customer with a great starting pathway to saving their money and building their wealth at PNC.

name: David Casey
review: PNC Virtual Wallet is by far the most high recommended financial banking service that I could mention. Firstly, the process of acquiring a Visa debit card for your virtual wallet is quick and painless, and the easy ATM access with minimum fees creates a convenient experience. Also being a low budget college student, the lack of a REQUIRED amount to have stored in the account at all times is also very useful. The employees are very nice at every branch that I have ever been to. In addition, I had once racked an overdraft fee of over $80 USD, and they waived it from my account for free, after just signing up for a PNC Credit Card, which them knowing I was a college student, I wouldn't be accepted for anyway. Overall, great bank!

name: Christine Helton
review: I recently switched to PNC Bank from a credit union that I had been using for quite a while. I was eligible for the PNC Performance checking account and signed up for it. I am very pleased with my choice. The checking account perfectly fits my needs and the customer service that I have received from PNC (at my local branch and on the customer service line) has been outstanding!

name: Tonya Tootoo
review: In the beginning I was very pleased with services provided by PNC, but after one year it went downhill and I was in tears over being charged twenty overdraft charges totalling $800. What started as an overdrawn account ended up being a huge mess and this bank refused to work with me. I am appalled that this bank prides itself on customer service, however I was on the phone daily trying to reason and compromise with customer service since there were several unauthorized transactions causing my account to be in the negative. I was told that I was responsible for the fees and it was my fault, but my account was hacked by a company who would withdrawal money every month under different business names to make it difficult to track and do stop payments or block them from taking money out. I spoke to many different supervisors that all said the same thing. "I can't help you". Seriously? I was a loyal customer and always kept my account in good standing, but nobody could help me resolve issues with the fees. No courtesy refunds and also a daily fee of $10 for each day it was overdrwan totalling $90. I ended up closing this account and meanwhile the bank reaped the fruits of my labor. I am honest and hard working, but I was a victim of fraud and nothing was done.

name: Laura House
review: I simply LOVE Virtual Wallet. I have the apps on my phone and tablet, and I'm set up with online banking too.  I've never had an issue, and they offer incentives all the time for things I purchase.  They also have a great referral program! I'd recommend this to anyone looking to watch their budgeting and track their money management better!

name: Tara
review: I have a PNC Bank statement savings account. I've had it for about 3 years. I like it because it connects with my other PNC accounts and I get a higher interest rates provided I make extra deposit into my checking account. I don't make a lot of money on it but I don't actually think anyone makes any money on their savings account. I have a couple transfers I can withdraw from my savings your moms free of charge and it is of course FDIC insured. Every time I have any questions about any of my accounts with PNC Bank customer service representatives are always very nice and very helpful. I really like that they offer mobile banking and I can deposit money directly into my savings account from my smartphone.

name: Amanda Neel
review: I just opened up my account a few days ago, the set up for online banking was quick and easy. Im a little frustrated that the banker at my branch didnt tell me that the direct depost had to be 500 a month. The app on my phone is pretty cool. I like the punch the pig feature to transfer funds from checking to savings.

name: Josh Hinnebusch
review: I have had nothing but good service with PNC. No monthly fees, overdraft protection, and ATM reimbursement really help out as a college student who doesn't have much cash. Their customer support is second to none and I have had nothing but good experiences with them. I plan to have my future checking and savings accounts with PNC, and I look forward to using their services.

name: Richard Schmitt
review: I've had a PNC Virtual Wallet account since right when they initiated the service, and it's been the best thing in my banking and financial life.  The account simplifies everything, as its online system makes everything so easy, from transferring funds to allocating monies toward different goals.  The account provides for easy paying of bills and although the interest rates are fairly low, the customer service absolutely makes up for it.  Plus, while other companies are having security issues, this has never been a problem for PNC Virtual Wallet checking in the many years I've had the product.

name: Richard Schmitt
review: To be honest, I am very disappointed with this savings account.  The monthly fee for having below $1000 in the account is pretty annoying as it amounts to 1% at minimum of my funds in the account.  In addition, the interest rates don't change enough based on the amount of money in the account.  The breaks are at $100, $10K and $25K and those are huge jumps for the increased rate of return.  This account seems to be for people with a lot more money than me although PNC pitched this account to me as ideal.  I am disappointed.

name: Andy
review: I like PNC Bank. As long as you do all your banking via ATMs, there is no minimum balance or fees. Also, my internet provider made an unauthorized payment request while I had insufficient funds to cover it. This caused the PNC system to charge me over a hundred dollars in over draft fees. But, after explaining the situation to CSR rep, I was reimbursed the full amount of charges taken from my account.

name: Brad
review: I joined PNC when my brother started working there and have not looked back. I love the online tools and the apps for my devices, it makes it so freaking easy to manage my money, pay my bills, and do anything I could possibly need with just a few clicks. They are also incredibly secure, back when I was with regions I had some fraudulent activities and they blamed me each time, where as PNC has successfully helped me out. Never going back.

name: Tony
review: I have been banking with BBVA Compass for about six months now. I have no complaints with them. I made a mistake when I first starting banking and overdrafted. Compass refunded the fees to me with no problem. It is a great account and free of monthly fees which is hard to find these days. I love that they are partnered with NBA since I was able to get a Boston Celtic debit card and support my team.

name: Patricia Garci
review: I joined PNC a few months ago and so far I have been very pleased. They were offering a pretty great sign up bonus of $75-$300 which is a plus. Also the virtual wallet automatically comes with 2 checking accounts and 1 savings account which are all linked. I thought this was awesome because you don't have to go through the hassle of signing up for each. The biggest advantage of PNC is that so far I have not incurred any fees associated with either of my bank accounts.

name: Thomas Busch
review: I signed up for PNC accounts about 8 years ago and I've been OK with their savings.  The interest rate is very poor, but the features are good otherwise.  I signed up back with National City using "work perks" because my office actually has an ATM in it.  Since I'm currently trying to eliminate credit card debt, I'm not keeping a substantial amount in savings so I don't work on the additional features much but I do appreciate the online access which is straightforward and easy to use.  The mobile app works well on Android and iPhone but no love for my Windows phone.

name: Erin Case
review: I am generally a big fan of PNC Bank, and I really like my Virtual Wallet account. As long as I've been in the US I've never had any issues with it, and it's really great to be able to deposit checks at an ATM, as well as to transfer money so easily. The only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is that they are really difficult to get in touch with when you are abroad. They take up to an hour and a half to pick up their phone fairly often (and if you're abroad this can cost you quite a lot of money), and sometimes just never pick up. Otherwise, though, they are pretty great.

name: Clint McBride
review: I have never had a problem with my PNC virtual Wallet account except for when switching to it and ended up overdrafting my old PNC account.  The bank representative was very nice and helpful in refunding me the charge.  The web site and app makes it extremely easy to monitor and manage my money.

name: Randy S
review: I am very pleased with PNC Statement Savings.  At first I only had a checking account with them, and pretty much let it run itself, but now I have, thanks to them, taken a more active approach in moving my money around to my benefit.  They incentivize by having money moved from checking at least once a month (I do it once a week) in order to avoid the monthly charge.  In building up a savings this is a great and wonderful idea.  The customer service regarding both the accounts has also been very helpful, and even was able to reverse incorrect charges when I brought them to their attention.  I would highly recommend this service or account to anyone who was willing to be able to take control of their finances, as it has helped me tremendously.

name: Randy S
review: I have generally had great things to say about PNC's banking services overall.  The checking account is easy to use, and I have had little trouble setting up online banking, bill pay, and other such services that have been available to me.  There was one time I had an issue with overdraft protection fees not being properly disclosed with a link from savings; I was charged a fee to move money to cover such a thing; I brought this up to the bank, and they took care of it, so in that regard, I'm thrilled with the attentive service and checking account.

name: Selena Edwards
review: I give PNC bank 5 stars all the way around. I've banked with them for about a year and they are great. I say that because whenever I've had to go in the bank to discuss an issue, I've received great customer service and friendly bankers. I recently had to travel out of the U.S. and had an issue so I called in and my problem was resolved right away and also, I once again received great customer service. They have modern ATM that are more advanced than other banks I've dealt with. I have three accounts with them and I have been treated like a valued customer..no complaints here.

name: Melissa Wolff
review: I fully enjoy my interactions with BBVA Compass bank.  The tellers and account managers at the Tillman's Corner branch location in Alabama are amazing.  They are friendly and always willing to help with any questions I've had in applying for and choosing the best savings options.  I will be doing all of my banking at this location in the future.

name: Shawnie
review: When I started my new job last December, I was searching for another bank to deposit my paychecks without all of the hassle with fees. PNC has offered nothing but great customer service and has allowed me set up an account online and download the mobile application such as the Virtual Wallet. I must say that I have been able to save and budget my money wisely since I have used the Virtual Wallet.

name: Lauren
review: I am in LOVE with my PNC virtual wallet performance spend account. The account comes with 3 accounts linked together, 2 checking accounts and 1 savings account. The primary checking is your regular account that you spend money with your debit card or write checks from. The secondary checking is a great place to hold money that you would like to save, but aren't quite ready to commit to putting it in your savings account yet. And of the course the savings account is a higher interest earning account. The online banking for this account has MANY unique features and tools to help you manage your money and track your spending. You can compare month to month spending based on categories and find out where you save money. You can easily transfer money back and forth to your accounts with a click of a button. This is an amazing account for college students learning to manage money and also professionals who want more control over their accounts.

name: Michael K
review: I originally signed up for this account out of convenience. There is a branch in the supermarket right next door to where I live. But in the course of the last couple of years I've come to really enjoy the services provided by PNC. I've never been great with managing my money, but the PNC website is set up to help with that and it has helped me. I've still messed up here and there and been charged an overdraft fee, but the application of this has been more than fair unlike past banks I've used who try to take every opportunity to charge you a large fee. I do wish the Rewards Points system that PNC has in place offered more place to shop for rewards that were relevant to me. It seems that most rewards I can earn are from places that I have no reason to shop. Overall, banking at PNC has been a really good experience.

name: Christina
review: I live in a small town with several banks that I am not fond of. I research online checking accounts and found BBVA Compass. The closest one is 30 minutes away, but they offered the convenience of being able to deposit my checks on my phone app. The account opening process was easy, and done completely from my home. My only issue is that the phone app works great, but the deposit section of the app hasn't worked since I opened my account. Therefore, I have to travel to the next town over to deposit any checks.But I do like the fact that as long as I make a deposit before 8:30pm, it stills goes in on the same day, and they place no holds on any checks I have deposited. 4 stars because the deposit section of the app is non working, otherwise I would give 5.

name: Ramon Morales
review: I have my day to day checking account with them, and I'm fairly happy.  The drawbacks are that there aren't many locations close to me, which can be a challenge every once in a while.  Also, the fees can get a little over the top sometimes, but, service is decent, my company also banks with them.  All in all, I'm pretty satisfied with them.  There are other banks with more locations, such as the big banks, but, bigger banks don't have the quality of service that you would find here.

name: Hai Jiang
review: The reward points worth only a fraction of other credit card issuers points. Be careful before you apply it, because you'll really regret it.

name: celeste lee
review: I really like the virtual wallet.  My company banks with them as well so I also am eligible for workplace checking.  i have minimal fees and the customer service is phenomenal.  I did have an issue with a fee once and the representative at the branch in Jenkintown, Pa went above and beyond to get the issue resolved.  I am very happy with the account. The hours are great there is even a branch locally that is open on Sunday.  No complaints here.

name: Rebecca Branson
review: I have had a savings account with PNC for about fifteen years.  They have different options and this one was easy to open and does not cost anything to have - unlike some other banks' accounts(I'm looking at you Citizens Bank!).  Customer service is great, everyone I have dealt with was friendly and helpful.  PNC has many ATM machines so you are not hit with a lot of fees.  I only get a paper statement every three months but I don't really need more than that.  It is easy to move my money around on the PNC website and the transfers seem to post immediately.  The only reason I didn't rate it five stars was that the account pays next to nothing on my money, but that is true of any savings account right now.

name: Rebecca Branson
review: My son has this as his first checking account.  It has been very easy for him to use and he doesn't always have to go to the physical bank.  It has been a good introduction to banking and budgeting with his first job's paychecks.

name: Brian Russ
review: I have had a checking account with PNC Bank for over 20 years. I have always found them to be very helpful and able to answer any questions that I may have. The ability to use an account for automatic fund withdrawal in the case of an overdraft is a very helpful feature and has saved me on several occasions. My only issue would be that in order to have free checking you need to maintain a minimum balance and if you go below that balance you will be charged a fee without notification, I don't see this as a major issues but it is something to consider. I am sure I will be a PNC customer for a long time to come.

name: Steph Cathey
review: Little fees, but the fees they do apply are applied rather arbitrarily it seems. I find it much easier to transfer money between bank accounts at other banks with my PNC account than with other banks I have been a part of. Their hours are great, being open on weekends especially. I do sometimes have issue with my card being accepted at places-there seems to be an error with their debit cards that triggers a security lock which is why I still have my backup bank accounts. This is not a frequent issue, though.

name: Candice Hobson
review: I have had a free checking account through PNC for over two years. Until recently, I have been extremely satisfied with every aspect of the checking. However, just this past month, I realized I had been charged seven dollars per month for the last seven months. My address has not changed and neither has my email address. There is no excuse for not informing all customers of this new fee. I only signed up and maintained the account because it was a "FREE" checking account. How can they just start taking money every month without consent? I should have had to sign something return an email saying I agree to the new terms of my account or they will close it. I called customer service and was told "they sent out some letters last summer". I was refunded the $7 from this month, but the woman I spoke with said there was nothing she could do about the previous 6 months. Lesson learned, account closed. I will never use this bank again and I will also watch my accounts more closely in the future.

name: Brittany
review: I have always haas a nice experience at my local PNC bank. They handled a fraud issue I had very well a few years back. I also find that they're always friendly, and it's nice when they ask about your day and interact with you while you're there. I also really like virtual wallet, because I like seeing my bank statements and activity any time I want. They also contact me if they fear there is a unknown charge. I love PNC as a bank!

name: Nick Stojsavljevic
review: I started using a PNC checking account when they had representatives at my college. The representatives were very friendly and clearly outlined everything I wanted to know about the account. Later in the day I decided to go to a PNC bank to open an account and all of the people working there were so friendly and helpful.  Also the convenience of online banking was very enticing to me because I am on the move a lot.

name: Nate
review: I always find monthly fees for checking accounts to be a ridiculous theory. Spending money so I can spend money just doesn't make sense. It's a common practice, but honestly no bank should do this. The monthly fee is fortunately waived as long as you make direct deposits totaling $500 or more. The overdraft fees are high with a $32 per overdraft transaction plus $7 per day your account remains in a negative balance. They do have a grace period of a couple days, allowing you to make a deposit to cover the overdraft within that time frame to null and void the fees. So while they are lenient in allowing you to correct your mistake, the punishment/fee is still ludicrously high.Most of my deposits (direct deposits and checks) clear within a single business day and are available to use in my account. This is extremely fast, as most other banks take about 3-5 business days for funds to appear.The interest rate does not apply to me, as I normally do not save up the $2k mark. But even if I did, it's better off putting it into investments or a savings account with a higher interest rate. The interest rate here is laughable, but like most people, I use a checking account to spend money not save it. Still, if an account is advertised as "interest checking", the ability to gain that interest on your account should be more attainable.I use this checking account for disposable income, and like I said, I do not have $2k as disposable income per month. If you do, then I suppose the interest will be a nice little bonus for you.

name: Nick Stojsavljevic
review: I started using PNC since I started college and they offered me a student checking account. I love how the account offers a paper statement for no charge compared to my old bank Us Bank. I also like how there is no minimum balance on the checking account, which is good, since I like to keep as much money in my savings as possible and only keep enough in my checking for everyday spending. The staff is also helpful when I come in and explain everything I want to know in a clear and straightforward manner. I would recommend this account for anyone who wants a very straightforward and simple checking account.

name: Ian Goodwin
review: I signed up for this checking account while in college and I have had nothing good experiences. The checking account is reliable and easy to access. I enjoy the online banking component. There are several ATMs that are available for monetary withdraws for no fee. Unfortunately this checking account does not offer any interest and requires a hefty minmum balance of $2,500 to avoid monthly fees. That being said, PNC is a great bank. They are super friendly, and offer solid credit cards that they (probably) are more willing to provide to loyal members than those that do not bank with them.

name: Anne Lambert
review: We have used PNC Bank both in our personal and professional lives.  We have Virtual Wallet, and a standard business checking account.  We have loved the specialized customer service we receive any time we stop in the bank.  The tellers know our name and even remember our little dog whether she is with us or not.  I find the website very user friendly and always up to date with in seconds of making a purchase.  I have never had a frustrating experience with PNC in any capacity.  They are a joy to bank with.

name: Brian
review: It is hard to beat the interest rate offered by PNC bank select checking. As a young college student paying rent, insurance, and electric I rarely have enough in there to get charged any interest. That type of free checking with the quality customer service and reputation of PNC is hard to match. The also allow to enter your money into a money market account or relative low risk investment accounts, which are excatly what I am looking for. I would definitely recommend to anyone in their early twenties.

name: Heather
review: I have been with PNC now for about 8 years and have had a Virtual Wallet for the last 5 years. I love the convenience of online banking, and PNC makes it super easy. Their site is user friendly, and makes it simple to keep track of your finances with a Spend Calendar, Bill Pay, Transfer to other Accounts, and even has a way that you can set aside money within your Spend Account for a specific purpose, like saving up for a trip.

name: Andy H
review: The credit card is sleek and easy to use. Its for functionality rather than something that "pops" and has a designers appeal. The truth is this card is pretty hard to get. At first I was denied, but then I was approved within minutes. I have no idea why. The card works though, and since the PNC app helps with my life I can view my bank account on the go. I think the only downside to this card is the APR, its different for everyone. Mine was between 16-17% APR which is horrible. Since I payed my bills on time I avoided any late charges, so I did not mind the APR.

name: Ian Goodwin
review: I recently applied and was approved for a PNC CashBuilder Credit Card. I have had nothing but positive experiences with the card. The card is taken at every single location that I have tried to use. Better yet, paying your bill can be completed through your online banking site! This makes bill paying so easy, I am virtually guaranteed to never miss a payment. The cash back rewards program is nice too, although it would be nice if you could cash out before $50. I would highly recommend banking with PNC and signing up for a CashBuilder Credit Card.

name: Jerry Berg
review: I joined PNC when I saw a promotion for their Virtual Wallet. They offered a cash bonus for opening a checking account and doing direct deposit. I decided to give it a try, and have been very pleased. The Virtual Wallet is extremely helpful, and allows me to see all my activities on a graph. I get email alerts whenever I have a deposit go in, so I'm always up on what my balance is. They recently ran a promotion for their Visa Checkout. I signed up my debit card with them and received a Visa gift card in the mail within a week. So two thumbs up for a bank that has excellent customer appreciation and service.

name: Colin Lubbe
review: Love PNC bank. I have been banking with them since February 2012. We were banking with Capital One 360 and they provided horrible customer service and problem resolution. We have never had an issue with PNC. Living in Philadelphia, there are plenty of branches and ATMs to utilize. The online interface (Virtual Wallet) is extremely easy to use. A+ company.

name: Be Love
review: After being a satisfied PNC customer for many years (I was with National City at the time of the takeover, and, surprisingly, I'm a bigger fan of PNC than I was of National City), I recently opened a Statement Savings account to begin saving for my grandchildren's future, and was pleased to learn that the monthly fee ($4) could be waived if I transfer at least $25 from my checking to that savings account or if I maintain a $400 balance in my savings. I also found out that the fee could be avoided if the account was specifically for a minor child (as opposed to several children, lol). There was no minimum balance requirement to open the account; it took a few brief moments, and with a nominal deposit, the account was opened. I am unsure if it accumulates interest, but I do know it allows me to confidently save. :)

name: Jack Browning
review: PNC has been a great company to my family and I in all aspects.  We have had our accounts since before they bought out National City and were worried about what changes would come from it, as well as if we would have to switch companies.  The switch went so smooth we decided to stay with them, and we are glad we did.  They have ATM's in a lot of places, which is great for us, always being on the go.  Their staff is always kind and helpful whenever we need them, and we're on a first-name basis with our local branch, which is comforting.  Highly recommend PNC to any one who needs to open a bank account, or switch to better company.

name: Coty Flanigan
review: I have used PNC since they were National City Bank. I feel that they kept their same morals and principals when they converted. Each time I have had an issue it was dealt with simply over the phone or in person. I'm not usually on hold very long when I have a question about my account or any problems that are occurring. I would recommend using PNC as they are good to work with and are just about all over the place.

name: Sarah W
review: I've had a PNC account for years. I recently switched to the Virtual Wallet. I love it! No excessive bank visits, mobile check deposit, no fees and easy to use website. It also included a short term savings, long term savings and checking. ATM reimbursement too! I had one episode of someone hacking my card, but PNC blocked it and called me right away. All the money never left my checking account. As a graduate student, I am always on high alert for identity theft, but PNC caught it before I did. I will continue with PNC for as long as they are around!

name: Pete
review: PNC Virtual Wallet is a great account to have if you want to manage your checking and savings account all in one screen online.  The online interface is easy to learn and easy to use.  It's very easy to transfer money between all your PNC accounts, including checking, savings and PNC credit cards.  It is also easy to send money to outside accounts through PopMoney. You can set up BillPay to pay one time and regularly occurring bills. Overall, this is the best checking account I've ever had. And on top of all of that it's free as long as you meet the balance requirements.  The one downside is that you are limited in the amount of in-bank visits you can make before you get charged a fee for each time you use services inside the bank.  Online banking and ATM banking can be used whenever you like.

name: Thomas Santell
review: I used PNC checking account for a few years. I closed it a couple years ago when I moved, to change to a local bank. However, PNC was a good bank to use. It was simple to understand their policies and they were fair. I was a student so I had a better interest rate, which was nice. The staff was always helpful with me and polite. I never had any problems that I had to call  customer service about. I would recommend this bank.

name: John Fleming
review: I have been with PNC for over 10 years. I upgraded my checking account to a virtual wallet a few years ago and it was a great decision. I love the website and being able to track my spending using the calendar. Being able to see what you have as well as what is going out soon is so helpful. I also use online bill pay and it is fast and easy.  The customer service is always great if I ever have any questions. If you are looking for a new checking account I highly recommend PNC Virtual Wallet Spend.

name: Maddie Walker
review: I cannot say enough kind things about the checking service by PNC. Their Virtual Wallet with Performance Spend option was the first thing offered to me when I got a new job with direct deposit, and of course with the direct deposit they waived the monthly fee. I do not think I would pay 15 dollars a month for the online service knowing that there are free ones elsewhere, but I like it because it's free. What I like is easy transfers from checking to savings by "clicking the pig". He's very cute. I appreciate easy printouts of paperwork I need for taxes too. The app can be buggy. Sometimes the app refuses to open on my Android phone for no reason, but they do update it often and fix the problems every few days. Best part of PNC checking is being able to take pictures of checks and deposit them using my phone. Makes checking so, so easy!

name: Maddie Walker
review: I have always enjoyed banking with PNC and this savings account is a solid part of the performance banking online program that they sign you up for right off the bat. The online interface lets you see your savings right next to your reserve and spending and they make transfers easy. One thing I don't like about the savings account is that the interest rate varies from a lower rate to a higher rate and you only get the higher rate if you use the debit card attached to your checking account at least 5 times a month. Otherwise the savings interest rate is a default low rate like 1 percent. When you use the debit card at least 5 times, you get a higher savings around 5 percent. Customer service at PNC is always good and there are lots of branches in my city.

name: Emily
review: I've had a PNC bank account for about 7 years, and have had a virtual wallet account for about 3 years. The Virtual Wallet account is a really great tool to help budget my finances.  I especially like that I can see what my account balance will be on certain days (if you have reoccurring bills every month it will account for that).  I also really like that I can have a 'separate' account within the account, specifically set up to help me achieve my long term and short term goals.  It makes saving up for things like vacation much easier. I would highly recommend this account.

name: Marc Voorhees
review: I switched from a Chase checking product almost two years ago, and I couldn’t be happier. The online virtual wallet interface is one of the best online banking products I have seen, and it helps keep me on top of my finances. The interest rate for the performance account is small, but nice, however, the lack of a checkbook is a bit annoying (You can buy one, it just isn’t included). This coupled with the PNC Savings account I have, makes a very powerful and convenient online checking and savings tool.

name: Dave Brandt
review: I've had PNC Virtual Wallet for about four years now. Managing the account online is fantastic, and the mobile site is also very nice. I've dealt with customer service several times and each time was very good with a fast response. In cases where my account has had some "issues" thanks to Target or Home Depot, the customer service cleaned them up as soon as I brought them up with no problems. The interest rate is pretty abysmal, but as far as a basic point of action checking account, Virtual Wallet is fantastic.

name: Michael Huffman
review: I have been a member of PNC since 1999, and the virtual wallet is the best checking account that I have had.  I was drawn to an offer for free checking through being a student at my university.   The mobile app is so nice, and the online banking is better.  I am able to easily move funds from the "reserve" account to the "spend" account, making it simple to save money for things like rent, and groceries, then move it to my spend when I need to write a check or go shopping.  The "growth" account I haven't done much with.  All of the online graphs, systems for automatic payments, mobile deposit make this account great.

name: Dave Brandt
review: Just like everyone else here has written, the PNC Flex Visa Card is above average, but not great. The points benefits are not spectacular at 4 points per dollar. The upside is that there is not an upper limit on how many points you can accumulate, so hoarding points is possible (but not recommended).  The balance transfer fee of 4% is decent, but not great.The issue is that you need very good credit rating to get this card. It’s a decent card, but you can get much better rewards than are available with the PNC Flex Visa Card. If you qualify and are comfortable with the rewards given, go for it. Personally, I’d look around a bit more.

name: James
review: This bank is great and I enjoy my checking experience with them very much, I have never had a problem with them that was not just a phone call and a helpful representative away from being resolved. I have never had an issue with my money at this bank ever, The branch is very nice as well maintained and all of their tellers are quite nice and very knowledgeable, they really make you feel like home every time you come in, I would recommend this bank to all my family and friends and I plan to be with them for many more years to come.

name: Blank Blank
review: Bad card, no incentive, annual fee, poor customer service, terrible experience with this card.

name: David Parmelee
review: Good card with no annual fee and easy-to-understand cash reward system.

name: Javier Orellano
review: My experience with PNC has been very positive. I had an issue with a charge that I did not recognize and customer service was very helpful and we got the issue resolved quickly. I had a similar problem at my previous bank and it was a nightmare. I would recommend this bank to anyone.

name: Rhea Jaisingh
review: The only reason I signed up with a checkings account with this bank was because of the virtual wallet. If you have a virtual wallet account, it waves the monthly fee. However, you cannot see a banker or you will get charged. You are only limited to a maximum of 500 cash withdrawal but I was only allowed to withdraw $300. They do not give checks when you open the account, you have to pay for them. My experience with PNC was very frustrating which led me making the decision to close my account with them.

name: justus jackson
review: I've been a member of PNC for 10 years now and they have certainly kept up with the times. They offer what amounts to be a free checking account if you use your debit card 5 times a month, which since most people don't carry cash and use a card is very reasonable. Their online interface is easy to understand and informative.

name: Peter Brooks
review: I've been using a checking account at PNC for several years now and it has mostly been a pleasant experience. The convenience of their services has been great and their online system is very easy to use. Once I had an issue due to making a purchase while overseas but this was easy to solve with a call. It does emphasize the security they provide my money. I appreciate the emails they send when anything odd happens on the account, such as failed login attempts or the balance dropping beyond a certain point. Fees have not been excessive. Transferring funds between services such as Paypal or amazon payments to my account has been easy and issue free with transfer times being reasonable. Overall a great experience and I have no intentions of going elsewhere.

name: Lisa Hollstegge
review: I first joined PNC when they were offering a bonus to join through my previous employer. The bonus money was deposited as promised. I transfer money out of this account easily. I like the 'tap' feature on the Visa card. The security features they have are great to the point of being annoying. I'm glad they are in place, but they can be a pain sometimes. The other thing that I'm surprised about is that no one reached out to me to offer/sell additional services based on my account value. I have about half as much at a competitor and they have contacted me. Overall, I would recommend PNC for checking accounts. I was also at the branches frequently making business deposits. The tellers are the friendliest out there! They helped me resolve deposit slip discrepancies on a couple occasions, and were very patient while I communicated with our store.

name: Laura Danford
review: I currently have a savings account that is part of my checking account. I love the fact that I am able to save money and watch it grow. The most important to me is long term savings and I was given that option when I opened my account. PNC has looked out for me from day one, and I trust they will continue to do so. I would recommend PNC to every one I come into contact with.

name: Jack
review: PNC SHUT MY ACCOUNT OF 7 YEARS WHICH I HAVE BEEN USING CONSISTENTLY WITHOUT ANY EMAIL OR PHONE CALL.  UNACCEPTABLE. I have been with PNC bank for about 7 years, and until last week, would have given them a rating of "A", 5 out of 5 stars, in spite of having heard complaints about them without even looking for complaints.  Earlier this year, I suddenly started getting a $7 monthly charge on what had been a free checking account since I joined 7 years ago.  I inquired, they refunded the one month charge, and explained that they have no more standard free checking, but that I could avoid the charge by switching to virtual wallet.   I took time out of my schedule during their business hours, personally visited one of their branches, and signed up for virtual wallet.  They were quite helpful.  This was a couple of months ago.  Last week, checking my account online, as I have several times a week for 7 years now, I saw that my balance was zero, my account transaction history was gone, and also my messages to and from PNC in the "secure message center" had been erased.  When I called, a helpful sounding phone rep asked me to hold while he looked into it.  When he returned, he told me that PNC had decided to shut the one of my 3 accounts (all virtual wallets have 3 accounts as far as I know) which I was using, very obviously using, because they had sent a letter to me for verification and I had not returned their verification letter within 30 days. NOT ACCEPTABLE FROM ANY BANK:  They did not send me any message about this in the "secure message center" online where I check on my account several times a week.  They did not send me any email about this to my email address, which they happily send many advertising emails to each and every week.  They did not call me about this, at my phone number which they have on file.  Also, to my email address, they sent an email just last week that "my online statement is available for viewing" referencing the account which they had just shut down without contacting me in any way other than one paper letter via snail mail with a 30 day "respond with our verification as requested or we shut your account with no other contact attempted" policy??  TOTALLY INEPT AND UNACCEPTABLE.  Since I have contacted them about this, they have shut a 2nd one of my 3 virtual wallet accounts, and seem to be blocking my adding funds to the one remaining account. THIS IS HOW A BANK GOES FROM AN "A" RATING TO AN "F" RATING INSTANTLY WITH CUSTOMERS.  Period.  Bottom line, don't use PNC Bank, not for anything.  If you do use them, don't trust them.  Don't fall for their advertising gimmicks about virtual wallet.  One of the very clearly specified ways to qualify for "free virtual wallet" is to only deposit or withdraw money online or by ATMs.  I followed this to the letter.  What did I get, in addition to "free virtual wallet" ??  I got "shut~down of your bank accounts, with no contact other than a paper letter which is basically a 30 day time~bomb."  People TRAVEL...  HELLO???  ANY such verification should have a 60 day time window before any such troubles, at the very least, even better, make it 90 days.  Shutting down customer accounts with NO OTHER CONTACT ATTEMPTED beyond the paper letter 30-day time-bomb is RIDICULOUS, PATHETIC, and TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE for any "BANK."  A "BANK" should keep a customer's money IN the customer's account, and make EVERY ATTEMPT TO CONTACT the customer IN EVERY WAY before making ANY CHANGES at all, that is OBVIOUS AND CLEAR. For these reasons, I have changed my rating of PNC Bank from "A" to "F" with no stops in between, and warn EVERYONE AGAINST PNC BANK and their gimmick "virtual wallet."

name: Laura Danford
review: I have been using PNC as my bank for 4 years now and by far they are the best I have had any dealings with. I like that they offer a checking account along with two additional savings accounts, one short term and one long term. There is also a feature to monitor your spending habits, which helps to see where all your money is going each month and where you can make changes to save save more money. For the most part these accounts are free and you don't find that every where now days. ATM charges a refunded if you have to use a non-bank atm, and most all additional features are free to customers. I wouldn't change banks for anything at this point.

name: Todd
review: I have had my savings account with PNC Bank for almost 19 years.  They are an excellent bankfor me to have my savings account with.  The customer serviceis excellent and they explained everything I need to knowabout the account.   I usually try to keep at least 500.00in my savings account in case I need it for a rainy day.  I willcontinue to do business with PNC Bank.  I recommend anybodywho is interested in signing up to call PNC Bank.

name: Regan Williams
review: I love this account with PNC! It is perfect for me right now for several reasons. The best feature is that you do not have to maintain a minimum balance. This is such a huge stress relief because as a student you are broke majority of the time and need to use all the money you have.

name: Sarah Bolton
review: This is a great basic checking account. The customer service is great, the online banking is fast, easy to use and always accurate. There are an abundance of locations with ATMS. The checking card that comes with it is free and very easy to use.I would recommend this account to anyone looking for just a plain old checking account!

name: Tania Goncalves
review: I've been using virtual wallet for several years now. It is an easy way to manage my money, and has been linked to my savings account so I never have to worry about over-draft fees. The interest rate is one of the best you will find on a checking account. They refund any ATM surcharge you may experience from using a non-PNC ATM which is always nice when you are in a jam and need money quickly. Overall, I have been very impressed with PNC virtual wallet performance spend.

name: Todd
review: I think PNC Bank checking is awesome.  I have had a checking account with PNC Bank now for 18 years.  It is easy because I do not have to carry cash with me all the time.  The Customer Service Reps are very friendly and helpful for any questions I may have.  It is very user friendly to use my debit card, and there is no fee when one uses their PNC Bank debit card at a PNC mac machine.  I hope to continue my relationship with PNC Bank with my checking account.

name: Laurie Lecocq
review: I absolutely love having my bank account through PNC.  I have the PNC Virtual Wallet Student Account, and love that I don't incur any monthly fees.  A lot of accounts that offer no fees have a bunch of different stipulations-like making you keep a higher minimum balance in your checking account at all times, but with this account, I don't have to.  Not having to worry about what dropping below a certain minimum balance makes this account great!  One of the features besides the Virtual Wallet that I use a lot is online bill pay.  I was able to set up all my bills, so once I get my different bills each month, all I have to do is log in, choose the company that I want to pay, (Example: My Capital One Credit Card)  type in the amount that I want to pay, along with the date that I want it paid, and click select.  I also love that you can see you previous billing history of what accounts you have paid in the past.  This is exceptionally great because I don't have to worry about saving and filing a receipt.  I highly recommend the PNC Virtual Wallet Student Checking Accounts!

name: Logan Wiley
review: I've banked at PNC for several months now. The customer service at my local branches is excellent, representatives are friendly, and always greet you with a smile. The virtual wallet presents a new dimension to online banking which makes banking relatively easy with the growth/spend/save in one account. Makes it extraordinarily easy to manage everything from the tip of your fingertips on your phone. I look forward to doing business with them in the future.

name: Carmen Smith
review: Virtual Wallet is great, when it works, which isn't very often.  It is either slow to load or doesn't load at all.  Need a major fix, has been going on for a long time, and PNC hasn't done anything about it.

name: Lori Hart
review: This bank is awful! They charge you $7 a moth for just having the account and then they will rearrange you deposits and debits as to take to make it appear that your account was overdrawn for a minute. Then they will take $36 from you. I had a fair large amount of money in my account and suddenly I see an overdraft charge, big problem nowhere on statement is it overdrawn. When call about this issue I'm given the run around and lots of different reasoning for this so called charge. I have filed a case with consumerfinance.gov. I would tell you to definately not use this bank unless you have money to throw away.

name: Kate
review: In the past, I have banked at a few other banks. After moving, I decided to switch banks. I started an account with PNC, and I have been pleased ever since. They are there for me when I have questions regarding my account. If there is an issue, the issue is always quickly resolved. The customer service is excellent, and they have helped me plan for my financial future. I talked with a representative about my finances, and they gave me advice to help secure my financial future.

name: Andrea Sutter
review: My only complaint with this type of checking is the disappearance of PNC Points. I originally had a regular, plain checking ( I'm not sure what PNC calls that as it was National City when I opened it. PNC took over National City.) and loved adding up  PNC points for paying bills and using my debit card. However, they took the PNC Points away from that. When I called to ask if I could get My Points back, I was told I qualified for Performance checking and advised to switch. My Performance checking accrued points for a while but then I got a notice that the points program was going to end for it too. Now the only way that I know of to get points is to use my PNC credit card. I've been using debit only because I'm trying to get off of the credit cards.

name: Tin Le
review: Recently, I just applied for an trial online service. It turns out to be a scam. I tried to contact them to cancel the service but most of time, there is no reply. Finally, It lets me cancel the service. But when I check my account, I see i keeping charging me $10 per month. So, I contact the PNC customer to block it from charging my card. Then I hope it will work this time.

name: Adam A
review: I have had a savings account with PNC bank for four years now. It has been a great experience. They first set me up with a savings account when I opened my checking account with them. They gave me a great rate and thanks to auto deposit from my checking, my savings account grows monthly. The interest rate has been great for growing my nestegg into a reliable safety net for me and my family.

name: Adam A
review: I switched to PNC after moving to a city that no longer had my old bank branch. However I had no clue what I was missing out on by having a bank that actually cares! They have worked with me on several occasions to help me maximize my benefits as well as giving me adequate time to clear up any mishaps that happen. I now have multiple accounts with them and could not be happier, plus their mobile app makes online banking really easy!

name: Sonia Garcia
review: BBVA Compass is actually a Spanish Bank (Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria) and I have had really good experiences with them. When I opened my checking account with them; although the banker assigned to me was new and had never opened an account. He was quite friendly and professional. I could tell he was a bit nervous but over all he held his own; at one time asked a manager for assistance and kept me entertained by conversing with me when he needed a little more time. There were many occasions when tellers asked if I wanted my deposit in my account right away and offered to make them available immediately. I was really impressed by their service. Every time I strolled into the BBVA Compass Bank I was greeted with a very friendly manner, offered additional services but not a pushy manner at all. I could tell they are about business and growing. They even give out referral cards and do reward you with a considerable amount of money for referring someone to bank with them. As a matter a fact- I myself opened an account because they offered $100 to open an account at the time. And they have excellent customer service center; offer second chance banking and over all make banking an enjoyable experience.

name: Andrea Leonard Targonski
review: We opened a savings account at PNC in correspondence with a home equity line of credit. We liked that the rates were in line what other banks were paying and the bank has convenient hours and many locations in the area in which we live. We keep a fairly small balance in this account, but we have never had any issues or concerns. We also liked that there are a lot of PNC ATM machines in Wawas and other stores in our area so we could access our money easily if necessary. We would open other accounts there as well and have considered moving all of our accounts to this bank.

name: Katy
review: Overall my experience with BBVA Compass was a positive one. I really appreciated that their customer service department was open late (until 11 PM), so that if I had a question after standard business hours I didn't have to worry about making time to give them a call and get it taken care of. I also liked the ability to deposit cash and checks into my account at the ATM. My biggest complaints about BBVA Compass are that in one instance they only sent me a letter to tell me that they would be sending me a new debit card due to some kind of possible vulnerability Visa had alerted them about; I had recently moved and did not receive this letter, so didn't realize my credit capacity on my debit card was slowly lowering until I was denied a purchase at a gas station. I found it frustrating that they had not called or emailed me regarding this and had only sent a letter. I also found the frequent survey calls to ask how your experience was at your branch recently to be a little annoying; they called after nearly every transaction I made in the drive through or in the branch. All in all, BBVA Compass was a good bank and had I not moved to another state I would likely still be with them.

name: Angela Christina
review: The biggest problem I've encountered with PNC Bank is trying to get a small personal loan for 1000 dollars. I understand my credit isn't the best, which I immediately brought up before we even got started. I have been a loyal customer with zero overdrafts on my checking account for the last 2 years, I also have a car loan through a credit union which has no late payments and most importantly I have been working a steady job with a weekly paycheck that is directly deposited into my account. The woman I spoke with told me there was a high chance for a loan considering all of these things but once she ran my credit and saw that I almost  have zero credit built up, a 'thin file', she turned very nasty and out right told me if I needed a load then I should just go to a Cash Land and get a payday loan. Not only was that very unprofessional  but I also found to to be very demeaning that a woman working at a bank would even suggest that.

name: Erin Grupp
review: PNC Virtual Wallet has worked out great for me, its super user friendly and easy to manage. I can handle everything online and check my balance and activity right on my smartphone. I've never had a problem with PNC and their customer service has always been great, which I truly appreciate.

name: Ryan Wackerly
review: I love my PNC Virtual Wallet but that $15.00 monthly fee can be a bit tricky.  There are some months where I do deposit more than $2,000 but it is no always consistent.  Sometimes I get charged the fee and sometimes I do not. I wish they had a better option so I would not be charged the fee. I also think the over draft charge is a little high.  I try to be a good consumer and not go into overdraft but there are times when my math has been off and I went into overdraft.  A 24 hour grace period would be nice as well.

name: Alicia Conklin
review: In general I really like the Virtual Wallet, the only issue that I've had with it is the online banking.  I find that it really doesn't work too well with Google Chrome.  I often can see only the front page but can't get in to see the actual account activity.  If I open in Internet Explorer it works fine, but since Internet Explorer is not my preferred internet browser, this kind of makes it a pain to log into.  I also have had more fraud occur while using my PNC Debit Card then I ever did with any other bank.  I don't know if that's just coincidence, since I have heard there's been a surge of debit card fraud lately, or if it's something with PNC's security.

name: Erin Grupp
review: I have never had a problem with this card, building up cash is easy. I even had a problem with my card being hacked once, and right away my card was replaced just in case someone had gotten a hold of the number! I highly recommend this card.

name: Mary
review: I have been a customer of PNC for many years.  I exclusively use their checking services and have found that they have wonderful customer service and support.  What I love the most is that they let me use my old checks from National City instead of forcing me to buy new checks.  It has made life so much easier.  Anytime I call with questions they courteous and helpful.

name: Greg Spencer
review: The only fee that's a humongous problem for me is the maintenance fee. Why am I paying for this fee when it's impossible to transfer money when they are doing maintenance? This is ironic and very redundant. I understand that security can be an issue; but why charge me when you can't provide these capabilities? For example: I've been trying to put money on this card to provide my kid with some back to school shopping for over 3 days! Then again, I've learned that all the new and popular stuff that corporations and banks do is very unreliable. Nonetheless, I'm happy that my bank can provide this rather than paying more for even more unreliable cards such as GreenDot.

name: Crystal Harris
review: Just got a new account after closing my chase account. PNC so far i am happy i went into the bank to open this account. They are really nice at the location i went in Lansing, Mi the employee greet every customer. They told me about all the fee's and how i would be able to get the most out of my account. I really feel like they educated me about what i can look forward to when it comes to managing daily usage of my debit card.

name: Drew
review: I have the PNC Virtual Wallet with Performance Spend checking, but I'm here to talk about the growth (savings account).  The interest rate is, like most accounts available, terrible, but what makes it worse is that I have to maintain 15,000 dollars across ALL accounts in order to gain a higher rate.  If I don't maintain that exorbitant amount, I not only get poor interest but massive monthly fees.  It is convenient because of the online banking, but that doesn't outweigh the negatives of the savings account.

name: Victor Diaz
review: I'm a college student and this card is a great way to start building small credit on a very limited budget, although it is a basic card with no rewards its still a nice card to have. I use mine for purchases such as gas and food. You do not have to have a bank account with PNC, I just went in place my security deposit and a week or two later I received my card

name: Laura Danford
review: I have been a customer for 5 years now and have had no problems while working with PNC. I actively use PNC's Virtual Wallet account, and by far this is the only bank I have ever used that treats me like a person. I had an issue when I went to a local branch and tried to deposit cash in the ATM. When I put the cash in it jammed and I wasn't able to retreive my money nor could I deposit more cash. I went inside the branch, right at closing time on a Saturday, and talked with the branch manager who was very helpful in giving me a provisional credit for the amount of money I had already deposited so that I could still use my funds through my checking account. This process took over an hour but all employees remained in the bank branch until I was satisfied. This is what I call service.

name: Buzz
review: I've liked BBVA's service from the start. It's a Spanish company and when Spain was having economic problems, I was concerned, but there haven't been any problems at all. The girls at the counters are always helpful and nice. The managers are competent. I like that there are no fees at all with my direct deposit. When I had to get something notarized there  was no fee. The banks in the stores have great hours. AND they have NBA credits cards!

name: bob broshack
review: I have had a checking account with this bank for years. I love the virtual wallet as I can control everything from my computer. In addition, whenever I do visit a local branch, the customer service is bar none. And as an added bonus, all ATM fees are reimbursed so I can use any ATM I would like! I would highly recommend this bank to anyone. I have not delved into the other services that PNC offers but I am sure that they are great as well.

name: LilTim Manning
review: I have been a member of PNc for 7 years prior to closing my account in 2013 the customer service was vary good although sometimes it seems like they side tracked me about my money. its been times i couldnt take out what i needed to take out from the atm .and also i used my checking account to pay a bill recently and money disappeared in thin air almost thats why i closed my account but otherwise good service

name: Michael Giavasis
review: I find PNC to be a good enough bank if you always have your ducks in a row. There are certainly banks out there that provide perks that PNC does not.For instance, many banks provide 24 hour overdraft protection. If you happen to overdraft, they give you 24 hours to get your account in the green before a fee. PNC does not provide this. I have opted out of overdraft fees myself, but occasionally an automated bill will dip my account into the negative. At first, I was stunned to receive an overdraft fee, but the bank explains that auto-bill pay is protected when you opt out. This was never explained to me at first, so the disclosure wasn't as clear as I would have liked. Customer service is always polite, patient, and helpful, but I can't think of a single thing that makes my checking account special at all. I have a checking account card. I put money in. I take money out. There are no extra bells and whistle. No extra perks. My family always tries me get me to switch to their bank because they say there's much more flexibility.

name: Mateo Reate
review: I've been using PNC's virtual wallet account now for over a year, and its been great. It's easy to login to their app on my phone to check any balance. PNC has also made every effort to help me along the way. They usually refund any ATM fees I incur, and were more than willing to forgive a time where I overdrew my account accidentally.  I can't see myself going anywhere else.

name: Samantha Bree
review: I love PNC Virtual Wallet. The app is amazingly accurate, and compared to my old bank, they process deposit transactions extremely fast. It takes about a day for any refund returns or deposits to reach my account, compared to about two or three days with TD and Citizens Bank. For people that don't have PNC Virtual Wallet, it's a really cool, new way to look at banking. When you open a Virtual Wallet account, PNC gives you three accounts, a Spend account (checking), a Reserve account (short-term savings/checking hybrid), and a Growth account (savings). I did have one issue with PNC that was a little annoying. The way PNC does overdrafts, they take money from your Growth account to cover NSFs and debit card overdrafts. The problem is, there is a federal regulation of 6 electronic withdrawals from any savings account. Even if you make a deposit or transfer the money yourself, you will still have the amount transferred to cover the negative balance. Even if you call customer service, they are unable to cancel the transaction. If this happens to you, you'll be in danger of losing your account. I had this happen to me recently, and I was extremely displeased. Otherwise, PNC Virtual Wallet gets top marks!

name: Joshua Dermott
review: I have had my savings account with BBVA for over 5 years now. Their customer service has always been extremely helpful and timely. I have had many offers to transfer my account elsewhere but always decline due to the high level of satisfaction I have received from this great bank! BBVA is very forgiving when "life" situations happen such as minor over-drafts etc. These kinds of things happen for one reason or another and Compass has always helped me through them.

name: Tyler
review: I have had an account with Compass for more than a decade and have had very few issues. The most recent experience that comes to mind as a serious situation that they handled very well was when I lost my wallet. The cards were used many times within the first few hours of the wallet being lost. Compass was very easy to deal with when it came to alerting them to the lost card and getting a new one mailed out to me. They were also very good about reversing all of the fraudulent charges made on the card. I have all my automatic deposits set up  through Compass and I like them very much.

name: Griffin Emerson
review: I have always had a good experience with PNC and my Virtual wallet account very easy online banking and I can deposit checks at most PNC ATM's (the most common bank in my city) an A strong national presence.  Checks are processed as fast my old bank.   Also I like that I get a Steelers Debit card.   No fees is a big plus also.   I don't use them for my credit card but I doubt I would ever change my checking account from them A very satisfied customer.

name: Justyn L.
review: I've been with PNC ever since I moved from NY to MI 4 years ago. They're a great bank and I've never felt like I've wanted to switch since joining. Their recent business moves have been something to get used to, but I love that they've started working on their online services, especially the virtual wallet program which has been my favorite tool to use since it was introduced. It's saved me a lot of money with the tools they have for budgeting, and the interest rates in general are pretty generous. My only complaint would have to be that I have had the unlucky experience of meeting some poor customer service reps and bank tellers, which really diminishes the great banking PNC does. Regardless of that, though, I love PNC and I don't see myself switching any time soon.

name: Liz Sutton
review: I have enjoyed my experience with PNC. Not long ago I have my account hacked and thank goodness PNC actually follows the laws on what to do for this. I work in financial crimes and many bank try to make people wait to "investigate" the matter. PNC immediately credited my funds back to my account so that I did not have to worry about having everything bounce and have no access to cash at all. I love banking with PNC

name: Alex
review: I've had a very frustrating experience with PNC just recently. I was applying for housing in the DC area and needed to transfer $500 to the owner as a down payment. However, PNC held up the transfer of money for no adequate reason and froze my ability to transfer money. I had to sit on the phone for 40 minutes to sort the issue through. I was never given an explanation for why this occurred. The PNC representative was very respectful and understanding, but this was still incredibly annoying. I almost missed the payment deadline because of this needless interruption. I've had decent service from them beforehand and afterwards, but it'll be a while before I can put this behind me.

name: Ashlee Headley
review: I have been with PNC bank for two years now.  PNC has recently switched their services and I have joined the Virtual Wallet account that they offer.  I was a little skeptical to join the Virtual Wallet because it involves holding on to three accounts and keeping track.  The idea was intimidating.  I didn't feel the virtual wallet website was very user friendly when I first began using it.  However, it's a matter of just exploring to get the hang of it. The customer service is wonderful there.  Whenever a customer walks into their building they are greeted with a smile and a hello.  The representatives at the branch are always kind and courteous and apologize to the customers for the delayed wait if there happens to be one.The location of PNC banks are very convenient.  They are scattered through the county I live in perfectly, so there is always one within reach.The only complaint I would say I have with my checking account is that there is a $500 withdrawal from the ATM per day.

name: Mark
review: I am a third generation account holder at PNC. While I have only been a customer for just over 4 years, I have always had a great experience. I am a student and the Virtual Wallet checking account is simple to use and maintain. Pairing it with its no fees it is wonderful. The online interface is a bit slow to load, but once it is loaded, it has all necessary information in an easy to use manner. The fact that you can customize the page to fit your needs is a nice perk as well. I will be staying with PNC for a while.

name: Angel Shifflett
review: I initially joined PNC after my car accident back in 2004.  I opened up a savings account and a CD.  When I opened up the CD initially I had it set for a year before I was able to touch the money in the CD.  I would incur a fee if I had.  It was about a year and a half before I actually needed to pay for something and I needed to use some of the money from the CD.  I went into the bank and was told that my CD was set for a 5 year plan and that if I were to take money out now, I would incur more fees.  I proceeded to show them the paperwork saying it was only for a year and that I was in fact able to take the money out.  The representative was very unfriendly and rude to me, stating that my paperwork was incorrect and that there wasn't much they could do for me.  I ended up having to go to their corporate office and after about 2 weeks finally got everything settled with them.  Needless to say, I decided to take my money elsewhere.

name: Rain Bee
review: I switched from Wells Fargo bank to Pnc three years ago. I felt wells fargo would constantly charge fees for almost every little thing. I was charged $12.00 when the funds in my savings account was used for my overdraft protection. I immediately switched to pnc and signed up for a free checking account. I have not been charged one fee since. There was one situation where i wrote a check which exceeded my account balance. I was told I had until 10pm that night to make a deposit before being fined. They also have amazing employees!

name: Curtis Jones
review: I switched my checking account over from TCF Bank after I graduated from college. Comparing it to friends, relatives and my previous experiences with checking accounts, it is the best checking account/banking solution.  The only negative thing I have to say is that at least in Milwaukee, where I live, the locations are not particularly convenient, but there are so many online and mobile resources I hardly need to go into a bank at all.   The features I like most are unlimited ATM fee reimbursement, integrated savings account and credit card account all on the same screen, mobile check deposit, and the online interface. I would recommend this account to anyone.

name: Liz Sutton
review: I started with PNC a few years ago after a bad experience with a credit union. I am not a fan of the typical large banks so I was not very adamant about using PNC. I have to say I was very wrong, they have GREAT customer service and have treated me with nothing but respect from the minute I opened my account with them. I am so pleased I went with this bank.

name: Eric Howard
review: I switched to PNC 6 months ago, one of the best decisions i have ever made! PNC makes managing my money through virtual wallet a quick and easy task. I can set up bill pay, automatic money transfers and my favorite feature POP money with which i can transfer money to other PNC banking members with zero fees. This makes it super easy for me and my girlfriend to send money back and forth to each other. I have never had a problem with the website and i recommend it to all my friends. Virtual Wallet you made banking easy for me and i'm thankful for that!

name: ANETA OBALEK
review: I've had a couple of accounts with BBVA Compass when my wallet got stolen and both of them were compromised. When I reported the incident, the bank immediately froze my accounts. When the personal banker at my branch was getting ready to open a new checking and savings account for me, I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of research she'd done regarding my previous accounts and what my financial goals are. She was then able to put my money in a savings account that would maximize my profit based on my needs.

name: Holuwahshyna Elohri
review: Upon my arrival in the U.S, I was scared to have money deposited in any banking institution, as I was not sure of how the procedure was; the charges and operation ethics. However, I have heard and read about so many bad experiences some foreigners have had, due to certain reasons that included not adequately understanding what they signed up for. With adequate research and visits to all major banks here in Michigan, I finally chose to open up a Virtual wallet checking account with PNC Bank.I am happy I made that decision, as the bank official who attended to me was named Maria, and yes, she did act as one. She helped me understand everything step by step, including the do’s and don’ts, she made sure I got the best service when it comes to inquiry whenever I visited because my funds were geared towards a successful professional degree. With no doubt, the services at the PNC bank I opened my account are very welcoming and supporting, each and every one of them always did find time to explain any solution thoroughly to whatever questions I may had. It is a very good experience and I find it welcoming and have never stepped into any other PNC bank branch because I was welcomed and not treated as a stranger when I stepped into PNC bank on the 28th Street, Grand Rapids.

name: Marie Burke
review: I've been a member of PNC with a Virtual Wallet checking account for over four years now.  I began banking with PNC Virtual Wallet Performance Spend checking at least two years ago.  I have really enjoyed using PNC as my primary bank because the Virtual Wallet platform, mobile banking apps, and many locations are very convenient.  The Performance Spend account allows you to earn higher interest on your purchases, and rewards me for making debit card purchases by giving my "Growth" (savings) account a higher interest rate for the month.  I do not pay monthly fees for my account due to the amount of money I receive by direct deposit into my account each month.    Compared to other banking accounts, this checking account is by far the easiest to use and one of the only accounts that does not charge a monthly fee (if you meet the criteria).  One downside of this account is the debit card purchase rewards program--you are offered certain deals and must "click to activate" and be eligible, but I never shop at those places and so I don't receive anything for that.  Otherwise, I really like it!

name: Christopher Petrossian
review: Recently I applied for an Auto loan through BBVA Compass. As a new customer to the bank it was interesting that they offered such low rates on Auto loans which is not typical for a bank. Not only was the Personnel banker VERY Helpful the Branch manager was there to help every step of the way. All my questions were answered promptly and everything was explained in great detail. My personnel banker kept every promise. They called me back every time they said they would and made sure everything went through as smooth as possible. Even as the car I was looking at changed constantly My personnel banker was there to make the necessary changes. I had no idea the Auto loan process could be so easy. Thank You BBVA!!

name: Samantha Gannon
review: I have held this account for nearly 10 years now and have always been thrilled with the customer service I receive from PNC.  While the interest rates on the Performance Checking account aren't anything to brag about, I will say that PNC clears pending transactions quickly and is always great with resolving any charge issues (either fraudulent or penalty charges that are first time offenses).
