I highly recommend this account as long as you can maintain the minimum balance to avoid the monthly fee.

name: Alex Greif
review: I first opened a checking account with PNC back in 2002 when I was a freshman in college.  Throughout the past 12 years, PNC has really taken care of me as a customer.  The thing I love the most about having an account with PNC, is that their ATMs can be found just about anywhere.  Also, if I do get an ATM fee from an out of network machine, they refund that fee.  The iPhone app that they offer is also one of my favorite things.  I can check my balance, transfer money, deposit checks, and just about anything else related to my account right from my phone.  In the past, there have been instances where I noticed a fraudulent charge on my account.  PNC is very easy to work with in order to clear things like this up.  I highly recommend PNC to anyone looking to open a new checking account.

name: Julie Springate
review: My first savings account was opened at PNC when I was eighteen. The staff at the branch was not particularly helpful, and did not take me seriously as a young student. Overall, I ended up closing the account because of difficulty with the representatives as well as the process of opening an account. I took my business to a place that would help me understand what I was doing, and how a savings account works. I probably wouldn’t consider opening another account in the future.

name: Megan
review: I have been using PNC as my primary banking source for over 5 years and do not have any complaints. I love the employees that work at my local branch in Michigan. I feel as though they are really out for your best interest and not just to make money. As for the checking account aspect, I have had two other checking accounts through other banks and have found this one to be the most simple and inclusive checking account out there. I highly recommend PNC (any types of accounts) to anyone.

name: Brendan
review: I've had the PNC virtual wallet for a few years now, and I've never had any complaints. My main satisfaction with the accounts comes from what you can do with it online. With my old checking account at PNC, most of my transactions had to be handled at the bank, but now many of my features can be accessed from my home or at work. It makes paying bills, checking your balances, or transferring money quite easy.

name: Carl
review: I've been a member of PNC for 10 years now and they have certainly kept up with the times.  They offer what amounts to be a free checking account if you use your debit card 5 times a month, which since most people don't carry cash and use a card is very reasonable.  Their online interface is easy to understand and informative.  They also have text/email alerts if your bank account is getting to a dollar amount (danger zone) that you determine.  I never had any issues.

name: Kara
review: While I haven't had any problems that needed resolving yet every experience I've had with PNC has been positive.  They have assisted me with a number of different accounts as well as answering financial questions.  I applied online and was notified immediately that my application was approved which was very convenient for me since I was home with a newborn at the time and had recently relocated.  I do mostly mobile and online banking, their mobile app makes it easy to transfer funds, make payments, and check balances, as well as deposit checks.  The few times I need to go into a branch I am always greeted promptly and updated regularly if for some reason there is a delay.

name: liliya
review: I recently opened a checking account at PNC and so far I've been relatively pleased with the services they provide. So far, I have received excellent customer service from my local PNC branch and I'm thoroughly impressed by the online "Virtual Wallet" service that they provide; it allows for easy and quick access to your checking and saving accounts.

name: ShƏrri Kish
review: I've had a savings account at PNC for my son for 6 years now. They have taken any concerns I've had seriously and taken care of them quickly. They speak to you in terms you can understand and really help you choose the right account for your particular situation. It's a really good bank and I'd recommend them to anyone. I'm actually going to be opening up another savings account with them for my daughter shortly.

name: William johnson
review: I've been a PNC Virtual Wallet member at the Performance Checking level since late 2008. While every bank has its issues, I've been extremely happy with PNC for my checking needs. At the Performance Checking "tier", there are very few fees (and most are reimbursed) and all of the convenience of the integrated "Virtual Wallet" experience. Customer Service has been friendly and helpful any time I've had an issue. I've looked at a lot of other banks, but for checking, I'm happy to stay with PNC.

name: Ermine Vita
review: PNC is a great bank to use for the latest and easiest technology in banking. I do everything electronically and the Virtual Wallet is the best thing since sliced bread when it comes to that. I pay bills online, check balances and activity from the phone ap, make mobile deposits on the go. It really is a life saver!

name: Jamie
review: I have had both a checking and savings account with PNC for a long time and overall I am very satisfied. PNC offers competitive savings account rates which is the biggest attraction to me. There are many ATMs located all over, which makes it very simple and convenient to deposit or withdraw money directly from my savings account easily. The mobile and online banking features are par for the times and allow me to easily move money between my savings and checking account, and also pay bills and transfer money to my external accounts. I like that there are branches conveniently located everywhere I go so that I can easily stop in and work out any issues I am having quickly, and with excellent customer service. My number one reason for opening my PNC savings account was that I already had the checking account with them, and I am happy I did. The account is competitive, super convenient, and really easy to manage and work with!

name: Scott Johnson
review: I recently opened a PNC checking account and am very happy with it so far.  I changed to PNC because PNC has recently opened a bunch of branches in my area and my previous bank had very limited ATM locations (which caused me to incur fees).  One thing I really like about PNC is their customer service.  Opening my account with them was very easy and the banker was extremely professional.  They even had fresh chocolate chip cookies in the bank when I was there!!  Also, there are numerous ATM locations available for me to use.  This bank is growing rapidly and is a great bank to be a part of!

name: Alex Eagle
review: I have been a member of PNC for roughly a year now. I signed up for a savings account and so far I have not been disappointed. They have a modest interest rate for your savings account. Furthermore, you have access to your funds directly online with their "virtual wallet" functionality. Transferring funds between accounts (checking/savings) is relatively straightforward. PNC provides a great foundation for those that are looking for a reliable and trustworthy banking service. My only issue with PNC has been the automated telephone service; it's sort of a nuisance and sometimes unreliable.  Nonetheless, I'd always recommend PNC to friends and family.

name: Katrina Cazares
review: I love banking with BBVA Compass. Every time I've had a problem I can call customer service and they handle it in a professional and timely manner even when my emotions get a little out of hand. They continuously do work on the website to make sure its easy for you to read and maneuver, and they take your privacy and identity seriously which makes me feel safe against identity theft. There are somethings I dont like. I believe the monthly fee is a little too high at $10.95 and I really didnt like that when my family member sent me money she had to pay a fee and then they charged my account to receive it! All in all though the customer service from the bank both over the phone and in person definitely make up for the extra money spent. I would recommend to a friend or family member!

name: san sub
review: I have been a customer for almost two years now, and they have never let me down. As far as checking account, their service is painless and very high-quality. ATM's are available everywhere I go,but more importantly, their virtual wallet checking account offers reimbursement at any ATM in the country.Their online banking makes it very easy to manage your checking account and to avoid unnecessary check printing fees due to online bill pay. If I were to ever need to call and cancel my card if it got stolen I could get through to them on their customer care line. Overall I would recommend PNC Bank for anyone who doesn'twant to have to worry about having a high balance.I was able to quickly resolve problems with my account the one or two times that I experienced an overdraft. There is overdraft protection offered which is also a great help to anyone who would like that type of protection for their checking account. Online banking management allows me to easily view past and present transactions. Their safe deposit locker is also very good & safe & we can keep all the documents & ornaments safely.

name: Laney A
review: I have been a PNC Bank customer for three years now and I do not regret a minute of the time spent with their service. The Digital Wallet feature on their website is very handy, as well as the text alerts you can get. It was very easy to sign up for an account and my card came in very fast. The customer service is absolutely wonderful and I like that I can find a PNC Bank just about anywhere I go. The ATMs are always in good service and easy to get to. If I have to use an ATM that is not PNC, the bank will reimburse me for any charges. I have saved myself a lot of trouble with their overdraft protection as well. I would recommend anyone to use PNC Bank.

name: Blair Wardolf
review: I've been using PNC Bank for the past few years now and I must say that I am pretty pleased.  In the past I have used other Banks for my checking account and they have totally abused their "overdraft" fee privilege.  PNC Bank is pretty fair with their charges and do not take advantage of their customers.  They don't require you to have any minimum balance and have no monthly charges.  Anytime I need to stop a check or call up the customer service line for something they are always helpful and efficient.  If I were to ever need to call and cancel my card if it got stolen I could get through to them on their 24/7 customer care line.  Overall I would recommend PNC Bank for anyone who doesn't want to have to worry about having a high balance or any sneaky hidden fees and charges.  PNC Bank is trustworthy and good for someone who just needs a place to keep their money without any fancy bells or whistles.

name: Chris Cotto
review: My wife, and I have been debating on consolidating our credit cards for quite a while, so we inquired about a personal installment loan. Our loan officer was very nice throughout the whole experience, even though my wife has a pretty hectic schedule, and can be pretty hard to get in contact with at times! She was very open, and honest about our options, and we took the best option per her recommendation. We are very excited about our big step towards financial freedom.  If you need an easy, no hassle loan, (with a great interest rate/incentives) you cannot go wrong with BBVA Compass!

name: bob bolaown
review: Great bank to use, both my wife and I joined PNC a couple years ago and could not be happier.Sign up was easy, they were friendly and assisted us in getting a basic checking account for each of us, as well as a joint account for the house for emergencies. After the set up we got our cards and were on our way. I have not experienced any issues with this bank, no fraud, no odd transactions nothing. Plus the app they have is seamless and great! It has check cashing for your phone and always lets you check up on balances and pending payments almost immediately. PNC is a great bank if you are shopping around for a new home for your money.

name: Alex Eagle
review: This is a relatively standard credit card with a minimal deposit requirements and fair reimbursement rates. If you're someone with poor credit, PNC will not dissapprove you so that's a huge bonus to those that have a limited credit history. Furthermore, you must have a bank account at PNC before you are able to use this card, and all funds associated with this card must be linked back to your bank account. Overall, I feel as if the services and rates provided with this card is reasonable and I'd recommend this card for anyone who is beginning their ventures with credit cards.

name: Jonathan Flemington
review: PNC is actually a very helpful bank. After moving back into my tiny little town in northern michigan, I found that there were very few larger-style banks compared to Grand Rapids (with more than 1,000,000 people, banks were plentiful there). I chose PNC because there was a branch in both cities, making my banking much simpler should I decide to move home. Basically, I like their checking/savings accounts, their branch locations, and their ease of use on the website. Not shabby. Currently, I'm looking into their student loans, credit cards, and potential investment opportunities, but for now, I'm satisfied with the high interest rates I'm incurring on my checking/savings account combination.

name: Michelle Sexton
review: I've had this credit card for over a year now and I love it. I personally use credit cards like my own personal debit card and pay it off as soon as the statement comes out. It's been really nice though because I've been able to accrue several points with this credit card and I almost always use it on dates for my husband and I. We enjoy using our points on gift cards for classier restaurants. It's like a nice treat for us once in a while and we didn't really have to do much to get the points. It's convenient to pay and use on PNC's virtual bank website. I would definitely recommend this credit card.

name: Michelle
review: I have been with PNC bank for about three years when I moved to Philadelphia. I have never had any problems banking with them and my account is always accurate and up to date with my latest transactions. I often use the app from my phone and it is very accurate even within one minute of using my card. I like that PNC reimburses my atm fees when I use other atms. I got this deal by using their virtual wallet which means I am also not charged a monthly fee and have access to a savings account. Overall I enjoy this bank and have no interest in leaving.

name: S Pearson
review: I highly recommend PNC Business Basic Checking because it has built-in pluses. It automatically comes with a promise for zero liability for fraud on your debit card. With many banks, that only comes with credit cards. In addition, you get automatic discounts at many popular retail stores that cater to people who make business-oriented purchases. Being an online seller, I also get 300 free transactions per month, which I come in under. This means you won't pay a percentage of your transaction to the bank. Best of all, PNC allows you to deposit paper checks via cell phone picture. This saves me many trips per month because I simply deposit the checks from the comfort of my own home. If you are a landlord, you will love this feature.

name: Jen Mc
review: Talk about ridiculous prices. $16 for a cashier's check. $5 for a money order. You have got to be kidding me, I can get them for less than a dollar from both Walmart and Meijer, but you were my bank so I thought I could depend on you for that. I received some fee every month that I was a member of this bank. There were rules in place that you got fined if you didn't have a certain amount of money in your account. The staff at the Lansing locations were usually okay and I never had a problem with their hours of operation. I was not a fan of their policies and fees. I had to chose a credit union over them because of these fees, as I have to pay my rent in money order. I don't want to deal with a checkbook because I move a lot.

name: Amanda Dodge
review: I have been a client with this bank for many years.  I was with them before they were PNC and formally known as National City.  Most of my experiences have been okay, but there are a few instances I've thought to leave this bank and switch to another.  One time I had automatic withdrawals coming from my account, I canceled the contract with the company who then stopped taking payment from my account automatically.  Six months later the company decided to pull a payment from my account (over one hundred dollars), I contacted my bank branch close to home and spoke with a wonderful lady who walked me through the steps to get my cash refunded.  I went through the same process multiple times before I was told they can't refund me my money.  This brought a lot of tension to me because it was obvious the money shouldn't have been withdrawn again from my account and I had multiple documents showing my information was accurate.  With that said, my bank agreed I should be refunded but the higher up people wouldn't refund me, so I was out the service with the company who took my money as well as out of respect for this bank.

name: Stephen Riella
review: I have had a fantastic experience with BBVA Compass. Most notably with their secured card program. My wife and I had lost our home due to an unfortunate circumstance. Our credit was a disaster. We sat down with an associate banker and they explained the benefits of the secured card. It has been a little over a year since then. Our credit has jumped 50 points a piece. We are now in the process of switching over to an unsecured card. I can't say enough about how great their service has been and how clear they have been about the things we need to do to get our credit back on track.

name: Petra Clarke
review: My fiance and I opened a join PNC savings account last year. We didn't really look at all that they offered. However, now we have moved to a new city and coincidentally PNC is one of the branches near our home. We have now visited the local branch and had the pleasure of meeting with Stephanie and she was so helpful. She went the extra step to show us the virtual spending wallet, no monthly service charge, free transactions at all ATMs and also their PNC Purchase Payback program. We could not have had a better experience with Stephanie.

name: betheny smith
review: I had an account with this bank. they said my bank went into the negative and reported me to the chexsystem. When I told them I was never overdrawn they were unable to see why they turned me in. I went to the main branch and spoke with the branch manager who was also unable to find the problem. Six years later they still have me in the chex system and cannot open another account. They did not resolve their mistake and for six years I've had to suffer! I will never do business with them again. They are terrible to deal with.

name: Robert Brasher
review: I have had my PNC Bank Points Visa for a couple of years now. I originally got it to help with some expenditures while traveling. PNC has offered great customer service with my banking and the same has followed suit with my Visa card as well. I have had a couple of instances that required my payment to run a couple of days late and they have always been easy to work with and make arrangements. I have taken advantage of the points process as well, earning some great gift cards and discount cards with it. Overall the card has been a big help and is supported well by PNC. I have never experienced hidden fees or manipulative errors.

name: Amanda Smith
review: My husband and I have been using BBVA Compass for about 3 years now. We spent a lot of time going through different banks trying to find one that fits all of our needs and wants. BBVA has everything we want and then some. The customer service has always been wonderful and helpful anytime we've needed to contact them. I hate that we wasted so much time looking for the perfect bank when we had one, literally, right down the street from our house. Whenever a friend or relative starts complaining about their bank, we tell them about how great BBVA Compass is. This is a great bank!

name: Calvero Danger
review: The BBVA Compass ClearPoints Credit Card can be a nice credit card to have your in your wallet if your lucky enough to get it as it requires an excellent credit history upon sign up.  This little gem of a card offers many things that others cards  in the elite credit card category do not offer. Such as no monthly or yearly fee's. which means that when you don't use your card you will not be getting charged useless random fee's. Another great feature of this card that many others in the same category don't offer is a very low APR of 9.99% after qualifying. If that's not an amazing deal, then I don't know what is.

name: Albert Phan
review: The PNC Flex Visa Card is a good card to start out with. The rewards are alright since there isn't an initial bonus, you can earn points with a base/max earn of 4 points/$1. There is no limit to how much you could earn and you're able to redeem points on gift cards and such. This is different from the Capital One VentureOne Rewards Credit card since the rewards deal with frequent flyer miles. The annual rate is average and the grace period is average with 21 days. Although the balance transfer fee is also something to look at with a good balance transfer fee of 4%.

name: Ashley Ballard
review: The PNC Flex Visa Credit Card is not horrible, but could be better considering you need excellent credit to qualify for it. They have no annual fee but do not offer a zero interest introductory period on balance transfers or purchases. They do have a rewards program though where you can earn points towards gift cards, traveling, merchandise and more. While the card isn't too bad, I like the Chase Freedom Visa card better because it has no annual fee, no interest on balance transfers or purchases for 15 months and instead of points you earn cash back. This card also requires excellent credit, so you might as well go for the one with better perks!

name: Ashley Ballard
review: The BBVA Compass ClearPoints Credit Card is a pretty decent card for people with excellent credit to begin with. They have no annual fee, a 6 month zero interest introductory offer and a rewards program that allows you to earn points that can be redeemed for gift cards, merchandise and more. They also offer 12 months of zero interest on balance transfers. I think the Capital One Quicksilver Cash Rewards Credit Card is just a bit better though as it offers one year of no interest on both balance transfers and purchases, and has no annual fee. It also boasts a rewards program in which you earn cash back on purchases. If you spend $500 within the first 3 months, you get a $100 bonus! Overall, I think their perks are better but both cards are good.

name: Bryan Simpson
review: These guys process the student loans through my university every year. They offer me to make an account with them but I choose not to and they are still very helpful even though I didn't make an account at their bank. They mail me my refund check within a week usually and it's very professionally done. I could not be happier that my school chooses to use this bank to process all of our finances. Nothing but positive experiences from them if you haven't already signed up for an account with them I suggest you do so as soon as possible. I for one am definitely signing up for one next semester.

name: Ehtel Sknerski
review: I obtained my PNC Bank Rewards VISA Credit Card roughly four years ago and I’ve maintained it ever since. The bank originally promoted the card through their points program by focusing on the fact that I would be receiving rewards for paying my bills with their credit card. I have since earned several hundred dollars in rewards and am paying additional bills with their card to earn even more. As with all credit cards, the interest rate is on the higher end of the spectrum, thus I do not carry a month end balance; rather I pay the total amount owed each month to avoid interest charges. It’s by far my most used card and I am thus far very satisfied with the performance of it.

name: Steve Simpson
review: PNC has been fantastic to me as a customer. I was with National City in Cleveland before PNC bought them. The transition a few years ago was smooth for me. PNC is up to date on technology too. They have great online features and great apps for both iOS and Android. In addition they also have a great mobile website. Every time I needed customer service they were more than helpful. When I had fraudulent activity on my account I called them and they took care of it quickly no questions asked. I could not be happier and think everyone should have PNC.

name: Treva Kane
review: This is my favorite credit card. I purchased airline tickets with my PNC card. The airline was suspended and filed bankruptcy. PNC immediately credited my account 100% not making me wait until after the date of the flight as some companies did with their customers. This is a great credit card, highly recommend!

name: Alice Charitable
review: I have been a PNC bank customer for about three years now. Overall, I would say that I have had a great experience banking with them. I used to bank with Chevy Chase bank and Wachovia but I grew tired of all the extra hidden fees. I love PNC because the student account has no minimum balance limit, no monthly fees, and no check card fees for debit purchases. Their branches also have longer hours than any other bank I've banked with. PNC also has Saturday availability which makes it more convenient for people who couldn't make it to the bank on Friday. The customer service representatives are friendly and helpful. I had an issue with some fraud on my account and they refunded me the money and charges without hesitation. They also helped me go through the process of closing and opening a new account. I've been with PNC for a long time and they will continue to be my bank of choice.

name: Monica King
review: I have had a PNC Points Credit Card since 2008. At first I was pleased to earn points on all of my purchases, but when I closed my checking account with PNC in 2010 because they mishandled my paychecks from work, I was automatically unenrolled from the points program and left with a high-interest credit card with no rewards to speak of. Also after closing my checking account but keeping the credit card, I was no longer able to access my points account online and customer service never helped me resolve the issue. After having this card for a while, I was offered a better interest rate from Capital One. Now I only keep my PNC card for emergencies since it is not rewarding or worthwhile otherwise.

name: Corey
review: I've been with PNC (originally National City before the merger) for about 5 years now, and I have been quite satisfied with their service. They have two convenient locations in the small city of Mount Pleasant, MI and both have held up to my standards of quality service. I most often only use my bank's physical location for their ATM and to the rest of my transactions over the internet, but the times that I have had to actually go into the bank, it has been a very pleasant and timely experience. Their online banking site has a lot of options for checking accounts to simplify transactions, and the postings of the transactions are quickly updated. I was worried at first when I found out that PNC was going to be taking over National City, as I wasn't sure what it meant for my accounts, but I can honestly say that the change has only been for the better.

name: Sabrena Pattat
review: I went to withdraw $22 from my account yesterday, Scott was right there upfront there to help me and he quickly got my account information pulled up. After the withdraw slip was filled out he led me over to a teller himself and I got the money shortly afterwards. I thanked him afterwards and left.

name: Kyle McCullough
review: I have been a customer of PNC Bank ever since National City merged with them. Of my experience with PNC, I have received excellent customer service from them and would highly recommend. I've gone through some tough financial troubles, ending up overdrawing my account, being charged overdraft fees. I went to my local branch to explain my situation and the woman in charge of the bank helped me out and actually reversed the fee. She was very sympathetic towards me and completely understood my situation at the time, then proceeded to tell me about their Overdraft Protection service. I was unaware there was such a thing, so after hearing details, I immediately signed up and haven't had an issue since. I've never had this kind of service at any other banks that I have an account with, so my hat is off for their excellent customer service and their ability to actually care.

name: Michael Sanislo
review: PNC was the answer to my banking problems. I have been with a couple different banks—with many issues at times among the different companies. Some offered free debit withdrawals at any ATM while others had certain requirements that didn’t work well for me. PNC offers free ATM withdrawals at any of their branches as well as at WAWAs. I don’t have to worry about those fees for my cash anymore. I also like their online website as well that makes bill pay quite easy. I have almost all of my monthly bills set up through autopay on their website. They are very good with communication and I haven’t run into a single problem that they have not been unable to help me with. I am very satisfied with this bank. I just hope they don’t get bought out anytime soon!

name: Wilhelm Vain
review: When I first moved to Maryland from Georgia I knew that I would have to get a new bank account, with new people, in my--as mentioned--new living area. I, however, did not know that it would be as simple of a process as Brittney--one of the agents at the Urbana Branch--would make it seem. The bank account was set up in approximately 10 minutes and I was even suggested toward bonus that would allow me to utilize my account in a different way. Yep, I'm talking about Virtual Wallet. Which has--for the past two years--really changed the way I do business. PNC was the first bank in the area that allowed you to use the NFC way of payment. It even allowed you to do it before Google Wallet was officially released. I can say that I am extremely satisfied with my experience with PNC and the only issue that I ever had with them was quickly resolved with a simple email to my banker.

name: Cori P
review: I have been with PNC bank for almost 4 years now. I switched banks when I moved to Pennsylvania for school. PNC was the primary bank in the area and offered great services for students like myself. Virtual Wallet was there new product at the time, and I signed up right away and got a few gifts for doing so. PNC was the only bank that you could set up a free checking account and didn't require a minimum amount in the account at all times. I have never had a bad experience with PNC. The bank tellers are very friendly at the locations I have visited. The bank tellers on my school's campus are extremely nice and know me now that I've done all my banking with them for the last 4 years. I love the Virtual Wallet app that is now available as well. It's very handy. I can just check my account on my phone within a matter of seconds. I highly recommend PNC to everybody and anybody!

name: Rick Schmitt
review: PNC has repeatedly earned my confidence and trust due to its unwavering attentiveness to customer needs and ability to solve any consumer's problems. I've been a customer for almost twenty years now, and they've never once let me down. As far as checking accounts go, their service is painless and very high-quality. ATMs are available everywhere I go, but more importantly, their virtual wallet checking account offers reimbursement at any ATM in the country. In addition their online banking makes it very easy to manage your checking account and to avoid unnecessary check printing fees due to online bill pay. The virtual wallet checking account has other benefits such as overdraft protection. I can't say enough about great of a bank PNC is.

name: janie castaneda
review: I opened my account with BBVA compass in 2003 through an open invitation at my place of employment. They used to offer a great checking account were I did not have to pay any fees for using my ATM card and they also paid other banks fees that were incurred if I used the card, their checking account did not have any monthly fees regardless of the money  that you kept on the account  or the number of transactions you made in a month, sad to say my account was compromised and I had to get a  regular account and now have fees that were never charged before, I stayed with BBVA because most banks now have fees so one is just as good as the other, and BBVA is still not overcrowded like a lot of banks here in TX, I can still get in and out of the branch within a reasonable time frame and the customer service is still Superb.

name: Jason
review: I've been with PNC for about 3 years now. I currently have one of their Virtual Wallet accounts and I must say it is the most balanced type of account possible and its free! Currently PNC is the only bank in the area offering free checking of any kind without having $200+ in the bank at all times.My only problem is with the local branch and its not that much of an issue. Seems they like to get new employees frequently. This sometimes leads to things taking longer than they should or getting confusing. It don't happen too often but it has so I felt I had to mention it.Bottom line, PNC is a great bank that has something for everyone! I highly recommend PNC.

name: BETH smith
review: I've been with PNC bank now for about a year now. I have this set up as my secondary checking and savings account, for which I use for emergencies, and for saving for large purchases and vacations. Setting up the account was extremely easy. I was able to do everything online without any extra help from customer service. I am able to do so many things online with the account that I've only had to go into a PNC branch office once. That was because I went to take money out of the ATM with my savings account card (also a first - no other bank I've had before gave me an ATM card for the savings account!), but it wouldn't let me take out anything. When I went inside the branch office and asked why, I was told that the card freezes and is unable to be used if you do not use it at least once every three months. I thought that was odd, considering it's a savings account and the point is to save and not spend, but whatever. She unfroze my card and I was out the door with my money in five minutes. Overall this is a good bank for anyone who likes to do everything online.

name: Simon Cook
review: I joined PNC bank when my main bank began to charge me to use my ATM card on other bank’s ATM machines. As PNC has a bank close to me but more importantly has free ATMs in the local Wawa and Quick Check it was an easy choice for me.I applied for an account online and was impressed how easy the process was. I received all documentation within a week and was given instant access to the online wallet. The wallet is an excellent online banking application that allows me to quickly and easily see my daily transactions and my total balance. It gives me some simple options such as transferring into savings, disputing transactions and seeing recent transactions. It’s a very intuitive website and I constantly use it.I have an automatic deposit directly from my job and have setup alerts that tell me when the deposit is made. I have never had to go to the physical branch. I am very impressed with PNC Bank. I have made one dispute of a transaction and received information about the transaction within a business day; the site is very easy to use and PNC has plenty of ATMs for me to use.

name: Heath Starkey
review: I have been with PNC for over two years, and have had a wonderful experience. The tellers and I are on a first name basis, and they treat me like family. Sign up was so easy. I was on my lunch break from work and I did not have time to sit through the whole process. They took my information and told me to come back when I had a chance. When I did, they just handed me the paperwork for my new bank account: It was already done! They tell me everything that I need to know, and always explain the fine print up front. They tell me point blank what is a good deal, and what is not. I couldn't ask for something better. If I have an overdraft, they call me at home and notify me, so I always have a chance to correct it before I get charged. I love them.

name: Gregorie Thomas
review: I joined PNC Bank after leaving Bank of America; plus PNC was the closest bank to me. I used them to set up both a checking and a business account. It was a pleasant experience all the way through. The manager is the one that handled all of my paperwork, and he seemed to take a genuine interest in not only me, but my electronic cigarette business as well. Whenever I came into the bank to drop off deposits, he would always take the time to speak with me, and even gave me free stuff like water bottles and coffee mugs and the like. I've had to speak to their customer service a couple times on the phone and they were pleasant and informative as well. All in all, I would say this is the best civilian bank that I have dealt with.

name: Gregorie Thomas
review: I've had the PNC Bank Points Visa Card for about a year now, to help rebuild my credit. I've had no problems with it, and in fact with using their online banking, I was able to pay off my bill from the comfort of my bed on my laptop just by signing into my checking account and transferring money over in a simple process. I tend to not let any money carry over from month to month as I'm still in the process of rebuilding my credit. Plus I want to keep the whole credit line open in case of emergencies with my car or apartment. I'm happy with the card overall.

name: Anonymous
review: I have been with PNC for about 3 years now. I had transitioned from another bank, and so far I have been pretty happy about this. Although I have had a few problems with reward points, there new system isn't as good as the old one. Other than that they are a decent bank. My nearest location isn't kept as clean as it should be, but the inside is good. The same employees have been there forever, so it is nice they all know my name. Their site is down a lot, so you have to call in and sometimes telephone customer service is also down. They have good security though, and alert you if there is suspicious activity. Their fees are pretty typical, and they do offer free savings if you maintain 25 dollars a month. So, all in all a pretty good bank.

name: Julie Petersen
review: When I chose PNC for my primary bank, I never looked back to the competitors. They are conveniently located with exceptional staff. The branch manager pre-screened me for the appropriate products. Once decided upon the proper accounts, she showed me the online features I can have access to. The tools offered online are highly useful for every day needs including budgeting and scheduling payments. I have followed her recommendations with setting up my account including an app for my smart phone. I am further considering opening a retirement account with them since the staff is so helpful and trusting. The best feature with this bank is there are no fees for checking.

name: Yevgeniy
review: I have held a PNC Bank checking account for two years and have nothing but excellent experiences with PNC. Every single bank location I’ve been to has been very clean and elegant. Each branch looks like a well run, professional, setting. The service I have received has also been exceptional, I have never had an encounter with a teller who was rude or unprofessional and everyone made me feel welcome and happy to have a PNC Bank checking account. PNC also has a variety of ATM locations open in my area, so if I ever need to deposit or withdraw money from my account, I can usually find an ATM within 3 miles. Overall, I have nothing but excellent and positive reviews of all of my PNC experiences.

name: Marcella Atkinson
review: I have been with PNC since they took over my local branch of National City. The transition process when they took over was very smooth. They issued us new checks at no cost and I have had no problem at all using my old National City checks. Customer service representatives can sometimes seem like they are not very helpful, but when the issue is normally my fault I understand why. My customer experience issues have normally been me calling to beg them to waive overdraft fees or for similar reasons. PNC is still a bank and they need to charge these kinds of fees if you do not keep your account in proper order. I understand that, but normally if my account becomes overdrawn it is a great chance that I also do not have the funds to cover such fees. PNC has a branch in most towns in my state making finding one when traveling around the state very simple. Overall, the friendly service that I receive (when I'm not calling in a frenzy, anyhow) and the ease of finding a branch when needed are what keeps me as a customer for many years to come.

name: Austeen
review: I have been a loyal PNC Bank Customer going on 5 years now and I couldn't be more satisfied with it. When I first signed up after moving to Pennsylvania years ago, I didn't have the best credit so it was difficult for me to find a bank that would let me open a checking account without all kinds of crazy fees. PNC offered a free checking account and a money management class that has proven to be extremely helpful while most other banks would not even give me a chance. Any issues that come up with my account are fixed immediately and in a friendly manner. Their virtual wallet tool is awesome! I plan on banking with PNC forever and would highly recommend them to everyone.

name: Tom Garrett
review: I have been a loyal PNC bank customer for 4 years now and would highly recommend them to anyone. I use their Performance Virtual Wallet product which includes an interest bearing checking account, reserve account and savings account all in one. Their robust Virtual Wallet application makes it very easy to move money around, pay bills and the addition of robust budgeting tools really helps you stay on track financially. This is really a great product for someone looking to move away from traditional banking and do everything electronically. Their mobile application is fantastic and allows you to deposit checks right from the app. The performance version of the Virtual Wallet offers other perks such as ATM fee reimbursement as well. My only negative about PNC is that lately their services have been very shaky. For a product that relies entirely on online connectivity, those services have a tendency to go down or become unavailable very often. It's apparent they are working hard to upgrade those services though, so I wouldn't let that affect my recommendation to give them a try!

name: Ashley
review: They are very friendly at the branch I go to. The hours are very flexible. I know of no other bank open on a Sunday, and it's very helpful that they are! I love the virtual wallet, it helps me organize my money. It makes life so easy!

name: Andre Changuway
review: I became a PNC Bank customer a few years ago because my old bank, National City, was bought by PNC.  I was nervous about the transition but everything was handled smoothly.  PNC Bank has a phenomenal online banking site allowing me to do just about everything that I need to.  I can pay my bills easily, set up recurring monthly payments, make transfers, and pay my PNC credit card.  I also really like the iPhone app that allows me to deposit checks and make transfers right from my phone without having to run to the local branch.

name: Travis
review: I am so happy that I made the change from my old bank to PNC. I feel safe with having my money there. Every time I go into the bank, which isn't that often because they offer so many great online services, I feel very welcome as the workers are very friendly. I like the additional security steps I have to go through. It makes me feel very secure because I don’t have to worry about someone stealing my identity. Once I had charged a lot on my debit card on a large purchase. They contacted me that very day to check if I had indeed made the purchase. I like that type of security.

name: tom
review: I would totally recommend PNC bank to just about anyone I know! They have great hours and every teller I have ever had to speak with was always totally helpful and very nice as well. I use them for my checking account and the best part is that there is no minimum required. That means I don’t have to worry about silly things like a minimum balance or any fees for not having enough money in my account. I honestly love PNC bank and would never change to a competitor. Look for a local branch and stop in. You will not be disappointed.

name: Alex Johnson
review: They recently opened a PNC Bank in the city I live in. I have heard great things about the services they provide so I was curious enough to go and inquire about opening an account with them. They were so convincing that I signed up right then and there. I was very excited that the ATM machines were able to take pictures of your checks and deposit them as well as count your cash and deposit it. Their online banking is also very simple and easy to use. Before I was spending more time going to my bank in person, now I can do it all at my convenience.

name: Evan
review: I have my primary checking account at PNC bank for 1 year. I appreciate the wide variety of services offered by the bank, their excellent online applications, and the availability of PNC ATM machines all around Pittsburgh. In particular I was recently impressed to discover the availability of a PNC money market account that I could open and link to my PNC checking account. Obviously I could open a money market account anywhere, but the convenience of having it at PNC is great. When I asked a question about this account in their online chat I received a prompt and clear response.

name: Elizabeth
review: I have been with Compass Bank for a few years now. Likes: The people that have helped me have been pretty nice! Always polite and friendly. They offer a customization service for your debit/credit cards. I actually love this feature! I have gotten quite a few compliments on mine.Dislikes: The hold times can be a little ridiculous sometimes. Also finding a branch can be a little pesky, as there are not very many close to where I work. The website could use a little work too. It’s a little difficult to navigate and not very user friendly. Another time, I went into a branch to have them change my address because I had moved, and they never actually took care of that. So whenever I tried to buy something online and had to verify my billing address, I wound up putting the wrong address in because they never changed it. Overall, I would give them an average rating because they've always been helpful.

name: Jackie Williams
review: I have only been with PNC Bank for a few years now but they have been good. I had a website charge my card multiple times and the bank was very helpful in disputing the charges and refunding my money quickly. I have the Performance Virtual Wallet which is three accounts and TWO of them earn interest! Overall, they have always been helpful and have good customer service and convenient locations. The ATM at our local branch even has a touch screen that gives out denominations as small as $1. The ATM also counts the cash you deposit and takes pictures of the checks so they can be deposited instantly!

name: Michael Lamb
review: I have been a happy PNC bank customer for about 10 years. The service at the local branch is second to none! Any time I have a question they go the extra mile to answer it as completely as possible. The branch manager even clued me in on some changes the bank was starting the next month and she suggested how I should change my accounts to take best advantage of the new policies. She did all this without me even asking about it too! That blew me away! I never had a bank do anything like that for me before. Funny thing is that before I became a PNC customer I did not even know they existed. I had an old Riggs bank loan that PNC bought when Riggs got into trouble for money laundering years ago. I highly recommend PNC if you have a branch near you.

name: ANETA OBALEK
review: I am VERY satisfied with BBVA Compass. I have been with them for several years, and they’ve impressed me from the very beginning. When I first walked in, I was greeted with a very warm reception. All the employees have always been extremely friendly and helpful. Even though I don’t frequent the bank very often, they always recognize me and ask about my life. They have an amazing fraud recovery team that handled my case after my wallet got stolen. When I reported the incident, they walked me through the investigation process, defined my next steps and obligations and told me the estimated resolution date. They communicated with me as the investigation was in process, and quickly closed my case. My account was frozen (then cancelled), and my stolen money was refunded

name: Jay Christopher
review: When I was younger, my parents steered me toward smaller credit unions and while they can have their benefits, at some point, you will need to “graduate” to a larger institution. The greatest thing about PNC Bank, other than their professionalism in the industry, is the fact that you can find one of their facilities almost anywhere.  It seems that I am never more than 10 miles away from a PNC. Furthermore, I love the fact that they reimburse you for using non-PNC ATMs (if you keep enough money in your account) and I also love their online interface. I highly recommend them!

name: Sarah Wolf
review: I've been using PNC for a while, and my parents used PNC back when it was still Old Kent Bank (decades ago). I've been pleased with the customer service, disclosure of fees, and their website’s ease of use. I'm currently using the Virtual Wallet, and I LOVE how I can deposit checks with my iPhone. It saves me the hassle of finding time to drive to the bank weekly. I've been so impressed with the bank that I've also opened up one of their credit cards. You can't really beat a 9% interest rate in this economy. All the local branches I've been to have been friendly, and I appreciate it when they tag suspicious activity and call you.

name: Jeff Kontak
review: I've had a credit card with PNC for quite a few years now ever since I was offeredone. I heard many warnings about PNC but I decided to give it a try anyways and I'mglad I did. In terms of customer service, PNC was super helpful. I remember one time,I had accidentally missed a payment. I got a call the day of and was informed I could payright then and it would be on time. Another time, after my card got stolen, PNCnotified me of unusual charges and called me to verify. After telling them it was not me,they declined the charges and told me I would not be responsible for those charges. I alsoreceived a new card in the mail that same week. Overall, my experience has been awesomeand would recommend PNC to anyone.

name: Daniel Lopez
review: PNC has been a very reliable bank for me. I have had a checking account with them for about 3 years. Since it is my secondary account, I mainly use it for paying bills or keeping extra spending money. I don’t really have a need to walk into a physical branch since I do everything electronically but I do wish that the mobile app or website were a little bit faster and easier to navigate. The few times that I did speak to a representative, they were courteous and were able to help me reverse some charges that were an error on their part. If you don’t balance your account regularly, keep in mind that some locations such as Target take a few days to post, like it has happened to me with Target.

name: Scott Bogle
review: I opened a Build-to-Order Checking account with BBVA Compass about three months ago when starting a new job. The customer service when opening an account was FANTASTIC. The rep I spoke with walked me through the process, and even advised me to switch to an account with a lower monthly fee. That's the first time I've ever had a bank go out of their way to save ME money! The $10.95 monthly service fee on the account is waived as long as I have at least one direct deposit of $300 or more each month. However, since opening the account, I've had a few issues. Some of the links on their online banking site do not work, and I had trouble receiving my checks and debit card after opening the account. I also found that the customer service reps on the phone, while generally helpful, are a little “hit and miss” when it comes to dealing with these issues. Also, although they've recently launched mobile deposit by taking a picture of a check from their iPhone app, apparently only a few types of accounts currently qualify. This would be a GREAT feature for me and save me a lot of time, so hopefully this will be expanded soon.

name: Felton Kassar
review: I have a basic checking account with PNC. I have always appreciated the progressive nature of their online account access and features. Nearly every online feature that has been implemented has been helpful and useful for my daily account needs and activities. I especially enjoy the ability to quickly and conveniently access past monthly bank statements. This has helped me to keep track of my own budget extremely easily. I also appreciate the expansive nature of available PNC locations across the northeast USA. I live in the northeast and it seems like no matter where I travel, there’s a PNC branch location or ATM nearby. I’m sure this has helped me save hundreds of dollars on these fees since I started my account. Finally, customer service in times of emergency was helpful and relieving. I misplaced my ATM card once, and in a panic I called PNC. They were very courteous, quick acting, and put my mind at ease. Later I realized that my card was in my house; after calling them back I was able to reactivate the same card without having to wait for a new card to be shipped. Overall, this bank is very helpful and convenient to customers with smaller needs like me. I’d recommend this bank to anyone.

name: Sarah
review: I go to the PNC down on Main St. They're open on Saturdays, the people are really nice, and the lines go really fast. Also, whenever I go to the ATM, it's always working (no matter which one I go to in the city). The representatives there know my name and are always very friendly, so I know when I go in they're going to take care of me. They also forgave me two separate overdraft fees two different times because they said it wasn't my fault (it was eBay charging me fees without notifying me), which was really nice. I've been a customer here for 5 years, and I always recommend PNC to my friends. I give it a 5/5.

name: Mike
review: I had my mortgage through PNC Bank for about 3 years or so. Overall, I thought they were ok to deal with. The customer service was pretty good the few times that I had to give them a call. The only complaint that I have is after I bought my house, I did a bunch of upgrades to it and increased the value a lot. I called them to ask if I could get an appraisal done on the house to see how much equity I had in it with the increase in value and then I wouldn’t have to pay PMI insurance. They wouldn’t let me do it and I had to just wait until I paid down the balance. So, I went and refinanced with a different bank, got an interest rate a lot lower, and don’t have to pay PMI insurance anymore. One little request from me that they declined made them lose my business.

name: Steven Crawley
review: I didn't pick this card per say I just wanted a card to help me go on vacation, when I went to the bank this is what I got. It is nice, I went to Florida on a two week vacation I spent about $30,000 on the card during the trip so by doing that I racked up some serious points, or cash back however you look at it. It was nice to get something back for using their card, most banks could care less if your happy, or so it seems. But this card makes it easy, my bills and statements are easy to get to online, if I have questions I never have a problem reaching someone on the customer service line, and they are generally quite polite. As far as cards go I like this one, I've had several cards over time, and this one is quickly becoming my favorite, I like cards and programs in general that give back to you for using them, so this is a perfect fit for me.

name: Rachel Ditzel
review: This is one of the first credit cards I ever had, and I decided to get it to build my credit. I do have to say that PNC is very consistent with sending out statements and bills--they make sure to send it to you in plenty of time before it's due, which is not a standard thing based on my experience! Their online banking was very simple to use, but it seemed that it went down frequently. It was easy to convert my earnings into actual rewards. I liked their customer service, which was largely comprised of live people, but towards the end of my time with this card, they switched overly to a mainly automated system that requires some annoying navigation to get to a person. Thankfully, I didn't have many problems with this card, so I didn't have to deal with that often. I'm not sure that it was the right choice for me at the time--I would recommend this card for a general consumer, but not for someone who's just starting out. Other banks (and even PNC) have much better options like secured cards for that, but I guess I can't blame the customer service representative for pushing this card. Still, there are better cards and I wouldn't get it again.

name: Nick Bourassa
review: I have had a checking account with PNC since I was in high school. Overall, I'd have to say that I am very satisfied with the service I have received with them. The staff is very knowledgeable and very polite. I especially recommend their online chat function. I had issues with accessing my account and the representative in the online chat was very quick to resolve it. Transferring money from account to account is exceptionally simple and virtually seamless and they made my bond cashing service quick and enjoyable as well. They also offer overdraft protection which transfers funds from your savings to compensate for overdrawn checking accounts. This helps to negate overdraft fees which we all know can be a real killer. Overall, I recommend their service to anyone.

name: Michael Lamb
review: I have used many different rebate cards in my time, but I really like this PNC cashbuilder best for everyday small purchases. The 1.25% rebate is better than most other cards I use for small stuff. Also if you have the better checking account at their bank too you get 1.5%! This is all in cash as a credit on your bill each month. That is awesome to me because it is simple to do. I get a little miffed at the cards that make you jump through hoops to convert points into money (or a gift card.) I have a few of those and try not to use them if I can help it. PNC makes this easier. I recommend PNC cashbuilder to anyone with good credit and who likes rebates.

name: sharon macdonald
review: PNC bank is absolutely fabulous. The Virtual Wallet account is awesome and there are no FEES! I have used quite a few different banks for both my personal and business accounts over the years, and none comes close to PNC. I first switched my personal account over and was so happy that I have since switched my business account over too! The customer service is great. They actually answer the phones! I had one issue with one of my checks and the representative who I spoke with resolved the issue in five minutes. She was helpful and kind. If you are looking for a bank that puts the customer first, check out PNC.

name: Jessica
review: PNC is great. I switched over from Citizens to avoid monthly fees. I never would have guessed how convenient PNC is. Their Virtual Wallet tool is easy to use (though I wish they would stop updating it, as it is slower now), and makes it easy to control how much is in my checking and savings accounts. The calendar tool is very helpful to have all paydays and bills laid out in an easy-to-see way. My only complaint about PNC is that they spelled my last name wrong on my debit card, and it took about a week to get that sorted out, and I noticed recently that my name is still incorrect on my bank statements. Other than that, they are quick, convenient, and upfront. I definitely recommend PNC.

name: Jennifer Ellis
review: I came to PNC when they took over National City. I was a little leery at first but they won me over after I came into the bank and learned about the Virtual Wallet account along with the great customer service I experienced. They've been nothing but great to me for four years now. I've only had one issue with the bank so far and that is when we switched debit cards, they forgot to close out our old debit cards but they took care of it right away when I called them and let them know. We've never had any extra fees or anything using PNC. It's been nothing but a positive experience! I can't say enough good things about the Virtual Wallet account that they offer. It's a must have for any busy family!

name: John Darden
review: Because PNC is one of the larger banks in my area, I was cautious about joining them. My friend convinced me to switch and I have not left them yet. I have been a loyal customer of PNC for 10+ years now and I am very satisfied with the bank for many reasons. PNC's ATMs in my area are very convenient and easy to understand. The tellers in my area’s bank are very courteous and helpful which is another big plus in my book. And I love the Virtual Wallet option they offer online. This makes spending and keeping track of expenses a breeze. It has been nothing but a good experience so far. I plan to stay with PNC for many years to come.

name: Brian Titen
review: PNC bank has been great to me. They offer free checks for every account that you have. I opened a Virtual Wallet account there, which gives me a checking, reserve and savings. All of the workers are friendly and helpful. I have a great fraud prevention team watching my debit card transactions. They also instantly reimburse any fraudulent charges. My savings account has a very high rate of interest and they even raise your interest rate if you spend enough money in your checking account. All of the accounts are linked online and the user interface is amazing and easy to use. I recommend PNC to everybody that I know who is in the market for a new bank.

name: kynzi klingbeil
review: I was able to sign up online for my PNC accounts. I just had to make a deposit of $100 with a credit card or debit card to open the account. That makes it very convenient to open an account if you are like me and are always at work during normal banking hours. I have only talked to customer service on the phone, but they are nice and helpful. Overall, I have not had any issues with my account. I am able to do everything with online banking, which is totally free. My checking account is free as well and I can use my debit card as often as I would like with no extra fees.

name: Lori McEntire
review: I took out a personal loan with PNC a few years ago. I checked a few big banks and even some small credit unions in town. PNC gave me the best rate and the biggest loan. It was more than enough to get me through the time between jobs. There was only one time that my payment was late and even though it was the result of my own stupidity they gave me a break and I didn't have to pay a late fee. I had such a great experience with PNC and my personal loan that I've since gone back for a loan on my new car and one for my family's new home! I would recommend PNC for any loan need you might have.

name: Jason
review: It’s a big bank so you might expect to have long lines, rude tellers, and lots of fees and mistakes on your account. But that's not what I get with PNC bank at all! I have only had one problem in the dozen years I've had an account with them. My checking account was set right shortly after I came in to the branch office in my town and I left happy with the solution and I felt that they understood where I was coming from and that I had a justified complaint. I left liking my bank even more than I had before the issue. They are top notch in customer service and amazing in regard to helpfulness. My issue was resolved quickly and efficiently. I don't feel that I'm less important to them just because my account doesn't have much money in it. I like that!

name: Karen Dumaine
review: I have been with PNC for 15+ years. My problems with the bank have more to do with my branch than the bank itself. I find them to be arrogant and condescending; and they are not very helpful with problems that have come up over the years. I now deal with the 800 number only. I lost my debit card once and it took more than 3 weeks to get a new one. I do find the online banking very easy to use, and I like paying my bills, and transferring money through the online service. I must say that I stay a customer of PNC because it is convenient to my home.

name: bobbie
review: Normally I would prefer banking with a small, independent bank but, unfortunately, independent banks are in short supply in the area where I live. Of all of the banking options in my town I decided to try PNC. I found the staff to be helpful and courteous when I was setting up my accounts. It has now been almost 6 years that I have been banking with PNC. There have been very few problems but when I did have a problem they worked quickly to get it resolved. They have quite a few branches in my area so it is always easy to find a bank if I actually need a physical site instead of the online options.

name: Michelle Kellum
review: I was originally a National City customer and became a PNC customer by default when they took over. So far my experience has been mostly good. I have had occasion to call customer service several times and I never have to wait on hold for long and have always had very helpful customer service representatives. One Saturday morning I received a call from PNC because they felt my card had suspicious activity on it. As it turned out, there were several charges from iTunes that were not mine – 5 charges totaling around $250. I have no idea how they knew those were fraudulent charges, but I was very happy they caught it! However, I have also had my mobile username deactivated once and my husband has had his deactivated twice. When we called to find out why, we were told that there were too many failed login attempts. It was annoying, but I'd rather have that happen than have someone hack into my account. The only negative thing I have to say about PNC is that there have been quite a few times that mobile access and/or online access have been down. Overall, I am very happy with PNC and I would choose them again.

name: Josh Ryan
review: My experience with PNC has been nothing short of excellent. The Virtual Wallet account setup is incredible and I love having the three different accounts, each for a different purpose. The Virtual Wallet account is an excellent account style for college students. The online banking is so much better than the one I had at the bank I came from. It’s easily accessible from all devices I could ever think of using. The people at PNC are also some of the best I have ever dealt with. Anything I have seemed to have a problem with has always been solved within a few minutes. Overall, PNC Bank is one of the best, if not the best, and I can suggest it to anyone, especially college students.

name: Marina Napoli
review: I have been very pleased with the service I have received over the five years I have been with PNC bank. They are helpful, easy to understand, and helped me get my money back when someone stole my information. I had to cancel my debit card and they sent me a new one right away. I got it within a week. When I set up my savings account, my money was transferred very quickly and I understood the whole process. When I have to transfer money between my accounts, the transfer goes through in, at most, two days. I am thoroughly pleased with the service I have gotten from this bank, and will continue to bank with them for many years to come.

name: Rick
review: I, and my family, have banked with PNC since they bought out National City Bank. Even during that transition process, which can be stressful for customers, they were extremely helpful, doing everything they could to ease any issues we had. Customer support – in person or on the phone – has always been extremely helpful, and bank lobbies are always tidy and brightly lit, many including carpeting and decor to make it seem less like a hotel waiting room and more like a family business. Any issues with overdrafts (I admit it has happened once or twice) are handled efficiently, even to the point of them eliminating three days of overdraft fees that were caused by a small (under three dollars) overdraft! Not only was this extremely kind of them, but it saved me from paying out a good chunk of money I didn't plan to spend on something like that. I would definitely tell others to bank with PNC, especially if they are unhappy with their current bank.

name: Dave
review: I love this bank! Nice lobby, helpful tellers, open 7 days a week, coin counting machine, what else could you want?Also, I have to say that the managers at this office are awesome and hilarious. The female manager I saw having a full on conversation with a toddler in baby talk to keep her quiet while her parents were doing business with a teller. The short male manager with a turban has been with the bank forever and could tell you anything you want to know (and more). The white male manager made me a poncho and hat out of trash bags when it was raining outside so I wouldn't get wet. What other bank has this kind of service?They are open 7 days a week but I made the mistake of going on a Sunday thinking their parking lot would be open but I guess they rent it out to a farmers market so there was no place to park other than the meters. Other than that this is the best bank I've ever used.

name: Adeoye
review: For years I had been a Chevy Chase (now Capital One) customer. They were local, helpful, and I never had any problems. Then PNC moved in. At first I didn't want to switch, but the bank came on campus and branches started popping up everywhere. So for convenience I opened up an account. This has been one of the best decisions of my life. The people there are very helpful and got me set up with my account within minutes. There was no hassle, or trying to get me to open any unnecessary accounts. On many occasions of going there I see them helping people and getting their customers familiar with deposits and withdrawals through the ATM in case they are in a hurry and cannot wait inside. I also had to open a new business account there for my fraternity. I didn't know what to do or even where to start. The people at PNC gave me all the information I needed to know, and even helped me find the tax I.D. for my fraternity that had been missing. They are a great bank, with great customer service, and their newly advanced ATM machines make banking easier for me.

name: Parvathy Neelakantan
review: My husband has been using the PNC Bank's Points visa card for 2 years. Although it is not the best card ever that we have used, it does serve  the purpose. The interest rate is reasonable although not the best we have had when it comes to interest rates. I pay my monthly bill and  have the full credit every month to use. I do not wait to pay off the bills for long because of the interest rate. We have this card around because we have been having it for a couple of years and we are sure it will help us at some point of time. Overall, I would say this card is not bad, it is good but not THE BEST.

name: Athena
review: I have had an overall good experience with PNC Bank, though there have been some rocky moments as well. In general, customer service is good, very helpful, and willing to take the time to resolve an issue. I use their Virtual Wallet online, which has been extremely handy in viewing expenses, and saving money with their Savings Engine features. The downside: I initially signed up for the account, and there was a promotion going to get $100 free, if you met criteria for Direct Deposits and debit card usage. I very easily met all criteria within the first few weeks of opening the account. There was a supposed to be a 90 day waiting period, plus an extra 60 days for verification. I waited 6 months, and called in to the bank because I hadn't gotten my bonus. The representative, who claimed to head the department grilled me, and referenced other customers who had tried to get over on PNC stating they had signed up for one of their offers when they hadn't, since it hadn't automatically been deposited according to the rep. He made me research what ads I saw, and then he'd do research to find out what they were offering. He told me he'd get back to me, and when he called me, he told me he couldn't see a promotion for that time period. I called him back, and confirmed what ad I had been shown. He almost accused me of lying to him, and got very defensive, accusing me of doing so. I reminded him quietly that I was sure I conversation was being recorded, and that he would hear himself later on raising his voice at me. He calmed down, and eventually found the promotion I had been offered, verified again that I had met all criteria, and eventually credited the account. There have also been a few times where things were posted late to my account, but the bank did credit me the overdraft fees because they were in error. Overall, I use the account for its online features. Again, PNC is okay in terms of experience, but I suppose it just depends on what you need from a bank.

name: heather
review: I have been using PNC bank as my local bank now for over one year. I started using them because we moved and they were the most convenient bank in the area near my house. My local office on Colerain Avenue has a drive-thru window, a drive-thru ATM, and a walk-up ATM if the drive-thru line is too long. They don't have annoying fees and one time, I accidentally overdrew my account and they were nice enough to completely remove the overdraft fees! Even though it was my fault! That is the reason I am writing a review here today. When I find good customer service, I like to pass on the word!

name: Stephanie
review: I became a PNC customer when they purchased National City several years back. At first I was comfortable with them, but quickly discovered it may not be in my best interest to stay with them. They significantly cut back the rewards program and their policies regarding withdrawals were in favor of the bank, not the customer. For example, if a deposit and withdrawal were pending in the same day, the withdrawal would be put before the pending deposit. In instances where I was low on available funds this would routinely overdraw my account, resulting in fees. While in the end I decided to switch to another financial institution, I must say my local branch was always friendly.

name: June Houghtaling
review: I have been banking with PNC Bank for about 4 to 5 years with just a regular checking account.  PNC is a growing bank, it just recently, within the last year, opened offices in the North Florida area.  I have found that I like PNC Bank because most of their accounts are simple and straightforward.  You also have the option to earn points with each purchase and then redeem them for gifts, gift cards or cash into your account.  That is a simple Christmas Fund account at the end of the year.  PNC’s phone customer service and banking personnel have always been pleasant and helpful.  There are a number of banks that I will not bank with because of their excessive charges and hidden fees, which I have found that PNC doesn’t have.  I recommend PNC Bank if you have one in your area.

name: Adrienne Dowling
review: I was a sophomore in college and I had fallen on some tough times. I was working 2 jobs and going to school full time and had a car issue. I went to PNC for a personal loan to help get my car fixed and they were great, genuine people. They helped me every step of the way, explained everything to me and never acted bothered or annoyed when I asked a question. I was approved for my loan almost instantly and I had a check in 2 days to get my car fixed. If it wasn't for them, I would have lost my jobs and not been able to pay for my schooling. I paid the loan off quickly, as there was no penalty for early pay off. PNC is an outstanding bank and I would use them again in a heartbeat.

name: Regina Sheppard
review: I switched to Compass when I moved from Atlanta to Florida since I was banking with a local bank in Atlanta. The sign up process was easy and I was able to complete it online. Any and all discrepancies I had were handled promptly by a live person. My only issue with Compass is that there are not enough ATMs in my area, so sometimes I would have to go out of my way in order to get money out. I never received an increased amount of fees and the few times I lost my bank card they sent me a new one within days of my requesting it.

name: Jennifer Strack
review: PNC has been absolutely wonderful when it comes to my banking. Although I am a student in college, I was treated very professionally as an adult not as a child. They helped me to locate the nearest PNC to my college as well as helped make me aware of all of the options and benefits I have with my account. Every time I go into a PNC, I have always been greeted with a smile. Switching to a PNC account to have my first “on-my-own” account was one of the greatest choices I could have made as I transitioned into becoming an adult. The people are great, the company sticks true to its word, and I certainly do not plan on switching banks anytime in the near future.

name: Michelle
review: I had switched to PNC after constantly getting the runaround from another bank. In the few years I’ve been with them, I've had very few issues. Most of the tellers are friendly, though I've had one or two get an attitude because I was using my license to deposit and didn't have my account number on my person at that time. They quickly fixed a problem when someone stole my card number and quickly credited everything back to my account. The only issue I have now, is since we moved, the closest PNC is 30 miles away. I enjoy the quick service and local feel of a larger bank.

name: Alex DiTullio
review: I switched from a small local bank a few years ago to PNC.
