All the things that I liked about the small local bank such as friendly faces, helpful staff, and an excellent website layout are all present at PNC. I like that feeling of small-time local banks, but not so much their lack of locations. I get both of those with PNC. My only complaint is a minor one. I tend to stay up later than most people at night. Most of the time, when I go to check my account online the systems will be down for maintenance. This might not be a big deal for most people though; it isn't even that big for me. I know my money is sitting safe in my account, and waiting a couple hours takes care of that situation.

name: Mary Boles Herbert
review: I opened an account with Compass bank about 4 years ago when I opened my first business. I had a bit of technical difficulties with the website with opening a new account, but I went into the closest branch and they were very helpful in setting my account up. They even gave me free checks and a free stamp with my account number. My account has no fees and no minimum balance, which is nice just starting out. They have a nice secure drop box for after-hours deposits, very good ATM access, good customer service and a nice app for my iPhone for checking balances.

name: Jena Connaghan
review: My husband and I have had the PNC Banks Points Visa Card for about 5 years now. My husband got it before we were married to build some credit for himself. He also already had PNC so it was one of the few cards he could qualify for. The card has been great over the past few years. It has the lowest interest rate of any of our credit cards, and is the one card we will keep as we close out our other cards. The PNC's points program has also been great. The points program used to be connected to our debit card as well but that has now been eliminated. We have received several $100 Lowe's gift cards due to the points we have accumulated and will be ordering another shortly. Overall we have been extremely pleased with the card.

name: Aaron Haycraft
review: I recently acquired a PNC Bank Points Visa Card because of the simple fact that I already bank at PNC and I always used the points connected to my Debit card.  Since the points are no longer available on the debit card, I thought I’d give the credit card a shot.  So far, I like it.  The points catalog seems to have been expanded and include things like apps for smart phones and tablets now, and the bonus points I received for signing up have already been useful.  Granted, I treat this like a debit card and pay it off each month, so I do not let any interest build up.  Still, Count me pleased.

name: David Seibert
review: During my college years I decided to open my very own CD account, and found that PNC Bank had the most favorable rate and duration for the amount of money I was investing. During the application process the representative was very thorough with all the details and provisions regarding this account. After signing on with PNC I encountered several questions about rolling the CD over into a new one after the term was met, and I was informed correctly and was given all the options that I could use. I have now rolled the CD over twice with PNC Bank, and have turned $3,000.00 into $4,500.00 in 6 years, which I think is fantastic considering the economy.

name: Kevin Peter
review: I have the BBVA Compass ClearPoints Credit Card and I am fairly satisfied with it so far. The clear advantage of it is the low interest rate. I have excellent credit so my rate is 9.24%, the lowest available. It is fairly helpful if you have to carry a balance for some reason. Another great aspect is they offer the Visa Zero liability. Any charges that are found to be fraudulent are not held against you. This was especially helpful to me on a trip to Miami when someone got my number and charged thousands of dollars worth of merchandise before BBVA noticed. All the charges were cancelled and I was not liable for any of them. I guess this is a fairly standard practice, but it really helped me out. The biggest problem that I have with this card is that the points you earn are fairly low. One point for every dollar spent. There are better points programs available, but since BBVA does not charge a yearly fee and the interest rate is so low, I think this balances out fairly well.

name: Tara
review: This bank has the most unreliable online banking service I've ever seen. At least two times a week either the website is down (always when I absolutely need access), certain features within online banking aren’t working, or the mobile app is unavailable. Why have online banking for your customers’ convenience when it's such an inconvenience because it is unavailable all the time. I'm truly considering closing my bank account due to the lack of consistency. I wished National City was still around. Customer Service was just that; Customer Service! Greeted with a smile and always eager to assist. Where in the world did the PNC come from? I'm closing out my accounts and going to another bank who knows how to treat a customer.

name: Jenn
review: I have been with PNC Bank for approximately 2 years and have had excellent service. The staff is always friendly when I come through and have been helpful the few times I have had issues that needed resolved. I was recently granted a more superior checking account due to our income level and provides me with waived ATM fees, which removed my most major complaint about PNC Bank. Their online banking tool is very useful, though can be difficult to navigate too deeply into your past. Check ordering is easy and quick, they always send me a reminder before they renew, but renews automatically. I would recommend this bank for local banking needs as they are efficient and fair.

name: Joel Sprague
review: Since we lived in Pittsburgh for a while, I saw PNC all of the time. I didn’t personally use PNC though until they took over management of one of my credit cards. I had had the card for at least 10 years at the time, but it originally was underwritten by my credit union, and after that, National City. Last year though PNC took over underwriting of the card, so I got to experience their customer service, communication, etc. I was pleasantly surprised. For some reason, PNC always gives me the feeling of a small-town, local bank, while still giving me great service that gives me confidence that my money and information is safely protected. I highly recommend PNC to anyone looking for a new bank.

name: Randol Lopez
review: I opened up a Basic Checking account with BBVA Compass a few months ago, and I have to say that the perks that come with this type of account are excellent. There is a $10.00 a month maintenance fee if your account balance is not maintained at $ 500.00 every month.	Some of the perks that I use often are the free notary services. I am in real estate so I use them quite a bit. I should say that every notary in my area charges $10.00 for every page that needs to be notarized. This gives you an idea of how much money I am saving simply on this one service.	The unlimited check writing privileges and no fee debit card usage is a definite plus. With more and more banks charging a fee to use your debit card at say a grocery store, I am certainly glad that BBVA Compass has not followed in the same footsteps.	BBVA also offers different financial products such as home improvement loans, personal loans, business loans, and credit cards. I have taken advantage of BBVA's credit cards some of which offer a 0% introductory APR for a whole year! I mean, does it really get any better than this!    BBVA's Customer service is second to none. I have called these people on a Saturday morning and received the assistance that I required. Their 800BBVACOMPASS toll free number will take you to a live representative who will certainly assist you. They are friendly, knowledgeable, and courteous. I would definitely recommend (and have) this bank to all people out there reading this review. Give them a try, you will not be disappointed.

name: Chelsea Bunker
review: I have been a PNC member for almost two years now. Signing up was easy with one short visit. I chose PNC because they have branches near where I go to school and in my hometown. I love the online banking which I use to check my accounts, or transfer funds, and they send me alerts when my account balance is low which I set the amount that I consider to be low. As a student the virtual wallet is great and I use the app on my iPhone to bank on the go. I have always had pleasant experiences with the employees and they taught me how to fill out the deposit slips, so thank you PNC!

name: Joel Sprague
review: This was the first credit card I received, and I still have it. At the time, this was card was underwritten by National City for my credit union.  These cards were designed for college students and other people setting up new accounts.  I have had this card for 13 years now, and I’ve never had an issue with it.  They have a great fraud department, as they’ve been right on top of any possible signs of fraud (including one time when I ordered from a UK company online and then used my card locally in Chicago).  If anything, they’re too protective, but that sure beats the alternatives.  The interest has always been very reasonable, and their customer service people are top notching.  I highly recommend this card to anyone looking.

name: Heather Thompson
review: I got my first car loan at PNC Bank in Pennsylvania. I had to have a co-signer even though I was working. I guess it was because I didn't have any type of credit. My payments were under 150.00 per month and the interest rate was okay. I had a little trouble making payments when I changed jobs, and they did not work with me. Thank goodness my co-signer was a family member and continued to make payments until I could resume myself. I paid off the loan and I would recommend using this bank for a car loan.

name: Jen Kosior
review: I have had nothing but fantastic service from PNC Bank. The employees have been nothing but helpful. They are knowledgeable about their services and will do whatever they can in order to help their customers.At one time, I had someone steal my check number and pay a bill that was not mine. I went to my local branch of PNC and explained the problem. They immediately stopped the payment and rectified the situation. I was at no point charged for the issue. I also did not feel that my information was in danger at any time, as they immediately closed that account and opened a new account for me.I also deal with PNC when working with my classroom accounts. They have also been very helpful when I am cashing in coins and other monies for my students.I am truly pleased with the service that I have received at PNC Bank. I recommend this bank to all of my friends and anyone who asks. I foresee using PNC Bank for as long as I live in the Pittsburgh area.

name: Eric Bailey
review: I grew up with parents who were National City customers, and naturally set me up with my own “junior” savings account as a child. Soon enough I had my own checking account when I got my first job, but it was actually not until I moved out of the house that I got a credit card in order to build up credit towards an eventual home purchase. By then, the bank was now PNC, and I picked their Points card because the variety of rewards they had interested me. Sure enough, I was soon using my credit card for everyday purchases such as groceries and gasoline in order to turn in my earned points towards items like gift cards for Target or Starbucks. Eventually, I had built up decent credit, was paying off my credit card balance off, and was able to sign off on a mortgage through PNC before moving into my very own home.

name: John Tompson
review: I opened an account with Compass 2 years ago. I opened the account because I was in need of a direct deposit and a check/debit card. Applying was very easy and I was set up with what I needed within an hour. I have only had a few times I've had to contact BBVA customer service, and that's because it was my fault. I had been overdrawn and was charged a fee. I am on a fixed income so the fee really threw me off and upset me. I called the 1-800 number and explained the situation to the operator, who quickly reversed the charge and allowed me to deposit money to cover the overdraft fee.On two or three different occasions this has happened (all my fault, mind you) and the customer service has been absolutely fantastic and has reversed the charges incurred, allowing me to get my finances back on track. I hope to remain a customer with Compass in the future for a very long time and I would wholeheartedly recommend them to anyone. Excellent customer service!

name: Sarina Daniels
review: I have been with BBVA Compass since my parents opened my first bank account when I was in elementary school, with only a crisp $100 bill from my grandparents that I thought could have bought me the world. Since then, a lot has changed. I am a college student, still banking with BBVA Compass, and for the most part, my experiences have been positive. The compass banks in the areas I've lived (Houston, TX and Auburn, AL) have undergone remodeling and have new computer systems, and my experiences have gotten better over time.Problem resolution has been an issue for me above anything else. For 3 consecutive months, my no-minimum student checking account was improperly charged a flat fee for insufficient funds, overdrafting my account the second time. I went into the bank and sat down with my banker every time and had it resolved, but the fees kept coming. However, every time I went into the bank, the staff was very helpful and apologetic, and all of the fees and overdraft charges were refunded in full and in a timely manner. Other than the few issues I've had with charges, I have found Compass to be a reliable and thoughtful bank, and it has undergone changes in the last year to two years that have increased my faith and trust in them.When I opened a new checking account for my university funds, I received a handwritten letter from the bank teller I've known for years wishing me luck at university and explaining all the forms that were sent along with the letter. Over all, Compass has served me well, and I do not plan on switching banks in the foreseeable future.

name: Amanda Ramsey
review: We have been banking with Compass for nearly six years now. We love their checking account with no minimum balance. We even have the option to get ATM fees refunded to us when we use other banks' ATMs! Customer service is always friendly, no matter which location we visit. The employees always seem to be having fun with one holiday or another.All of our transactions with Compass have gone very smoothly until we attempted to add a savings account. When we gave all of our information over the phone, the attendant told us that we would only need to come into the branch to sign in order to finish things up. Well, that was not true. We had to give all of the information over again, and then we were informed that an automatic deposit must come from our checking each month into our new savings. That would not have been a problem either, except that it's been two months now, and none of those “automatic” deposits have occurred. I suppose we will have to call and see what is going on with that!

name: Traci Carson
review: I have been with PNC since it was National City bank, and I have to say that it's become a much better bank since the changeover. Back when I first got a checking account through National City, I had a lot of issues through them. The moment PNC took over, though, things changed. Their customer service is top-notch, I've never had any trouble with getting the help I need. I also enjoy that the switchover allowed me to keep my checking account with no fees. In this day and age it's very rare to find a bank that lets you have a checking account with no fees, so that was a great perk. I visit the same branch all the time and the customer service reps and bankers there all know me by name, I stop and chat with them every time I'm there. Overall I love PNC Bank. Great products, great customer service, great employees. Highly recommended.

name: Prescott Kagan
review: I switched over to PNC from Chase and what a difference. I originally switched over due to the fact that PNC is one of the few remaining banks that still offer a checking account with no fees. Chase was charging me fees for having an account and fees for balance requirements. PNC has none of that nonsense with their virtual wallet service. All business with PNC can also be handled online with a fantastic user friendly interface that is by far the best online bank interface I've used. Customer service has been top notch every time I've gone into the bank as well. I couldn't be happier with the bank and I highly recommend to anyone looking for a new bank for checking.

name: Mark Hanna
review: My first credit card ever was this card. I remember sitting there when I was 18 the bank manager said right before "don't be upset if you are not approved" and then I was cleared for a 3500 dollar limit which surprised me. Over the next four years I abused the card and didn't make smart purchases however working to pay it off was easy and the pnc people helped me out a lot. They offer excellent customer service and a competitive interest rate. Even when I had some late payments I was in a jam one time and they increased my credit limit by 1000 dollars. I wish sometimes that I still had that card but I am happy to not have to worry or the hassle on my mind. My favorite thing about the card was the online system where I could track my points, my payment schedule, and my purchases online.

name: Yan Collelo
review: A PNC card was the first card that I had ever used, so naturally I was a bit worried about getting everything set up. I had nothing to worry about, as I was able to get everything set up without any trouble at all. The best thing about using PNC is without a doubt their amazing customer service, the few times I needed assistance I was on and off the phone with my problem solved in less than five minutes. Asides from that utilizing PNC gives you access to a decent points system, where you can occasionally cash in your points for various gift cards! In conclusion, I have yet to have a negative experience using PNC and the various bonuses they provide more than make them worth using.

name: Katie Chapman
review: I was a National City customer until PNC took over. I was worried about the change at first but I have nothing but positive things to say about PNC. I once lost my card and they were really quick to help get me a replacement and helped me with what I needed to know to prevent fraud on my old card. I use this card almost every day and I have never had any issues with it or with PNC. My favorite part has got to be the points that I earn when I buy things with it. I usually try to wait until the end of the year or around my birthday and cash in the points. This past year I was able to get a $100 Amazon gift card with my points, it was amazing. I couldn't be more satisfied with this card.

name: Frank Avalos
review: When my wife and I used to live in Arizona we had a checking account with BBVA and were beyond satisfied. At the time we had just switched from an accredited credit union to this bank and we weren't quite sure if it would meet our expectations. But my wife and I were proven wrong. BBVA was a great financial institution that knew how to treat its customers with courtesy, care, and respect. In those rare occurrences when we would have an issue, BBVA's staff was completely forthcoming with regards to information, and that made reconciling so much easier and faster. Although we no longer have an account with them, we highly recommend them as bank people can trust.

name: Siobhan Medders
review: I'm a big fan of this PNC card- it's the main card that I use. I get reward points when I use it and have redeemed them for gift cards (usually to Target!). The customer service is really why I keep the card though- if there is any kind of issue with the card or account the customer service people are eager to correct it and do so promptly. (That being said, there isn't usually a problem with the account.) My experience with this card has been so good that I have used PNC for other banking services. I would highly recommend it! You can also hook it up to a debit account so that it can be used as either debit or credit.

name: Fae Goldy
review: I've been a PNC customer for many years now. I opened up a Visa Credit Card with them several years ago, and have no complaints at all. They were very helpful the time my card was stolen. I called right away, and the woman I spoke to was wonderful. She didn't make me feel stupid or like I wasn't responsible. Within a week I had my new card in the mail, and one charge I did have to dispute, was taken care of right away. There is no hidden charges or fees. This is one card I will never cancel.  There is nothing bad to say about this card or PNC Bank.

name: Serena
review: I have had many banks in the past give me a hard time when I have claimed to have purchased something under false pretenses or if the product I receive was not the product advertised. At my branch I can honestly say that after feeling taken advantage of by someone who claims to be a reputable merchant they don't make me feel worse about the whole thing. Actually they responded rather kindly and quickly. As well with the high standards that a quality financial institution has to offer there is a sense of family. A commitment especially from my specific branch to help with my needs and not just look at me depending on how much I have in my account but rather, that I am a person utilizing what they have to offer. And they only seem to offer more Paul Hart is a valuable asset to PNC. He has definitely been an asset to me when it comes to my banking.

name: Sam Russell
review: I really like PNC Bank and I will tell you why.  Someone stole my debit card information off the internet and PNC did a great job of quickly freezing my account.  They also helped me to get my money back which was awesome.  I was able to get a new card quickly and everything was taken care of.  I will always remember this because getting my information was very frustrating but PNC really did everything they could to help me during the process and for that I am truly satisfied.  I know that I will continue to use PNC bank because I know that I can trust them with all of my problems.

name: Marie
review: I opened an account with this bank based solely on their Virtual Wallet feature. I'm somewhat ashamed to say that I watched a commercial, and more or less immediately went to the computer to set up an account. The application process was incredibly simple - it only took a few minutes, and my accounts were fully active very quickly. I don't know why more banks haven't added a feature like the virtual Wallet - it's like having a mint account completely integrated with your actual bank, and helps you track patterns in your spending really easily. This feature has helped me control my spending very effectively. The iPhone app is also great - it's the best banking app I've used so far. Customer service has also been excellent - I've never had trouble getting to an actual person on the phone, and their automated menu is not very painful. My emails have also been answered quite quickly. All in all, I'm very happy with my experience here, and I'll probably look into more services with them in the future.

name: Gary
review: I have to admit I was quite skeptical when PNC Bank acquired National City in 2010, because I'd been with NC for years, and this was a major change.  To their credit, very few things changed once they did.  They still offer free checking if you use Direct Deposit, though that consists of them making a $10 charge each month, and then crediting it back, which isn't ideal, but at least it does get credited back.Their online banking is excellent.  I use the bill-pay services almost exclusively, as it allows me to import all of my bills and pay them from one place each month.  Setting up a biller that isn't in their system is easy but can be a bit lengthy, and there are many -- especially in the medical field -- that are not already in their system.Other than the $10 in/out for Direct Deposit "free checking", I've had no issues with them, which is a pleasant surprise.  Their tellers are friendly and courteous as are their branch managers (at least in my city), and it really is a pleasure doing business with them, and not just something that you say.  I was seriously considering switching to a credit union when PNC bought National City, but now I'm glad I didn't.

name: Breenette Lawrence
review: The bank is a pretty good bank, the service is 5 stars and the application process is painless. Although it isn't clearly stated that if your account runs low they charge you 1.00 every day and every four days 4.00 can be quite the pain. Problem resolution is three stars because sometimes the bank simply seems as though they are telling you its not their problem, they can fix it but don't want to fix it and so you must deal with it. Overall this is a high quality banking facility with great customer service and friendly staff that is always willing to help out a customer in need.

name: Bryce Langlotz
review: PNC has been fantastic so far as they have been helpful and easy to set up an account with. The one minor issue I've had is the mobile deposit function on the virtual wallet up. For some reason it doesn't recognize the correct amount on the check and suggests a correct amount which is the same amount that I entered as the value of the check, it then corrects the value to the value it thought was correct and still won't let me deposit it  It is extremely inconsistent and makes it inconvenient to have to actually go to the bank to cash a paycheck; however when it comes down to it this has been such a minute detail that overall I would recommend them to anyone.  As for the actual functionality of the account, card and customer service it is nearly perfect.

name: Mary
review: I have been really pleased with my experiences at PNC, after switching from a bank with poor customer service. PNC's online banking experience is easy to use and helps me manage my money better. I also have an auto loan from PNC- their customer service rep was really helpful in figuring out what loan was best for me. They made an error with one of my loan payments but were quick to correct it and apologetic. My experiences, on the whole, have been really positive, and I plan to continue to do business with them for a long time.

name: Brett Fitzgerald
review: I have had my PNC Health Savings Account for three years now and I very much enjoy it. It comes with a debit card to make medical purchases and billing very easy. I never am questioned about it or its uses being so hassle-free is very important to me. I have never had to contact their customer support about any issues, except for when I set up my online banking information so I could check my balance online. Overall, working with them has been a great experience and I look forward to continue my banking with PNC. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Edward Mitchell
review: I used PNC’s business checking on a daily basis while at my previous job as manager for a small business. In my time with the company, I really have nothing bad at all to say about PNC. The tellers were always very friendly, going so far as to get to know me on a first name basis. With the nature of the business I was in, money was often floating into the account (whether it be check, credit card processing, etc.), and we would run into the occasional overdraft. PNC never bounced our checks; they simply let us pay them back. This saved us a lot of potential grief with our suppliers. Overall, I found our PNC to be a great bank that actually cared about us as customers.

name: Jaime
review: I really enjoyed my time with PNC Bank. I established the account as soon as I got out of high school and they practically grew up with me. They walked me through getting the account set up and explained all the services available to me. I appreciated the notices I would get letting me know whenever the account would get overdrawn and how appreciated it was when a representative went over my account and explained some tools that would be beneficial for me and would help me to not continue to overdraw. Customer service was always helpful and always pleasant whenever I spoke with them. I really do appreciate the fact that anytime I had a question or was trying to do a transaction, they were available to assist. I can recall doing a balance transfer with my card and how helpful the rep was that assisted me. I enjoyed PNC bank and all of the perks that it had to offer. I recently moved but I would still be with them if there was a branch in my area!

name: Rob
review: I recently switched from Bank of America to PNC Bank, mainly because PNC offers free checking.  I have been using PNC regularly for about three months now, and I actually enjoy banking; even more importantly I now enjoy saving money!  PNC's mobile apps and websites are what sets it apart from Bank of America, and all of the other banks that I compared.  PNC offers not only a checking and savings account (for free), but also for free, PNC offers a high yield growth account.  As long as you use your debit card for 5 purchases a month you get a high yield rate in this growth account.  Methods of putting money in this account range from direct deposits to punch the pig (a feature that allows you to save as little as $1 at a time at any time, hassle free.  On top of the extra account, the online banking is awesome.  It categorizes all of your purchases (gas, entertainment, groceries, etc.) for a quick glance at how you are spending; it even allows you to customize these labels and remembers them for later.  The best mobile feature is mobile deposit of checks.  Just snap a picture of front and back and you're good to go.  Adding electronic payment for credit cards is easy and convenient.  Once they are synced up it shows you when and what payment is due at the top of online banking whenever you sign in.  Scheduling payments is a snap, and hasn't failed me yet.Their customer service is great as well.  I have yet to have the need to go to a branch (amazing I know), but all of their phone customer service reps have been a delight to work with, and all of their policies seem very straight forward at this point in time.  I love that the debit cards have Visa paywave.. great for in and out at gas stations.  It really has been an overhaul of my financial life, which was once scary, and now I feel in control.Overall PNC is refreshingly convenient and dare I say fun to bank with.  They own all Wawa ATMs and their branch presence is growing daily with their recent acquisition of RBC.  I recommend PNC to anyone I know that I hear complaining about their current bank.  I honestly could not be happier.

name: Jennifer Fidalgo
review: I joined PNC bank on the Internet. I found that the application process was very easy. I filled out my information and deposited some money into the bank. Within a few days I had gotten my banking information. I was glad that this came because I had a home job that paid through direct deposit. I was able to set up direct deposit easily. I liked the virtual wallet feature because it allowed me to try to save money for future needs while spending other money on bills and daily needs. The problem that I had with PNC was that I did not make a lot of money and even with careful watch there were times that my account went over the limit. It was hard to wait for the money to get to my account because the bank fees went up right away. Sometimes calling the company was helpful but there were times that my problems were not fully resolved. These are problems that could happen at other banks which is why I put average.

name: Dan Imhoff
review: I don’t have many credit cards, but I really like this one.  The PNC/Visa people were very responsive when I had an issue with my card.  They raised my credit limit when I requested it after some time of good standing.  I really like point system too.  I forgot about it for a while, after just using it for gas and little day to day expenses and paying off the balance, I checked my points balance and was able to get a gift card for home depot.  I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a first credit card.  It was my first card, and I have no complaints.

name: Dave
review: When I was a college student, I used PNC for a student loan for one of my summer classes one semester. I asked a teller and they directed me to a customer service agent. They were very friendly and I did not wait much to meet with a representative. He was very informative and described the loan process for me. The rates were higher than I was expecting but everything he showed me was clear and precise. I was able to get all the information I needed and my loan was approved a couple days later. It took longer than expected but everything was fine at the end. I would look to PNC again for special loans.

name: jeremy
review: I had an account running with PNC Bank for a period of time a year or so ago. In all of my interactions with the bank, I never ran into any disrespect or an issue withdrawing my money. They have a cool addition to their online banking which made it stand out in my opinion from other banks. They have the virtual wallet, which is a really easy way to use online banking. You get cool information about reserves in your account, as well as having a spend/savings account in the Virtual Wallet. You can switch money between the accounts at any time online. You can automatically draw on the savings if you are out and spend over your funds in the spend section of the account. This, along with their consistent service, made them seem like a reputable bank and one worth considering. 5 Stars for the online wallet and good service.

name: Dima Ivanyuk
review: My time with PNC bank has been a good experience thus far. Whenever I go to the bank, I can always be sure that my issues will be handled professionally and efficiently. There is a never a lacking concern that I may forget any business as the staff doubles checks to make sure that they have handled any questions or concerns I may have. At times, however, I have gotten slightly frustrated by customer service on the telephone. If a complicated issue arises, they are usually clueless about what to do, and must put me on hold while they ask their boss how to handle my situation. Usually, this is the point in which I go to the bank. Other than this small complaint, PNC Bank does a great job all-around! I am sure I will stay a loyal customer to this bank for many years to come!

name: Laura
review: Compass Bank is very on top of their checking account issues, etc. The staff that I have dealt with at numerous branches have always been kind to me and have always been more than willing to help me with anything I needed done. I will always, as long as BBVA Compass is open, stay with Compass. My father was Compass and now my sister and I are at Compass. It is a honest establishment that is more than willing to serve your banking needs. I would suggest Compass over any other bank. I have banked with one other bank and was displeased when I, at the time being a college student and having a college student account with them, began being charged monthly charges for not having at least $500 in my account. What college student really does? However, my biggest complaint is that they did not inform this to me at any time. Compass will NEVER do this to you. At least they never have to me. They have always been on their toes and never cease to impress me.

name: Amanda House
review: I truly love this PNC Bank. My entire family back home uses this bank. The people that work here are courteous and very helpful. Neither I nor my family has ever had any problems with this wonderful bank. The customer service is wonderful, the application process I went through was extremely easy and fast, and they are always there if you need them. I would recommend this bank to anyone with a PNC bank in their area. I now live in a different area where this bank is not around, however I still keep my PNC bank account. PNC Bank is one of the best banks that I have ever had.

name: Zac Walker
review: Overall I have had a great experience with using PNC. I have had accounts with many other banks before settling on this one and have been nothing but happy since. I opened a "Virtual Wallet" checking account and love all of the online features and options that I have with the account. As a college student I am always on the go and having complete control over my account online and on my phone has been a huge resource for me. Customer service at my local branch has always been top notch and they have always done everything they can to assist me with anything I needed regarding my accounts. Since using PNC has been so great for me, my wife has even opened an account with them as well!

name: Avery Gonzales
review: The experience I have personally received from the checking account of BBVA Compass has been awesome. When I first signed up with BBVA Compass I have received a great looking card. The customer service is also incredibly nice and helpful. This was the first bank account I had ever opened and I'm still with them today. Of course I have looked at other banks and opened accounts but I always had troubles with other banks. Not at BBVA Compass. At BBVA Compass they held my hand through the entire process of opening a bank account and told me everything I needed to know. I still remember the things they told me the day I opened my account many years ago. I love BBVA Compass.

name: Bradley Girard
review: PNC is a great bank that I've been using for about 5 years now. It was a simple process signing up and I've never had a problem with them. Their customer service is great. I once lost my card and they instantly cancelled it and gave me a new one without hesitation and free of charge. I never have to worry about being charged for simple transactions, lack of activity, or any other hidden charges. I also enjoy the fact that I never have to enter the bank to make a deposit because I can simply do it through an ATM or by using their great app that just takes a picture of the check and goes through within a week. I recommend this bank to everyone I know and will continue to do so.

name: Jeremy Embrey
review: I have been using PNC for about 8 years and they have yet to let me down. I started with one of their free student checking accounts when I first enrolled in college. I have since moved on to a Virtual Wallet account. It is very easy to keep track of the money in all of my accounts, and I'm constantly updated whenever pending charges clear or when an automatic payment occurs. Their web portal is very well laid out and easy to use, making it simple to set up a bill payment or transfer money between accounts. The same goes for their Virtual Wallet Android app, which also allows you to deposit checks through you phone's built in camera. The PNC Points system is also a nice bonus, allowing you to earn gift cards, goods, and other rewards.

name: Christian Groeschel
review: I've been with PNC bank for two years and I absolutely love them. I opened up a free checking account on my campus and it's extremely convenient. The place is always clean, the staff is polite and helpful, and the numerous ATM machines around town make it convenient to withdraw money at any time. The applications process is very easy and it took me about 15 minutes to speak to someone, get an account set up, and deposit money. There is literally a PNC located just about everywhere I go, and I'm going to be a customer with them for a very long time.

name: Mateo Louis
review: I have been a member of Compass bank for over three years and have a checking account with them.  They are extremely friendly and have great customer service every time I go in there or have a problem.  I have heard people complain about unfair fees, but have never encountered any myself.  It is unfortunate that there are not more locations.  I have a couple that are close to my house, but if I am not close to home it is sometimes difficult to find a bank.  Also, it is not a fully national bank so if you are on vacation or out of town there is a good chance you will not be able to find a bank where you are.  However, Compass has always returned ATM fees from ATMs that are not Compass as long as I bring the receipts into a location.  This is an extremely helpful policy and helps to make up for their lack of banks/ATMs around the country and is the opposite of my former bank, Wells Fargo, which charged me a fee from them on top of the fee at the ATM for using a non-Wells Fargo ATM.  Overall, I am very happy with Compass Bank.

name: Becky Thomson
review: We have been a BBVA Compass customer for a number of years, although, it didn't start out as BBVA Compass when we first opened an account with them. They bought our bank Guaranty. They sent us the information about our accounts being changed over to BBVA Compass. They didn't explain how the bank applies the transactions. In that, the largest amount will be applied first even if a small amount was taken first. They closed our debit cards down without any notice. I was not happy about that. I had to go in person to talk to the local branch, although the assistant branch manger was very helpful.

name: Ula Mcclintic
review: I have the basic PNC card, and have had this type of card for five years. Extremely basic, doesn’t come with any rewards or that sort since it’s been the first and only card I’ve had. I had to replace my old credit card about a month ago because it was going to expire. I got another card within about one business week after I requested for a new one. So far I haven’t had any problems with it. The only thing that is worrying me is that the letters on the front of the card are slowly starting to fade out from it being in my wallet, but I can still make out what it says just fine.

name: Gabe
review: PNC is a great place to open up an account. I've been with them for 4-5 years now, and have never had a problem. Depositing checks and cash with the tellers are always quick, and they always are nice and friendly. Transactions do not take very long to process, usually it will take a day to get it done. Being able access it on my mobile phone is great too, especially when I need to check my account quickly and don't have access to the nearest computer. I had a problem earlier in the year where I thought I encountered fraud, so I quickly called PNC to take the best measures. The other person on the line helped me get things solved and I got a new debit card, after canceling my old one, in just a week. Couldn't have asked for better customer service.

name: Michael
review: I have had a free checking account with PNC bank for two years. The branch tellers have always been friendly, and I find their online banking website to be secure and simple to use. In the Pittsburgh area, it is generally easy to find a PNC ATM. Moreover, I travel a lot, so I often have to make international wire transfers. PNC has their own SWIFT code, so international wire transfers do not go through an intermediary, inccurring additional fees. Furthermore, the fees they charge for receiving international wire transfers are reasonable. I also have not encountered any issues using my PNC debit card throughout Asia. That is, I have always been able to withdrawal cash from ATMs accepting international credit cards and have not had my account frozen unnecessarily. I would recommend signing up for a checking account with PNC.

name: Ashley Perry
review: I became a member of PNC Banks when they bought out RBC Bank and I must say that I love it. Everything was clearly expressed during the changeover. All the services that I had come to enjoy, they continued and then went beyond what I expected. I can always get a hold of a member with any questions. Plus they all have been very amiable and helpful. I was quickly given my new cards that I was able to switch over that made it easy to change without interfering with my daily activities. They even created a new online access that I changed over immediately and have had no problems using and maintaining my account.

name: Stacey
review: I've been using PNC bank for almost 4 years now and they have been great during this time.  I signed up for a free checking account when I started college because my previous bank was not in the area of my school.  Luckily, PNC banks can be found almost everywhere! The website is extremely helpful and easy to use, and I love the mobile application for making the cashing of checks and checking of my balance extremely easy.  I love being able to deposit cash and checks quickly and easily at the ATM when I need to.  I have also experienced great customer service every time I stop into the bank.  I once had a security issue with someone trying to log into my online account and PNC froze my online account login until I spoke with an employee personally to reset and secure my information.  The man I spoke to on the phone was very helpful and made me feel safe with their security precautions. I have had no issues since.  I only have positive things to say about PNC because every experience and interaction with this bank and its associates has been superb!

name: Trent Johnson
review: PNC has been very good to me for the 3 years I have been banking with them. They have a superb online banking/checking site. I have had to call customer service a few times due to online banking troubles (My account was frozen due to people phishing for usernames) and each time I have had the problem it was fixed in under 5 minutes. They also allow for banking over the phone which has saved me from over drafting on my account when I couldn't get to my computer or an ATM. The online banking is confusing at first, but it easy to get the hang of things after 2 or 3 uses.

name: Jessica
review: I have been a PNC customer for more than ten years and have always had a great experience with them. The account managers that I work with are typically very helpful and are able to solve my problems quickly. I recently experienced a situation in which I had an overdraft charge after a company charged my account by mistake. PNC helped me to resolve the problem quickly and were very helpful. I have never had a difficult time getting a hold of someone when I had banking problems, and issues have always been solved quickly. I wish that PNC was more widely available throughout the country, as this has been my only issue with the bank.

name: Rebecca Simone
review: PNC bank is really helpful. when I lost my purse and had to replace everything but needed money before I could get it all back, and needed it desperately as I was living in a hotel, they helped me get a new ATM and some cash with what identifying items I had left. Plus when I accidentally overdrew my account they were willing to refund the fees since I wasn't in the habit of doing so. They were very friendly and very understanding in both cases. All in all I've had a pretty good experience with PNC bank and I'd highly recommend getting an account with them, especially when they offer their cash incentives for opening one. You should check their supermarket branches for those deals when you're in Giant.

name: Amanda Wallace
review: I had a 4 year car loan with PNC. About 3 years into it I started having financial problems and I missed 2 payments. I called customer service right away to explain to them what was going on. I was waiting for a small cash settlement to come in and informed customer service that as soon as the money came in I would be making my payment to get my loan current again and I would also be making the next month’s payment to get myself a little ahead. I asked the customer service rep if this would be satisfactory and they said yes, it was no problem. On the day my settlement came in, which was only 5 business days after the CSR said it would be satisfactory they came and took my car away. No warning, they just took it. I had no clue they would do this since the CSR assured me as long as I made my back payments in the next 14 business days I would be fine. I thought someone stole the car until I called the police and they informed me PNC took it. I was furious and called the customer service rep I had been dealing with. She then informed me there was nothing she could do and the only way to get my car back would be to pay off the entire loan. This of course was nothing like what we originally discussed. She lied to me and told me things that she couldn’t even follow through with. If I had known they could not wait for my cash settlement to come in I would have borrowed money from my father to avoid this whole mess. I realize I messed up by missing 2 payments but the CSR clearly lied to me about what my options were.  So needless to say, I will never go to PNC bank for any financial needs again.

name: Joe Miller
review: I have been with PNC bank for 4 or 5 years now and couldn't be more pleased. I created my free checking account as a high school student and it was quick and simple. My bank teller, Carson, was always there to help me with any problems or questions I had. I encountered overdrafts on a couple occasions and had no conflict with the policy or payments. I have since moved from Ohio, where I had originally joined PNC, down to the Atlanta area. PNC, as of a year ago, did not have any locations in my area. I held on to my free checking account regardless, because after years of a hassle-free banking account, it was too good to give up. Luckily for me a Canadian bank name Flagstar sold all 27 of their locations to PNC shortly after I moved here and now I'm surrounded by PNC locations! I couldn't ask for much more. I have direct deposit straight to my free checking account and debit card. It gets used daily, and there's never a hiccup in sending or receiving payments. The best part? It's an actual FREE checking account. 5 stars all the way!

name: Jay Garza
review: I used to be a customer of Compass Bank for a long time but I changed banks after a while because all the fees they try to milk out of you.  Do not use your debit card and not have enough money in the back to cover the transaction because this bank will find a way to hit you with large fees.  The website and online capability is horrible when compared to other major banks.  One of the last straws was they started to charge me a monthly fee for my checking account then a fee because I didn’t use my bank account enough.  It would be in your best interest to steer clear of this bank and move on to one of the larger more reputable banks.

name: Kay
review: I love banking with PNC because the branch I go to has really helpful people. Once I had about four different things I had to do there (depositing checks, getting cash out, asking about a home equity line, and talking about refinancing our mortgage). Luckily, I went toward the end of the afternoon and I was able to make my deposit and get my cash out with no wait at all. The time I went to ask about the home equity line of credit and the possibility of refinancing the mortgage, I was greeted very quickly and got all the information I needed. I did not end up refinancing, but the staff was knowledgeable and helpful and did not push me to do it when I decided I did not want to.

name: Amber Horne
review: My experience with PNC bank has been great! My boyfriend and i both have an account with PNC!  Every location I have used this bank customer service has been extremely friendly! 9 out of 10 times there is no long lines or wait, they are fast and efficient. They work with you to explain all of the terms and conditions so there is no confusion. In all my time with PNC I have gotten all of my statements on time and myself I have never had an overdraft fee. They also have a fantastic online site so you can check your accounts at any time and keep track of all activity right from home! There are many benefits to opening an account of any kind with PNC and I absolutely enjoy them! Overall I would rate them 4 stars and I would recommend this bank to anyone, because of the great customer service and benefits.

name: Ruth
review: We have tried several banks lately after moving to the area. This was our third bank & so far we are really happy with what we have experienced. There are many features we can use online, over the phone, through the convenient ATM, and even an iPhone app! There are no hidden fees (like we saw with other banks) and we haven't had any issues so far. The customer service has been great and we also enjoy the flexibility of having so many accounts linked to one another. Thanks, PNC, for doing a great job taking care of your customers!

name: Benjamin
review: I absolutely love PNC. When I first opened my account they were the only ones I had ever heard of giving points that can be redeemed for actual merchandise, with just having a few checking account. Today that of course has changed and the points are reserved for people with a monthly average balance of 1500.00 or more, but the fact remains the same, the company is amazing to it's customers. Whether it being applying for a student loan, or taking out a mortgage on a home, both of which I have done through PNC, the service is always incredible, and the make things as easy as can be. Thank you PNC!

name: Krista
review: I have a PNC Free Checking account that I chose because there are many nearby branches in my area.  I got to one in particular and the tellers always remember my name and ask me about myself, they seem to genuinely care.  Their mobile app and the Virtual Wallet make my life awesome, I can easily transfer money on the go and the Virtual Wallet really helps me save money in the long run.  However, there is a limit to the number of online transfers you can do, which is aggravating and, I feel, pointless.  Overall, I feel as though PNC is a pretty good bank.  They offer many services, are friendly and, depending on where you're located, it's very easy to find a close location.

name: Jenny
review: I became a member of PNC Bank after I moved cross-country for grad school.  PNC had many locations around my city and I decided to go in and check it out.  I spoke with a banker, who was the nicest banker I have ever spoken with.  They offer free checking and savings with their product called Virtual Wallet.  I love Virtual Wallet.  Before I had PNC I used Wells Fargo and I didnât have that great of an experience with them, PNC Bank is totally different.  The online banking is easy to use and their Virtual Wallet has many helpful features like goals, a âpunch the piggyâ piggy bank, and an interactive calendar.  Iâm a visual artist and I appreciate the time they took to make their online banking look good, be functional and user friendly.  I donât think I will be changing banks anytime soon.  Everyone is so helpful, the locations are all over my city, and the over-draft fees are very reasonable compared to Wells Fargo.  They also allow a certain amount of over-draft fee wavers, so if you happen to over-draw, just give a call and they usually help you out.  I would definitely recommend this bank to my friends, and I have in the past.

name: Julie
review: My husband and I have been using PNC Bank since Feb. 2012. Although we are new to this bank we are very pleased. I like that we get free checks for our checking account. We are able to check our statement online at any time. I feel their website is very secure and I have no problem checking my account online. We mostly use our free debit card which I really love. They have the best drive through service that is fast and friendly. Customer service is also great if you ever have any questions. I would recommend PNC bank to my family and friends.

name: Ashley
review: I have had a PNC/National City account for the past 5 years and I have never had an issue with the bank. I am entirely satisfied with the service I have received from those over the phone and also for those whom I have worked with in person. However, I do wish that there was not a charge or fee for the bank statements that I order in, as this is a hassle--although I understand the ability to print them online ahead of time. I have to say, PNC's customer service and care is top notch, along with the perks of having a free checking and savings account of course.

name: Katie Embrey
review: I have three accounts with PNC. I love this bank, it offers everything I ever need in a bank. I've lost my credit card on multiple occasions, and the Customer Service is completely responsive and helpful. Every time I go into a PNC bank, it is very clean and very friendly. I would recommend this bank to anybody who wants a great banking experience. They have great incentives, including that there is no charge at any PNC ATM you withdraw money from. They refund your money at any three ATM's that are not PNC. The application process for this bank is easy, you just need to bring an photo ID and proof of residency. I am never going to switch banks, PNC will be my bank for as long as I need one.

name: Andrew
review: I've been a customer of PNC bank for 5 years now. I've experienced their service in four different states and I have to say that all the branches were fantastic. Their tellers are always polite and courteous and they always try to connect with me whenever I go there. Their checking accounts are free of charge which is very nice for a college student like me since it's hard to keep a minimum balance in there at all times. I would recommend PNC for everyone.

name: John Updegraff
review: I have been with BBVA Compass when they were just Compass Bank here in Birmingham. I have kept all my savings and checking accounts with them just because it is easier to not change and because they have never given me a reason to changes services to another bank. They have been very routine in terms of what I need as a customer. There are really no bells or whistles here, but I must say that I did inquire about a car loan once and their rates seemed to be higher than surrounding banks I called. For the most basic of services that I could ever need they would be a definite recommendation, but for more detailed needs like a mortgage or car loan I would go to a bigger bank for assistance.

name: Nikki Irene
review: Well, just last Friday I decided to open up a checking account with PNC. I have to say so far they seem to be a really good bank. I walked right in to my local PNC bank and they welcomed me with open arms. I had never heard of PNC before I moved to North Carolina.I really enjoy the fact that they have real free checking and not like the bank I had before. So glad I switched banks. Not only do they offer free checking but all I had to do was deposit $35.00 to open up an account not like my other bank were you had to have $100.00 to open up an account.

name: Gabrielle Santora
review: This is a card that I had just gotten recently, a little over a month ago. I use it on a daily basis for things such as going out to eat, gas money, and clothing. The quality of the card itself is average to low, however the service is improved from my previous bank. The online banking is a huge step up from what I had and is convenient to me since I earn money online a lot and like to transfer funds from online sources to the card. Overall, it's a nice card if you need something very basic.

name: Chris Scruggs
review: I use the card a lot for groceries and gas and online purchases, and it is very easy to go to PNC's website to pay it off. However, one time I was without internet so I tried paying by phone, they said they would charge me a "convenience fee", so I had to go into the bank. I earn points with my purchases, but the rewards aren't very good so I've never used it. I always pay off the card on time so I'm not familiar with the late fees. It's a very basic card and that's all I needed.

name: Tyler Kershner
review: This card has been an extremely useful asset to have in my post-collegiate years.  For one thing, the interest rate is quite low, comparatively.  Secondly, it ears 1% cashback on all purchases.  This isn't an extremely huge number, but it can really add up when you put it out of your mind - periodically you'll realize that you have an extra $50 to add to your account.  Finally, the card is extremely easy to manage using PNC's online services.  I can view an incredible number of statistics and analyze trends very easily.  Similarly, paying the card is a snap using the online service.  I would absolutely recommend this card.

name: WalletHub
review: I’m so glad to hear that you’ve been pleased with you card.  However, the fact that it requires excellent credit for approval means that you are probably a good candidate for a card with a lower interest rate or better rewards.  Which you choose depends on whether you pay your bill in full every month or not.  If you do, you may find that a card like the Capital One Venture or the Blue Cash Preferred from American Express will prove more lucrative.  If you don’t, Citi has a couple of different cards that offer 0% on new purchases for 18 months.

name: Anita Herschberger
review: I've been with PNC since 2009 (when it was still National City), and have loved it for the most part. The employees at the location I go to are always nice and polite, and there is even one gentleman who will occasionally strike up a conversation with me while I'm waiting in line. It makes waiting, which I'm not good at, much less annoying when I have someone to take my focus off of how long I've been waiting. One thing I also appreciate is their attention to security of my accounts. I went in shortly after I had moved, and the teller helping me noticed that my address on my driver's license did not match what was on my account (I had changed my address online already). As a precaution, she had me confirm my account information. I'd like to think that they are that security conscious for everyone.The only thing I don't like is the limit on online transfers. Sometimes I have a need for funds that I didn't previously know about, so it puts me in a bind if I've already made the number of allowable transfers for the month.

name: Jenny Strat
review: I have been a member of PNC bank for six years, and I have to say I am very happy. I take my money and finances very seriously, and I am happy that PNC and their employees do too. When I first got out of college I could not find a bank that did not require a minimum balance. It is hard enough to worry about bills and money, but the last thing I want to worry about is not being charged to have a safe place to keep my money. PNC has given me a free checking and a savings account, which has given me the ability to help pay off my bills. They are efficient and friendly, every time I go to visit them. Before I utilize a company I always ask myself, " What can this company do for me that another company cannot"? I found that they are friendly, accurate, quick, and offer me free accounts. I love how you can check your accounts online, transfer money, and pay bills. They even have made an application for my phone, so no matter where I am I can pay bills; therefore, not paying any late fees! Thank you PNC! I definitely recommend them.

name: Tyler Kershner
review: I recently switched from Chase bank to PNC, and the difference was immediately apparent.  Everything was made extremely easy and straight-forward for me when signing up with PNC.  The transition process could not have been easier.  Perhaps the best thing, however, has been my experience with their online service, which far surpasses Chase's.  They offer Mint.com like spending tracking, and a huge host of other features that have made the switch infinitely worth it.  I'm able to fully automate my bill-paying, send money to other people effortlessly, and keep a very close watch on my balances.  I am truly glad that I made the switch.

name: Mike
review: I chose PNC as my bank because it has locations in most towns I tend to visit. I chose their Virtual Wallet product for my banking needs. I had some understanding of Virtual Wallet based on their TV advertisements but I soon found out my understanding was lacking. Despite the fact that the virtual wallet is represented as one account on the Virtual Wallet website, it is in reality three accounts, two checking accounts and one savings account. All of this was explained before I signed up but it was still a little confusing. Once I understood how the system works I found it to work well for my needs.

name: Kumutha Lane
review: I switched over to PNC from Bank of America when they were going to charge a fee for using my debit card.  I thought it was ridiculous that I had to pay a debit card fee for using my own money! Bank of America did not go through with the plan, but I switched to PNC anyways. I am so happy that I did. I have their free checking account and I decided that because I had no need for checks since all my bills are paid online. Any questions or problems I have had ( if any) have always been solved really quick either by phone or by one of their branches. The customer service is great and I can cash any checks myself and that's a big plus for me! I think it is great that I can cash my own checks up to $500.00 per day. You get to keep the cash and they deposit any change from your check! I have never seen this available in any other bank before. I also like the fact that PNC banks exists in certain supermarkets. I am very happy with the bank.

name: Joe loguirato
review: I have been a member of PNC bank for over six years now, and the customer service at my location is always phenomenal.  Whether I need to deposit or withdraw money, change an address, get a new debit card, view my statements, or order new checks, the clerks are always very friendly and eager to assist me.  They always greet me upon entering, and smile constantly.  The online banking feature that they offer is also a plus.  In truth, I haven't dealt with any other bank, but my overall experience with PNC has been fulfilling enough that I don't have to.

name: Savannah Williams
review: I have been a member of PNC for about 5 months.  My local branch has amazing customer service.  I am always greeted by name when I come in.  It was very easy to set up my checking and savings accounts and they answered all my questions.  The only problems I have had are with the website.  I attempted to transfer money from another bank to my PNC account online and it took over a week for the money to finally transfer.  I was very disappointed.  It would have been easier to just go into the bank and transfer money in person.

name: Nessa
review: BBVA Compass is a bank I use for a secondary checking account to pay for vacations and "extras." The bank has locations close to me, a friendly staff of competent employees and a simple, no hassle checking account option that I have been very happy with. Their online bill payment service is free and so is my checking account as long as I maintain the minimum balance. I've never had a problem with getting assistance with transfers or transactions, and the staff has always made sure I understand all fees and terms before I commit to anything. Overall, I would recommend BBVA Compass for its customer service and simple to use checking options.

name: Charles Dunn
review: I love PNC bank, I set up an account when I went off to college. It was my first bank account that was entirely mine. It was easy to set up and no problems getting a debit card for it. The free ATM is a nice perk and I never have trouble finding one when I need it. The Virtual Wallet feature is probably the best online banking system that I have ever seen or heard of. Very simple, very clear and easy to use. I have never had a problem but I can assume that their problem resolution center is held to the same high standards that everything else in their business is.

name: Phil Cook
review: I have been a member of PNC for the last two years and it has been amazing. The best feature they have for young people and college students is the virtual wallet. It gives you three different accounts that you can easily swap money back and forth to. This has been the best way for me to save money and I use it all the time. They also have a friendly staff and I go to the same bank all the time. I have had absolutely no issues with this bank yet and I hope it stays that way. I will be a PNC member for years to come!

name: Johnboy
review: Compass bank is a 'local' bank (I think they might only do business in AZ) and sometimes gets a bad rap for slow online banking, having few locations, inconvenient hours, etc......but the customer service they provide more than makes up for it.So far they've approved me for a credit card that I, most likely, otherwise wouldn't have gotten, waived service charges for me when automated direct deposits I was receiving failed, and even 'neglected' a charge when I went into minor overdraft status.....it was only by a few cents, but many banks would have slapped some fee on that might have cost me the account. When I visit their locations the staff have always been prompt, courteous, and very helpful. This reflects my overall experiences with Compass - there are some downsides to dealing with a smaller bank but I feel the extra personal attention they give might make it worth doing business with them instead of one of their larger competitors.

name: Cari Oliver
review: We switched from another bank to BBVA.  We've been very happy with their service and their access.  The bank charges are nominal, and they have a lot of branches, which keeps ATM fees low, if not nonexistent.  When I got my debit card, I immediately memorized my PIN, shredded my PIN letter, and then forgot my PIN.  It was so easy to reset it!  Also, my son is now working, and we wanted to set him up with a checking account, but we wanted some oversight.  They have a children's account that works great for this.  Honestly, we've been very happy, as banks go, they are actually really good!

name: Mikel
review: PNC Bank is an excellent bank and I would recommend this bank to anyone. PNC stands out from other banks because they're truly a community bank. PNC offers an abundance of services from a virtual wallet, overseas debit protection as well as points exclusively for PNC customers. I've used all three of these services as well as their other numerous services. I love shopping so the PNC points which are equivalent to cash back/reward programs that some credit cards offer, are a great incentive for shopaholics. The Virtual Wallet is probably my favorite tool that PNC offers. I travel a lot and this wonderful app which I downloaded via my IPhone shows me ATM locations (which are a life saver! Trust me, those ATM fees add up.), free overdraft protection, non-PNC transactions are covered for free as well as other perks. A Virtual Wallet is a really a variety of options all rolled up in one which offers banking at the click of your finger on your smart phone. I'm quite fond of the customer service that PNC offers because each banking specialist is truly involved with customers on a one to one basis. The staff at PNC makes sure that they're aware of the client that they're talking with weather you're making a deposit or interested in a loan. I also like that they're never pushy at least in my experience. If you're a student PNC is a great first bank because of the excellent programs and leniency that they offer students. Sometimes they even offer up to a one hundred dollar bonus for opening up an account with PNC. Free money is always good. I didn't get any rewards for opening up an account initially but I did get the chance to sign on with an awesome bank. There are plenty of different checking accounts to choose from. The PNC website is very simple and will help you direct which checking/savings option best suits your needs.For me one of the other things that I love about PNC besides the Virtual Wallet is the investment and wealth management option. This program has allowed me to set up a retirement fund and make very small investments on Wall Street. I've become so much more aware of finances and the stock markets, which surprisingly I've come to enjoy. PNC really is in a league of its own when it comes to personal banking.

name: James
review: BBVA Compass is a great place to bank for the most part. However, recently, they've started charging fees for having a checking account. As a long term customer, this seriously annoys me. Also, when I deposit large checks, Compass has a tendency to put a hold on them without any notification, occasionally causing me to overdraft my account, which everyone knows is a HUGE headache. Apart from these minor inconveniences, Compass is a pretty decent place to bank, and so far, seems to be better than alternatives. One really nice benefit Compass offers is the ability to choose your own design for their debit cards.

name: Allison Martini
review: Every time I go into a PNC the employees are so helpful. I always get my questions answered quickly and fully. In the case where they canât help me (like exchanging my Euro coins), they referred me to someone who could. I do all of my banking through PNC. I have checking and savings accounts, as well as student loans. I enjoy that they have different options for what type of account I want so I can pick the right one for me. I really like the Virtual Wallet for my checking account. It makes it easy to keep track of my funds. I don't think I've ever had a bad experience with them.

name: Joshua Palan
review: This bank has always been number 1 in my book. While at first I didn't get my debt card and I had to ask them to send a new one to my local bank I have had nothing but positive experiences with PNC. The Virtual Wallet account is very simple and the iphone and andriod app works like a charm. Every time I have gone in with a question or a problem the staff were super friendly and able to solve any issue extremely quickly.I would highly suggest this bank to just about anyone who is looking to open up a new checking and/or savings account.

name: Jeannine Martin
review: We’ve been customers with PNC Bank for over 10 years now and have been extremely happy them.  I wouldn’t say that they are absolutely perfect, but I do believe that they do put their customers' interests first above the mighty dollar.  During the time that we had accounts with PNC we also had another account open with a nationally known competitor.  Through my experience with this other bank I came to realize how good I had it with PNC and purposed in my mind that I would never switch.  One of the features that we use the most through PNC is their online banking.  It is really quite cutting edge and they are continually updating and adding features to their site to stay competitive.  They also allow customers to set up alerts through text messaging, and additionally allow customers to check their account balances through text messaging.  This feature has been indispensible for us.

name: Robert
review: I have been a member of PNC Bank since they were known a Capital City, and I have to say the service and quality of the bank as a whole has improved greatly. It's amazing how simply a name change can alter the quality of a bank, since then my account style has improved, spending and saving incentives have become exponentially better, and the customer service is terrific. I highly recommend their Virtual Wallet, which is geared towards younger customers but comes with a very clear and easy to use online system. I would recommend PNC to anyone looking to join or switch banks.

name: Andrew Bryant
review: I frequent the PNC in State College, PA for my money needs. Never have I had such quality customer service anywhere else, not just in a bank. The tellers are extremely friendly and even address you by name after you've been there awhile. They've been extremely helpful in resolving a few problems I've had and very timely in doing so as well. My favorite part about this branch is how the non-teller office workers ask if they can help you when the teller lines are too long. Even if you are just getting a deposit, they bring you into their office and offer to deposit it for you. Definitely a recommended banking institution.

name: Ashley
review: I switched over to PNC a little over a year ago. I had a credit union where I had so many problems with my money that I was miserable. I was skeptical about using another bank after having so many problems with my first bank account but after a few good recommendations I switched over to PNC.  Though the sign up process took a while, the employees were all very nice and kept the conversation light and comfortable. They explained all the differences between a regular checking account and a Virtual Wallet account to help me  choose which one would be more beneficial to me. I went with the Virtual Wallet account and they showed me the basics off their online site and how to use it. It was helpful because the site could get a little confusing on it's own. I've only had one problem with them in the year I've had them and they fixed it as soon as I noticed it. They apologized profusely over the simple $2 they were supposed to reimburse me but forgot to. A major thing I like is that they have their own coin counting machines. I am one of those "penny pinchers" who will collect every nickle, dime, and penny I find in the couch and put into a jar. When I get a full jar, I take it to the bank and the machine counts it for me. I can then either deposit it in my account or withdraw it as cash. It's free for customers which is way better than Coinstar's high fees. In the past 6 months, I've had about a hundred dollars in just collecting my change. The bankers are almost always polite and smiling though on the rare occasion you will run into the one who is having a bad day. All in all, I love having PNC as my bank.

name: Juli Audet
review: I recently changed my bank and joined PNC because I was dissatisfied with my old bank's online banking service.  I have to say that after years of using online banking at different banks, practically since it first became available, I did not think I could be impressed.  But, boy was I wrong!  The PNC Virtual Wallet is a completely unique approach to online banking!  I love the calender set up and at a glace options for month, day or year.  And I have never had a service outage or been unable to access my account...no matter what time of day or night. So glad I switched!

name: Erin F
review: I have been a PNC customer ever since they switched over from National City Bank. At first, it took me a while to get used to the changes, because I had been completely familiar with my National City online account. However, now that I have adjusted to the changes, I really like using PNC. Since it is a big, well-known bank, I can have all my accounts in one place and access them easily online. In addition to a savings and checking account, I was ecstatic to find out that I could refinance my mortgage.
