I ended up cutting off 8 years of payments by switching, so I was very happy about getting that lower interest rate by switching to a PNC account. The reason Iâm rating them so high is not because of the lower rate however, it is just the convenience of having all my accounts easily accessible in one place.

name: Adam Green
review: I have been banking with PNC for about 15 years.  Since I opened my first checking account as a college student I have opened personal savings accounts as well as several business accounts, which consisted of both loans and checking accounts.  The service has always been top notch, any problems I have are resolved extremely quickly with the help of their business bankers.  The rates and fees have always been competitive.  They have convenient ATM and branch locations.  Whatâs best of all is that they are one of the strongest banks financially, not requiring any stimulus funds when many of the other big banks did.  They did not take on any toxic mortgages and continue to expand by acquiring smaller regional banks.

name: Shana
review: When our mortgage was sold to PNC, my husband and I were worried the customer service would worsen as well.  We have been very happy with the overall results we receive when we have questions.  We like having online baking options when it comes to paying our mortgage online.  We can retrieve many of our mortgage documents at any time which makes the process easier.  Although the wait times for speaking with a customer service representative are typically long, we always get professional and friendly service.

name: Eric Baker
review: PNC is a great bank overall, however, they do have a few minor issues when it comes to customer service.  There are a lot of small fees they don't make very clear when you first sign up to bank with them.  I got charged 2.50 every time I would check my balance at an ATM that wasn't theirs.  I couldn't find anywhere in the paperwork they gave me when I signed up to validate the charges.  Customer service is pretty good about straightening those mistakes up though they only allow  you 3 fee reversals each month.I love the online banking service they offer.  When you sign up for the free checking account you get a checking, reserve, and savings account, all-in-one.  You can easily transfer money between the 3 online.As far as checking accounts go, I have had the best experience with PNC.  Overall, the customer service is good and you get a lot of perks with the online banking application.  I would recommend this bank, just remember to read the fine print.

name: Gloria B
review: I've had several accounts through PNC, as does my husband, and we've both had very positive experiences with the bank. Whenever an issue has popped up, customer service has been relatively timely in getting back to us, and has always addressed the problem completely. We were disappointed each time that the PNC Points program was scaled back, because we benefited from it and liked the rewards, but it is rather understandable with the current economy. I love all of the features on the PNC website - their online banking is very easy to use and comes in very handy. Also, my local branch office regularly has community events, free coffee, etc. that set them apart from other banks in the area.

name: Robert Brasher
review: My wife and I have been customers with PNC bank for approximately two years. I have to say that every time we have had reason to call on PNC for help with our account, they have gone above and beyond the norm for us. Martin, the branch manager where we opened the account, is a top notch employee. He and his staff take the time to fully explain any information that might be confusing. We have also had a couple of issues with our account, both from human error, and the employees have handled them promptly, professionally and effortlessly. They have made my view of the banking process turn around. Our previous bank left us wanting as far as any kind of positive experience. I would highly recommend this bank for anyone who likes a fair and courteous bank that is interested in more than your money.

name: Rob
review: I have been a member of PNC bank since I was 16 years old...11 years now.  I can honestly say that I have had very little problems when it comes to my checking account.  I use it on a daily basis for a number of reason.  I have direct deposit from my work to my checking account, I use it to pay all my bills on line and I withdraw and deposit into it often.  Customer support is always available and they are helpful with whatever questions I have.  I get monthly statements (which I elect to do electronically).  I would highly recommend this bank for anyone in need of a checking account!

name: Ej bell
review: I love PNC Bank. They gave me a chance when nobody else would give me a chance because I had made mistakes in my past. I recommend everybody I run into to go to PNC Bank and open an account. I have nothing but good stuff to say about PNC. I hope PNC bank stays PNC bank forever and never changes because I want a lifetime relationship with them!

name: Angel
review: I opened my account at BBVA Compass about three months ago. The application process was easy compared to my previous bank and I was able to complete it online then just go into a location and make the initial deposit. The customer service was excellent. I honestly expected to be treated a little worse than someone with better credit and less student loans but I was treated and helped equally. Compass has a great program you can enroll in that offers life and accident insurance for a low fee every month and it also includes a lot of discounts on rental cars and other things. I really love their new ATM system that allows you to make cash deposits through the ATM at anytime. I really love this bank and do not plan on ever switching!

name: Kevin
review: I've been a long time customer of PNC Bank and have had a great experience so far with my primary checking account.  Customer service and the online account management features are outstanding.  I especially enjoy the online bill pay and the optional security alert features offered.I was able to quickly resolve problems with my account the one or two times that I experienced an overdraft.  There is overdraft protection offered which is also a great help to anyone who would like that type of protection for their checking account.  Online banking management allows me to easily view past and present transactions.  The only thing I would change is the automated phone system when calling in to check transactions.  The process seems to take forever and isn't very efficient in my opinion.  Other than that, I'm pleased with over service from PNC.

name: sujatha swaminathan
review: I have had nothing but great experiences with PNC bank. I had gone through two banks in a five years span before finding PNC.And I  must say PNC has the best customer service, easy to use, doesn't have a lot of fees and my account hasn't been flagged, overdrawn through no fault of my own or any other mix-ups I had with other huge banks. I recently moved to Erie, Pennsylvania and I have opened this new checking account with PNC and I'm absolutely happy about the customer support and the process.

name: Rev Wilson
review: I opened an account at Compass about 10 years ago. I can definitely say that things have changed alot. I would have rated it five stars when I started banking there. And I will say that I've never had an error occur in my transactions. That's crucial. But the bank I belong to used to be full of super friendly, customer oriented people. They would remember who I was and always be respectful and kind. Then some of there policies changed. I believe it was because they were bought out by a Spanish Banking Company. The first change I noticed was requiring me to take checks that I was depositing from a trading account into the bank to deposit them instead of using the drive thru. Not so convenient. And I wasn't even getting money (cash) back. I was simply trying to deposit an amount over their 500 dollar limit. I finally got a manager to sign off on being able to deposit these checks through the drive thru. But believe me when I say, she acted like she was doing me a favor. They also started charging for some services, that used to be free, like notarizing documents, and using my debit card at different cash machines. So I guess, I would rate them a solid three stars now. I long for the day when this bank wasn't part of a huge complex of foreign banks. But just a small local down home kind of a bank. Maybe I can find a review on here that will lead me to that kind of a banking experience. You know in your heart what five star service is like. And Compass Bank just isn't it anymore. I wish it was. Sigh.

name: Alanna
review: I opened an account with PNC Bank after closing my account with Chase around this time last year. Chase began charging monthly fees and PNC was the only bank in town that still offered free checking accounts. I have had no problems with them so far. The bank tellers have provided great service every time I've had to stop inside. I would definitely recommend them to a friend or family member!

name: Joe Weider
review: Trying to decide whether the BBVA Compass ClearPoints Credit Card is right for you? Well, the only compass that will truly point you in the right direction is an evaluation of the cards terms in light of what the competition has to offer. So, I guess I’ll play compass for a minute. Starting with rewards, the BBVA Compass ClearPoints Credit Card gives you 1 point for every $1 you spend. Unfortunately, this is basically the bare minimum a rewards card can offer, so the ole compass is pointing away from the BBVA Compass ClearPoints Card right about now. You can’t always get an accurate reading at first glance though, so why don’t we see what kind of interest rates it has to offer. Well, it does offer 0% on purchases for six months, which is on the low end of the 0% spectrum but is still better than all those cards out there that do not offer a low intro rate. The BBVA Clear Points Card also advertises an introductory balance transfer interest rate of 0% - 3.99% for 12 months. Aside from the fact that only the people with the best possible credit are likely to get the 0% rate, the card also has a 4% balance transfer fee. Overall, the BBVA Compass Card’s balance transfer offer is therefore not very attractive because there are cards out there that offer guaranteed 0% intro rates for longer and do not charge a balance transfer fee.So, that brings us to your alternatives since the BBVA Compass ClearPoints Credit Card would clearly just lead you astray. As far as rewards are concerned, my favorite cards are the Chase Sapphire Preferred (excellent initial bonus), the Cap One Venture Card (travel oriented 2% cash back card), and the Blue Cash Everyday from Amex (great rewards on everyday expenses). In terms of cards with the best rates, the No Balance Transfer Slate Card from American Express is the way to go since it offers 0% on purchases and transfers for 15 months and does not charge you a fee for transferring a balance. Oh, and you’ll be able to get any of these cards with the excellent credit required for approval for the ClearPoints Compass Credit Card.
